Encore is primarily used for offensive engage and crowd control, capable of locking down multiple enemies and allies caught in its extended range.
abilities.original_description:
Seraphine deals damage and charms enemies hit, refreshing the range with every allied or enemy champion hit. Seraphine takes the stage, projecting a captivating force that Charms for {{ rchannelduration }} seconds and deals {{ r1totaldamage }} magic damage.

Any champions struck (including allies) become part of the performance, extending the range of this Ability. Allied champions gain maximum Notes.

abilities.name: Double Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Double Strike is a passive ability that automatically triggers on Master Yi's basic attacks. After landing a few consecutive auto-attacks, Master Yi's next basic attack will strike twice, dealing bonus physical damage. This offers an offensive boost by increasing his damage output and potential for burst.
abilities.original_description: Every few consecutive basic attack, Master Yi strikes twice.

abilities.name: Meditate
abilities.mechanics_description: **Meditate (W):** This is a **channeling** ability that Master Yi uses on himself. It is used **defensively** to heal and significantly reduce incoming damage. While channeling, Master Yi also gains stacks of his passive and prolongs the duration of his E and R.
abilities.original_description:
Master Yi rejuvenates his body by focus of mind, restoring Health and taking reduced damage for a short time. In addition, Master Yi will gain stacks of Double Strike and pause the remaining duration on Wuju Style and Highlander for each second he channels. Master Yi channels, restoring {{ totalheal }} Health over {{ healduration }} seconds. This healing is increased by up to {{ maxmissinghealthpercent*100 }}% based on Master Yi's missing Health.

While channeling and for {{ drlinger }} seconds afterwards, he takes {{ initialdr }} reduced damage, decreased to {{ damagereduction*100 }}% after the first {{ initialextradrduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Wuju Style
abilities.mechanics_description: Master Yi's Wuju Style (E) is a **toggle ability** that, when activated, imbues his basic attacks with bonus **true damage** for a set duration. It is used **offensively** to significantly increase his overall damage output, particularly against targets with high armor or magic resist.
abilities.original_description: Grants bonus true damage on basic attacks. Master Yi's Attacks deal an additional <trueDamage>{{ totaldamage }} true damage</trueDamage> for {{ duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Alpha Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: **Alpha Strike (Q):** A point-and-click ability that allows Master Yi to instantly teleport, becoming untargetable and striking up to a set number of nearby enemies (or repeatedly striking a single target). It's primarily used offensively for damage and trading, with its cooldown significantly reduced by basic attacks and its untargetability offering a brief defensive window.
abilities.original_description:
Master Yi teleports across the battlefield with blinding speed, dealing physical damage to multiple units in his path, while simultaneously becoming untargetable. Alpha Strike can critically strike and deals bonus physical damage to monsters. Basic attacks reduce Alpha Strike's cooldown. Master Yi becomes Untargetable and teleports to rapidly strike enemies near his target, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to all enemies hit after {{ alphastrikebounces }} hits.

This Ability can strike the same enemy repeatedly if there are no other targets, dealing {{ subsequenthitmultiplier*100 }}% damage for subsequent hits ({{ subesquentdamage }}), for a maximum single target total of {{ singletotaldamage }} physical damage.

abilities.name: Highlander
abilities.mechanics_description: **Highlander (R)** is a **buff** that Master Yi **toggles** on. Upon activation, it grants him significantly increased movement and attack speed, as well as immunity to slows. Kills and assists during Highlander's duration extend its remaining time.
abilities.original_description:
Master Yi moves with unparalleled agility, temporarily increasing his Move Speed and Attack Speed as well as making him immune to all slowing effects. While active, Champion kills or assists extend Highlander's duration. Passively reduces cooldown for his other abilities on a kill or assist. Passive: Champion takedowns reduce the remaining Cooldown of Master Yi's basic Abilities by {{ rcooldownrefund*100 }}%.

Active: Master Yi enters a trance, gaining {{ rmsbonus }}% Move Speed, {{ rasbonus }}% Attack Speed, and immunity to Slows for {{ rduration }} seconds. Champion takedowns extend the duration of this Ability by {{ rkillassistextension }} seconds.

abilities.name: Searing Brilliance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Searing Brilliance (Passive):** Mel's next attack after using an ability launches bonus projectiles, increasing her damage output. Dealing ability or auto-attack damage applies stacking "Overwhelm" debuffs, which will execute targets below a certain health threshold.
abilities.original_description:
Whenever Mel uses an ability, she gains three bonus projectiles (up to nine maximum) on her next attack.

When Mel deals damage through an ability or attack, she applies Overwhelm, which can stack infinitely. If the enemy is hit by Mel with enough Overwhelm damage, the stacks are consumed to execute the target.

abilities.name: Radiant Volley
abilities.mechanics_description: **Radiant Volley** is a **circular skillshot** that Mel uses offensively. Upon hitting a target location, it unleashes a burst of projectiles that repeatedly deal magic damage to all enemies within the expanding area, offering a significant damage and burst potential.
abilities.original_description:
Mel fires a barrage of projectiles that explode around a target location, dealing damage repeatedly to enemies within the area. Mel unleashes a barrage of {{ explosioncount }} projectiles that explode in the area around a target location.

Each explosion deals {{ totalexplosiondamage }} magic damage, adding up to {{ alldamagehit }} magic damage total.

abilities.name: Solar Snare
abilities.mechanics_description: **Solar Snare (E)** is a linear skillshot that fires a radiant orb. Enemies hit at the **center** of the orb are rooted, while those caught in the **area around it** are slowed and take damage over time. This ability is primarily used for crowd control and setting up follow-up damage or escapes.
abilities.original_description:
Mel fires a radiant orb forward, rooting those at its center while the area around it slows enemies and deals damage over time. Mel fires a radiating orb, Rooting enemies at its center for {{ rootduration }} seconds and dealing {{ damage }} magic damage.

The orb builds up a hostile area around it that Slows enemies by {{ areaslowamount*100 }}% and deals {{ areadamagepersecond }} magic damage per second.

abilities.name: Golden Eclipse
abilities.mechanics_description: **Golden Eclipse (R)** is an auto-targeting ability that Mel can only cast when at least one enemy champion is marked with her passive, "Overwhelm." It deals significant magic damage to all marked enemies, with the damage scaling based on the number of Overwhelm stacks they have, making it a potent offensive finisher.
abilities.original_description:
Mel strikes all enemies marked with Overwhelm regardless of their distance from her, dealing additional damage for each stack of Overwhelm.

Ranks of Golden Eclipse increase Overwhelm's damage. Passive: Overwhelm damage is increased to {{ passiveflatdamage }} magic damage plus {{ passivestackdamage }} magic damage per stack.

Active: Mel unleashes her power on all enemies affected by Overwhelm, dealing {{ ultflatdamage }} magic damage plus {{ ultstackdamage }} magic damage per Overwhelm stack.

Can only be cast when an enemy champion is affected by Overwhelm.

abilities.name: Rebuttal
abilities.mechanics_description:
Mel forms a circular, stationary barrier around herself. This ability is a **point-and-click** style cast that creates an **auto-targeting** defensive zone. While active, it reflects enemy projectiles back for magic damage, prevents Mel from taking damage from those projectiles, and grants her decaying movement speed.

**Usage:** Rebuttal is primarily a **defensive** and **utility** tool, used to block incoming damage and crowd control from projectiles. It can also be used offensively by reflecting damage back at attackers, especially in chokepoints or when Mel is focused.
abilities.original_description:
Mel forms a barrier around herself that reflects enemy projectiles back at the attacker, prevents her from taking damage, and grants her movement speed. Mel forms a barrier around herself that reflects projectiles from enemy champions, prevents her from taking damage, and gives her {{ movespeed*100 }}% decaying Move Speed for {{ duration }} second(s).

Reflected projectiles deal {{ damagepercent }} original damage as magic damage.

abilities.name: New Destiny
abilities.mechanics_description: **New Destiny (Passive):** Graves' auto attacks fire a cone of 4 bullets that deal reduced damage to subsequent targets; hitting multiple non-champion enemies with a single attack knocks them back. This passive enhances both his offensive burst potential by landing multiple bullets on a single target and his defensive/utility by creating space with the unique knockback.
abilities.original_description: Graves' shotgun has some unique properties. He must reload when he runs out of ammo. Attacks fire 4 bullets, which cannot pass through units. Non-champions struck by multiple bullets are knocked back.

abilities.name: Smoke Screen
abilities.mechanics_description: **Smoke Screen (W)** is a circular skillshot that Graves fires to a target location. It deals immediate magic damage and applies a brief slow to enemies hit by the initial impact, while the resulting smoke cloud obscure vision for those inside and outside the area, making it a powerful tool for both engaging and disengaging.
abilities.original_description: Graves fires a smoke canister at the target area creating a cloud of smoke that reduces sight range. Enemies caught in the initial impact are dealt magic damage and have their Move Speed reduced briefly. Graves creates a cloud of black smoke for 4 seconds, <status>Slowing</status> enemies inside by {{ e2 }}% and blocking their vision outside the area. The initial impact deals <magicDamage>{{ impactdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Quickdraw
abilities.mechanics_description: **Quickdraw (E)** is a **skillshot dash** that Graves uses to reposition himself. It offensively provides burst potential by reloading a shell and defensively offers a stacking armor buff that refreshes on hit, allowing Graves to quickly build resistances and survive sustained fights.
abilities.original_description:
Graves dashes forward gaining an Armor boost for several seconds. If Graves dashes towards an enemy champion, gain two stacks of True Grit instead. Hitting enemies with basic attacks lowers the cooldown of this skill and refreshes the resistance boost. Graves dashes and reloads one Shell into his shotgun. He also gains a stack for 4 seconds (max {{ e0 }} stacks) or two stacks if he dashes towards an enemy champion. Stacks grant him {{ e5 }} Armor. Stacks are refreshed when damaging a non-minion.

Each bullet hit from Graves' Attacks reduces this Ability's Cooldown by {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: End of the Line
abilities.mechanics_description:
**End of the Line (Q) - Graves**

**1. How to hit/use:** This is a linear skillshot that's affected by terrain. Graves fires a projectile that will travel in a straight line until it hits an enemy champion, monster, or minion, or until it hits terrain. If it hits terrain, it detonates instantly. If it doesn't hit terrain, it detonates after a 1-second delay.

**2. How it is used:** Primarily offensive, dealing burst physical damage. It's used to poke, trade, and secure kills. The detonation mechanic, especially off terrain, allows Graves to hit multiple targets or apply double damage to a single target if positioned correctly.
abilities.original_description: Graves fires an explosive shell that detonates after 1 second, or after colliding with terrain. Graves fires a powder round dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. After 1 second or after colliding with terrain, it detonates, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldetonationdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> along the travel path again and to enemies near the blast.

abilities.name: Collateral Damage
abilities.mechanics_description: Graves' ultimate, Collateral Damage, is a **linear skillshot** that deals high physical damage to the first enemy champion hit. Upon hitting a target or reaching its maximum range, the shell **explodes in a cone**, dealing reduced damage to enemies within that area. This ability is primarily used **offensively for burst damage** and can also be utilized to **escape by "rocket jumping"** Graves backwards.
abilities.original_description: Graves fires an explosive shell dealing heavy damage to the first champion it hits. After hitting a champion or reaching the end of its range, the shell explodes dealing damage in a cone. Graves fires an explosive cartridge, blasting himself backwards. The cartridge deals <physicalDamage>{{ damage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> to the first enemy hit. After hitting an enemy champion or reaching the end of its range, the cartridge explodes outward, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ falloffdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>.

abilities.name: Steel Tempest
abilities.mechanics_description: Steel Tempest is a linear **skillshot** that functions as a **basic attack**, used offensively for **damage**. When cast twice within its duration, it transforms into a **second, longer-range projectile that applies crowd control** (a knock-up). When used during a dash, it strikes in a **circle** instead of a line.
abilities.original_description:
Thrusts forward, damaging all enemies in a line.

On hit, grants a stack of Gathering Storm for a few seconds. At 2 stacks, Steel Tempest fires a whirlwind that knocks Airborne.

Steel Tempest is treated as a basic attack and scales with all the same things. Yasuo thrusts, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. If he hits, he gains a stack for {{ gatheringstormduration }} seconds. While he has 2 stacks, his next use of this Ability fires a whirlwind from range, dealing the same damage and Knocking Up for {{ knockupdurationtooltiponly }} second.

If used while dashing, this Ability strikes in a circle rather than a stab.

abilities.name: Wind Wall
abilities.mechanics_description: Wind Wall is a **linear skillshot** that creates a stationary wall of wind for 4 seconds. It is primarily **defensive utility**, blocking all enemy projectiles that attempt to pass through it.
abilities.original_description: Creates a moving wall that blocks all enemy projectiles for 4 seconds. Yasuo creates a drifting wall of wind that blocks all enemy projectiles for 4 seconds.

abilities.name: Sweeping Blade
abilities.mechanics_description: Sweeping Blade is a targeted dash that allows Yasuo to travel through a chosen enemy champion, dealing magic damage. Multiple casts in quick succession increase its damage, and it synergizes with his Q (Steel Tempest) to create a circular AoE attack.
abilities.original_description:
Dashes through target enemy, dealing magic damage. Each cast increases subsequent dash's damage, up to a max amount.

Cannot be re-cast on the same enemy for a few seconds.

If Steel Tempest is cast while dashing, it will strike as a circle. Yasuo dashes through a target, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. Each use of this Ability grants {{ bonusdamageperstack }} bonus damage to subsequent uses for {{ stackduration }} seconds, stacking up to {{ maxstacks }} times.

This Ability has a {{ e2 }} second per-target Cooldown.

abilities.name: Way of the Wanderer
abilities.mechanics_description:
"Way of the Wanderer" is Yasuo's passive.

1.  **How to hit/use the ability:** Yasuo's critical strike chance is doubled, and he passively gains Flow (a resource) while moving. Flow is consumed to create a shield upon taking damage from a champion or monster.
2.  **How it is used:** This passive is for both offense and defense. The doubled critical strike chance enhances Yasuo's damage output, while the Flow shield provides a defensive buffer against enemy attacks.

**Concise Description:** Yasuo's passive doubles all critical strike chance and grants a rechargeable shield that absorbs damage when he has sufficient Flow, built up by moving.
abilities.original_description: Yasuo's Critical Strike Chance is increased. Additionally, Yasuo builds toward a shield whenever he is moving. The shield triggers when he takes damage from a champion or monster.

abilities.name: Last Breath
abilities.mechanics_description: Last Breath is a targeted blink that can only be cast on an enemy champion who is currently airborne. Upon activation, Yasuo deals damage to the target and knocks up any other airborne enemies in a small radius, while also granting him maximum Flow and a temporary buff to his critical strike armor penetration.
abilities.original_description:
Blinks to an Airborne enemy champion, dealing physical damage and holding all Airborne enemies in the area in the air. Grants maximum Flow but resets all stacks of Gathering Storm.

For a moderate time afterwards, Yasuo's critical strikes gain significant Bonus Armor Penetration. Yasuo teleports to an Airborne enemy champion, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage and holding all nearby Airborne enemies up for an additional {{ rknockupduration }} second. Yasuo also gains maximum Flow, but loses all Steel Tempest stacks.

Afterwards, Yasuo's critical strikes ignore {{ rpercentarmorpen }}% bonus Armor for {{ rbuffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Blade's Reach
abilities.mechanics_description: Blade's Reach is a **linear skillshot** that Kayn uses offensively to deal damage and apply a decaying slow. As the **Shadow Assassin**, Kayn gains increased range and can move while casting, while as the **Darkin Slayer**, it also knocks up enemies hit.
abilities.original_description:
Kayn damages and slows targets in a line. Kayn swipes his scythe upward, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and Slowing enemies hit by {{ e3 }}%, decaying over {{ e5 }} seconds.

Shadow Assassin: Kayn can move while using this Ability and increases its range.

Darkin Slayer: Additionally Knocks Up enemies hit for {{ e2 }} second.

abilities.name: Shadow Step
abilities.mechanics_description: **Shadow Step (E)** is a **dash-like ability** that allows Kayn to **walk through terrain** for a duration, gaining bonus movement speed and healing upon entering terrain. It's primarily used for **utility** to reposition or escape, offering significant **defensive** and **ambush potential**, especially for Shadow Assassin Kayn who gains movement speed, slow immunity, and a shorter cooldown.
abilities.original_description:
Kayn can walk through terrain. Kayn gains {{ e1 }}% Move Speed, becomes Ghosted, and can move through Terrain for {{ e2 }} seconds. When he first enters terrain, he restores {{ totalhealing }} Health.

Being Immobilized and spending more than {{ e3 }} consecutive seconds outside of Terrain ends this Ability early.

Shadow Assassin: Gain {{ e5 }}% Move Speed, Slow immunity, and reduce the Cooldown to {{ assassincdreduction }} seconds.

abilities.name: The Darkin Scythe
abilities.mechanics_description:
1.  **How to hit/use:** This is a passive ability and is not directly cast. It continuously influences Kayn's kit.
2.  **How it is used:** It provides both **offensive** and **defensive/utility** benefits depending on Kayn's form. As Darkin (Aatrox), it offers sustain through spell damage. As Shadow Assassin, it provides burst damage.

**Mechanics & Usage:** The Darkin Scythe is a stance-based passive that grants Kayn bonus effects based on which Darkin form he has achieved: the Darkin form heals him based on spell damage dealt to champions, while the Shadow Assassin form grants bonus damage on the first few seconds of combat with enemy champions.
abilities.original_description:
Kayn wields an ancient weapon and fights Rhaast, the darkin within it, for control. Either the Darkin will triumph, or Kayn will master Rhaast and become the Shadow Assassin.

Darkin: Heal for a percentage of spell damage dealt to champions.

Shadow Assassin: For the first few seconds in combat with enemy champions, deal bonus damage.

abilities.name: Reaping Slash
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Reaping Slash (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that Kayn uses offensively. He dashes a short distance, dealing physical damage to all enemies passed through with his scythe. Upon completing the dash, he then **deals the damage again** in a small area around his final position. This ability is used for **burst damage** and to **clear waves**.

**Darkin Slayer (Rhaast form) bonus:** The second instance of damage is significantly increased, dealing a percentage of the enemy's maximum health as physical damage, making it a potent tool for dueling and executing high-health targets.
abilities.original_description:
Kayn dashes, then slashes. Both deal damage. Kayn dashes then spins his scythe, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to enemies he passes through, then deals the damage again to nearby enemies.

Darkin Slayer: Instead deal {{ darkinflatdamage }} plus {{ darkinpercentdamage }} max Health physical damage.

abilities.name: Umbral Trespass
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Umbral Trespass (R) is a dash that allows Kayn to become untargetable by infesting a marked enemy champion.**

*   **How to hit/use:** This ability is a dash that **auto-targets** a single marked enemy champion.
*   **How it is used:** Umbral Trespass is used both **offensively** and **defensively**. It deals significant physical damage upon exiting the enemy, with Shadow Assassin Kayn gaining increased range and a cooldown reset on his other ability, while Darkin Slayer Kayn deals damage based on the target's maximum health and heals himself. While inside the enemy, Kayn is **untargetable**, providing a potent defensive tool to dodge incoming damage or follow-up abilities.
abilities.original_description:
Kayn hides in an enemy's body, dealing massive damage when he bursts out. Passive: Champions damaged by Kayn are marked for 3.15 seconds.

Kayn infests a marked enemy, becoming Untargetable. After {{ infestduration }} seconds or after Recasting, Kayn bursts out, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage to the enemy.

Shadow Assassin: Increases this Ability's range, the distance Kayn exits, and refreshes The Darkin Scythe's Cooldown on exit.

Darkin Slayer: Instead deals {{ slayerdamage }} max Health physical damage and restores {{ healvalue }} Health ({{ slayerhealpercent*100 }}% damage amount).

abilities.name: Five Point Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Five Point Strike is a linear skillshot that Akali throws a fan of five kunai in an arc. It's primarily used offensively to deal damage and slow, and can be a key part of her burst combo.
abilities.original_description: Akali throws out five kunai, dealing damage based on her bonus Attack Damage and Ability Power and slowing. Akali slings kunai in an arc, dealing <magicDamage>{{ damage }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> enemies at the tip by {{ slowpercentage*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Assassin's Mark
abilities.mechanics_description: Assassin's Mark is an auto-target passive ability that applies a mark to champions when Akali deals spell damage to them. Exiting the marked range empowers Akali's next basic attack with bonus magic damage and increased range, primarily used offensively to extend her burst combo and secure kills.
abilities.original_description: Dealing spell damage to a champion creates a ring of energy around them. Exiting that ring empowers Akali's next Attack with bonus range and damage.

abilities.name: Twilight Shroud
abilities.mechanics_description: **Twilight Shroud (W)** is a circular area of effect ability that Akali lays down. Its primary use is defensive utility, granting Akali invisibility and making her untargetable by enemy auto-attacks and most abilities while within the shroud. While invisible, she can move freely, and attacking or using an ability will briefly reveal her.
abilities.original_description:
Akali drops a cover of smoke and briefly gains Move Speed. While inside the shroud, Akali becomes invisible and unable to be selected by enemy spells and attacks. Attacking or using abilities will briefly reveal her. Akali drops a smoke bomb, unleashing a spreading cover of smoke lasting {{ baseduration }} seconds and granting herself {{ movementspeed }}% Move Speed decaying over {{ movementspeedduration }} seconds.

Akali increases her max Energy by {{ energyrestore }} while the shroud is active.

While inside the smoke, Akali is Invisible.

abilities.name: Shuriken Flip
abilities.mechanics_description: Shuriken Flip is **cast by targeting a direction (linear skillshot)**. Akali flips backward and throws a shuriken, marking the first enemy or smoke cloud hit. Recasting the ability allows Akali to **dash to the marked target**, dealing damage on both the initial hit and the dash. This ability is primarily used **offensively for damage and gap closing**, but can also be used defensively to escape by marking a smoke cloud.
abilities.original_description: Flip backward and fire a shuriken forward, dealing magic damage. The first enemy or smoke cloud hit is marked. Re-cast to dash to the marked target, dealing additional damage. Akali flips backwards as she throws a shuriken, dealing <magicDamage>{{ e1damage }} magic damage</magicDamage> and marking the first enemy or smoke cloud hit. Akali can <recast>Recast</recast> this once to dash to the marked target, dealing <magicDamage>{{ e2damagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Perfect Execution
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Perfect Execution (R)** is a **two-part dash ability**.

The first cast is a **skillshot dash** that damages enemies in its path and can be dodged. The second cast, as long as you are within range and line of sight of an enemy champion after the first cast, becomes an **auto-targeting execution dash** dealing increasing damage to enemies based on their missing health. It is primarily used offensively for burst damage and to finish off low-health targets.
abilities.original_description:
Akali leaps in a direction, damaging enemies she strikes. Re-cast: Akali dashes in a direction, executing all enemies she strikes. Akali vaults over an enemy champion, dealing {{ cast1damage }} magic damage to all enemies in her path.

Akali can Recast after {{ cooldownbetweencasts }} seconds to execute a piercing thrust, dashing and dealing {{ cast2damagemin }} to {{ cast2damagemax }} magic damage based on missing Health.

abilities.name: Blooming Burst
abilities.mechanics_description: **Blooming Burst (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage. Upon hitting a champion, large monster, or killing a unit, it **re-blooms twice**, dealing bonus magic damage in an area. This ability is primarily used **offensively for burst damage and wave clear**.
abilities.original_description: Neeko throws a seed dealing magic damage. The seed blooms again on hitting champions or killing units. Neeko throws a seed that blooms to deal <magicDamage>{{ explosiondamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. If it kills a unit or hits a champion or large monster, it will bloom again, dealing <magicDamage>{{ seconddamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Max 2 extra blooms.

abilities.name: Tangle-Barbs
abilities.mechanics_description: Tangle-Barbs is a linear skillshot that damages and roots enemies. Enemies hit by the tangle empower it, making it larger, faster, and increasing the root duration. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and crowd control.
abilities.original_description:
Neeko slings a tangle that damages and roots everything it passes through. If the tangle kills an enemy or passes through a champion, it becomes larger, faster, and roots for longer. Neeko slings a tangle that deals {{ basedamage }} magic damage and Roots for {{ minrootduration }} seconds.

The tangle becomes empowered after hitting an enemy, growing larger, moving faster, and Rooting for {{ maxrootduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Shapesplitter
abilities.mechanics_description: Shapesplitter (W) is a **skillshot** where Neeko becomes invisible and creates a short-lived clone that travels in a chosen direction. Neeko can **recast** the ability during the clone's duration to instantly switch its movement direction, allowing for deceptive plays to escape or bait enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Neeko passively deals bonus magic damage every third attack, briefly increasing her move speed. Neeko can activate to send a clone in a direction and recast to change the direction of the clone. Passive: Every 3rd Attack deals an additional {{ passivebonusdamagecalc }} bonus magic damage and increases Neeko's Move Speed by {{ passivehaste }}% for {{ passivehasteduration }} second.

Active: Neeko becomes invisible for {{ stealthduration }} seconds and projects a clone that lasts {{ cloneduration }} seconds. Neeko and the clone gain {{ haste }}% Move Speed for {{ hasteduration }} seconds.

The clone can be controlled using the Move Pet Click hotkey or by Recasting this Ability.
The clone mirrors her spellcasts, emotes, and recall.

abilities.name: Inherent Glamour
abilities.mechanics_description: Neeko's passive, **Inherent Glamour**, allows her to transform into an allied champion by activating the ability and selecting one of her nearby allies. This disguise breaks when she takes damage equal to her disguise's health, casts a damaging spell, damages an enemy tower as a non-champion, or is affected by immobilizing crowd control, offering powerful deception for assassination, baiting, or escape.
abilities.original_description: Neeko can look like an ally champion or as other units on the map. Receiving immobilizing crowd control, casting damaging spells, damaging enemy towers as a non-champion, or your disguise taking damage equal to its healthbar breaks the disguise.

abilities.name: Pop Blossom
abilities.mechanics_description: **Pop Blossom (R)** is a circular AoE skillshot that Neeko can hold to charge. She can use it offensively for burst damage and crowd control (knock-up, damage, and stun). If Neeko is disguised, the charge-up animation is hidden, allowing for deceptive usage.
abilities.original_description:
After a short preparation, Neeko leaps into the air, knocking up all nearby enemies. Upon landing, nearby enemies are damaged and stunned. The preparation is hidden if Neeko is disguised. After a delay Neeko leaps into the air, Knocking Up all nearby enemies for {{ delayuntilexplosion }} seconds. She then crashes down, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to all nearby enemies and Stunning them for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

This Ability can be prepared in secret if Neeko is disguised. {{ delaybeforepassiveremoval }} seconds after casting this ability Neeko breaks her disguise.

abilities.name: Mark of the Kindred
abilities.mechanics_description: Mark of the Kindred is Kindred's passive ability that involves **auto-targeting** specific enemy champions or jungle camps designated by the game. Its primary usage is **utility** for enabling large-scale **offensive buffs** awarded for successful "hunts," which are marked targets that Kindred defeats. Completing these hunts permanently empowers Kindred's basic abilities and grants increasing basic attack range.
abilities.original_description: Kindred can mark targets to Hunt. Successfully completing a Hunt permanently empowers Kindred's basic abilities. Every 4 hunts completed also increases Kindred's basic attack range.

abilities.name: Dance of Arrows
abilities.mechanics_description: Dance of Arrows is a **dash-like skillshot with auto-targeting** that allows Kindred to **leap a short distance** and fire up to three arrows at nearby enemies. It is primarily used **offensively** for damage and a brief attack speed boost, and its cooldown is significantly reduced when Kindred is within her W, Wolf's Frenzy, enabling more frequent use for sustained damage.
abilities.original_description:
Kindred tumbles and shoots up to three arrows at nearby targets. Kindred vaults, firing an arrow at up to 3 enemies, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and gaining {{ totalqattackspeed }} Attack Speed for {{ e8 }} seconds.

While inside of Wolf's Frenzy, this Ability's Cooldown is reduced to {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Wolf's Frenzy
abilities.mechanics_description: Wolf's Frenzy is an **auto-targeted ability** that directs Wolf to attack a recently targeted enemy, dealing % current health magic damage. It is primarily used **offensively** to secure damage and execute targets, and Kindred's passive gains stacks from moving and attacking to empower subsequent auto-attacks with a **defensive heal**.
abilities.original_description:
Wolf enrages and attacks enemies around him. Lamb passively gains stacks by moving and attacking. When fully charged, Lamb's next attack restores health. Passive: Kindred gains stacks as they move and attack. At 100 stacks, Kindred's next Attack restores up to {{ attackheal }} Health based on their missing Health.

Active: Kindred claims a territory, ordering Wolf to bite at the last enemy Lamb Attacked. Wolf's bites deal {{ basewolfdamage }} plus {{ percentwolfdamage }} current Health magic damage.

abilities.name: Lamb's Respite
abilities.mechanics_description: Lamb's Respite is a **circular ground target ability** that creates a zone for a set duration. **Offensively**, it prevents enemies from dying, allowing Kindred to chase them down or secure kills after the zone expires. **Defensively**, it protects allies from lethal damage, acting as a powerful anti-death ult that also provides a significant heal to everyone inside when it ends.
abilities.original_description:
Lamb grants all living things inside a zone a respite from death. Until the effect ends, nothing can die. At the end, units are healed. Kindred blesses the ground for {{ e2 }} seconds, allowing no unit, ally, enemy, or neutral to die while inside. Upon reaching 10% Health, units can't be damaged or healed while still inside the zone.

When the blessing ends, all units inside heal for {{ e1 }} Health.

abilities.name: Mounting Dread
abilities.mechanics_description: **Mounting Dread (E)** is a targeted ability that Lamb casts on an enemy champion or large monster. After casting, Kindred must land two basic attacks on the target within a short window. Upon hitting the target with a third basic attack, Wolf leaps out, dealing significant bonus physical damage based on the target's missing health, which critically strikes if the target is below a certain health threshold. This ability is used offensively for burst damage and to secure kills, with the initial slow providing utility for landing subsequent attacks.
abilities.original_description:
Lamb fires a carefully placed shot, slowing the target. If Lamb attacks the target two more times, her third attack instead directs Wolf to pounce on the enemy, savaging them for massive damage. Kindred weakens an enemy, Slowing them by {{ totalslow }}% for {{ slowduration }} second.

Kindred's third Attack against the target within {{ totalduration }} seconds of each other directs Wolf to pounce on the enemy, dealing {{ basebitedamage }} plus {{ percentbitedamage }} missing Health physical damage.

Wolf's pounce critically strikes for {{ basebitedamage }} plus {{ critdamage }} missing Health physical damage instead if they are below {{ healththreshold }} Health.

abilities.name: Avengerang
abilities.mechanics_description: Akshan throws a boomerang as a **linear skillshot** that bounces between enemies, dealing physical damage on its way out and back. Each champion hit extends the boomerang's maximum range and grants Akshan decaying movement speed, making it an **offensive** tool for poking, wave clear, and chase.
abilities.original_description:
Akshan throws a boomerang that deals damage going out and coming back, extending its range each time it hits an enemy. Akshan throws a boomerang that deals {{ finaldamage }} physical damage, extending the range each time an enemy is hit.

Champion hits grant Akshan {{ totalhaste }} Move Speed decaying over {{ hasteduration }} second.

abilities.name: Going Rogue
abilities.mechanics_description: **Going Rogue (W)** is activated as a **toggle** that makes Akshan **camouflaged** while moving towards marked Scoundrels. This offensively used ability grants bonus **movement speed and mana regeneration**, facilitating his ability to chase down and eliminate targets marked as his revenge targets.
abilities.original_description:
Akshan passively marks enemy champions as Scoundrels when they kill his ally champions. If Akshan kills a Scoundrel, he resurrects the allies they killed, gains bonus gold, and clears all marks.

When activated, Akshan enters camouflage and gains Move Speed and Mana Regen while moving towards Scoundrels. Akshan loses the camouflage quickly while he is not in brush or near terrain.

abilities.name: Heroic Swing
abilities.mechanics_description: **Heroic Swing (E)** is a **skillshot** that allows Akshan to grapple to terrain. Upon second cast, he swings around the terrain, automatically firing at the nearest enemy. This ability is primarily used for **offensive mobility and sustained damage**, allowing Akshan to reposition, chase, or escape while dealing consistent damage. Picking up a takedown resets its cooldown, encouraging aggressive, chain-engage play.
abilities.original_description:
Akshan fires a grappling hook into terrain then swings around it, repeatedly firing at the nearest enemy while swinging. He can jump off early or gets knocked off when colliding with champions or terrain. First Cast: Akshan fires a grappling hook, attaching to the first terrain hit.

Second Cast: Akshan swings around the terrain, repeatedly firing at the nearest enemy for {{ asmoddamagetodeal }} physical damage per shot.

Third Cast: Akshan dives off the rope, firing a final shot.

Colliding with an enemy Champion or terrain ends the swing early.

Champion takedowns refresh this Ability's Cooldown.

abilities.name: Dirty Fighting
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dirty Fighting (Passive) is an auto-targeting mechanic involving Akshan's basic attacks and abilities.** Every third instance of damage from Akshan against a champion grants him a shield and bonus damage, while his basic attacks also fire a bonus, weaker attack. Akshan can also cancel this bonus attack for a movement speed boost, making it a versatile tool for trading, engaging, and disengaging.
abilities.original_description:
Every three hits from Akshan's Attacks and Abilities deals bonus damage and grants him a Shield if the target was a champion.

When Akshan Attacks, he fires an additional Attack for reduced damage. If he cancels the additional Attack, he instead gains Move Speed.

abilities.name: Comeuppance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Comeuppance (R)** is a channeled skillshot that Akshan uses offensively as a potent damage finisher. He can target an enemy champion to begin channeling, storing bullets for up to 4 seconds (defaulting to 3). Upon recasting the ability, Akshan fires all stored bullets in a linear skillshot. The first enemy champion, minion, monster, or structure hit by the skillshot takes physical damage, which is significantly amplified based on the target's missing health, making it excellent for executing low-health enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Akshan locks onto an enemy champion and starts storing bullets. When released, he fires all stored bullets, dealing damage based on missing health to the first champion, minion, or structure hit. Akshan locks onto a champion and begins overcharging his gun for up to {{ channelduration }} seconds, storing up to {{ numberofbullets }} bullets.

Recast: Akshan unleashes the stored bullets, each dealing at least {{ damageperbulletwithcrit }} physical damage to the first enemy or structure hit, increased up to {{ maxdamageperbullet }} physical damage based on missing Health.

abilities.name: Cocoon / Rappel
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Human Form (E - Skillshot):** Elise fires a skillshot that stuns the first enemy hit and reveals them.
**Spider Form (E - Dash/Targeted):** Elise transforms into a spider, dashing to a target enemy and increasing her bonus damage and healing from Spider Queen for a short duration.
abilities.original_description:
Human Form: Stuns the first enemy unit hit and reveals them if they are not stealthed.

Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings ascend into the air and then descend upon target enemy. After descending on an enemy target, Elise's bonus damage and healing from Spider Queen is increased. Human Form: Elise fires a cocoon, Stunning and revealing the first enemy hit for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Neurotoxin / Venomous Bite
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Human Form (Neurotoxin):** This is a point-and-click ability that deals magic damage based on the target's current health. It is primarily used offensively to burst down enemies, especially those with high health, before they can escape or retaliate.

**Spider Form (Venomous Bite):** This is a point-and-click ability that dashes Elise a short distance to an enemy and deals magic damage based on a percentage of their missing health. It is used offensively to execute low-health targets and as a mobility tool to close gaps during engagements.
abilities.original_description:
Human Form: Deals damage based upon how high the target's Health is.

Spider Form: Lunges at an enemy and deals damage based upon how low their Health is. Human Form: Elise injects neurotoxin, dealing {{ basedamage }} plus {{ humanpercenthealth }} current Health magic damage.

abilities.name: Spider Queen
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Spider Queen (Passive)** interacts differently based on Elise's form.

*   **Human Form:** Elise's damaging abilities apply stacks of *Mark of the Spider* on hit.
*   **Spider Form:** Her basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and heal her for a percentage of her missing health, stacking with *Mark of the Spider*.

This passive encourages Elise to weave between forms, using her abilities to mark targets before switching to Spider Form for empowered auto-attacks that deal extra damage and provide sustain in combat.
abilities.original_description:
Human Form: When Elise's abilities hit an enemy, she gains a dormant Spiderling.

Spider Form: Basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and restore health to Elise.

abilities.name: Spider Form
abilities.mechanics_description: **Spider Form (R)** is a **toggle** ability that allows Elise to **transform** between her Human and Spider forms. As a toggle, it has no cast time or target. This transformation is primarily used for **trading/burst damage** due to enhanced damage from her Q and E in spider form, and for **mobility/utility** with increased movement speed.
abilities.original_description: Transforms into a menacing spider, reducing her attack range in exchange for Move Speed, new abilities, and a Spiderling swarm that will attack her foes. <keywordMajor>Human Form</keywordMajor>: Elise transforms into a menacing spider, becoming melee, gaining access to <keywordMajor>Spider Form</keywordMajor> Abilities and summons all dormant <keywordMajor>Spiderlings</keywordMajor>.

abilities.name: Volatile Spiderling / Skittering Frenzy
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Human Form (Volatile Spiderling):** This ability is cast as a **point-and-click** that summons a spiderling at your target location. The spiderling then **automatically moves towards the nearest enemy champion**. It explodes after a short duration or upon reaching an enemy, dealing magic damage.

**Spider Form (Skittering Frenzy):** This is a **toggle** ability. When activated, Elise and any active spiderlings gain increased attack speed.

**Usage Pattern:** In human form, Volatile Spiderling is primarily used for dealing **burst magic damage** from a distance, often to follow up on successful stuns. In spider form, Skittering Frenzy is a **self-buff** used to **increase all-in damage output** during trades or to quickly secure objectives, and can also empower allied spiderlings.
abilities.original_description:
Human Form: Releases a venom-gorged Spiderling that explodes when it nears a target.

Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings gain Attack Speed. Human Form: Elise summons an explosive spider that moves to a location and explodes when it nears an enemy or after 3 seconds. The spider deals {{ spell.elisehumanw:totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Petricite Burst
abilities.mechanics_description: **Petricite Burst (Passive):** Sylas's basic attacks expend a stored charge to deal bonus magic damage in an area around him. He gains attack speed while holding a charge. This passive is triggered and used via Sylas's basic attacks after casting any ability.
abilities.original_description: After casting a spell, Sylas stores a charge of Petricite Burst. Sylas's basic attacks will expend a charge and whirl his energized chains around him dealing bonus magic damage to enemies hit. While Sylas has a charge of Petricite Burst, he gains attack speed.

abilities.name: Chain Lash
abilities.mechanics_description: Chain Lash is a **two-part skillshot**. The initial lash deals damage and slows enemies hit, and a delayed explosion at the intersection point deals additional damage. This ability is primarily used for **offensive damage and crowd control**.
abilities.original_description:
Sylas lashes his chains out, intersecting at his targeted location dealing damage to and slowing enemies.

After a delay, magical energy explodes from the intersection point dealing damage. Sylas lashes his chains out, dealing {{ damage }} magic damage and Slowing by {{ slowamountcalc }} for {{ slowduration }} seconds. The place where the chains intersect explodes, dealing a further {{ explosiondamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Kingslayer
abilities.mechanics_description: **Kingslayer (W)** is a **targeted ability**. Sylas lunges at a chosen enemy, dealing magic damage and **healing himself** based on his missing health, with bonus healing against champions. This ability can be used offensively for damage and burst healing, or defensively to sustain through fights.
abilities.original_description: Sylas lunges at an enemy with magical force dealing damage and healing himself against enemy champions. Sylas lunges at an enemy with magical force dealing <magicDamage>{{ mindamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Against champions, Sylas restores between <healing>{{ minhealing }}</healing> and <healing>{{ maxhealing }} Health</healing> based on his missing Health (max healing at or below {{ maxexecutethreshold*100 }}% Health).

abilities.name: Hijack
abilities.mechanics_description: Sylas's ultimate, **Hijack**, is a **point-and-click** ability that allows him to **steal** an enemy champion's ultimate ability. He can then **cast the stolen ultimate freely**, with its effectiveness scaling off his own stats. This ability is primarily for **utility**, providing Sylas with immense flexibility and burst potential by granting access to powerful enemy ultimates, while simultaneously imposing a cooldown on the target to prevent immediate re-hijacking.
abilities.original_description:
Sylas steals the enemy's ultimate ability and can cast it freely. Sylas hijacks an enemy champion, allowing him to cast a copy of their ultimate Ability, based on his Ultimate level and using his stats.

Hijacking an enemy places a Cooldown on them for {{ pertargetcooldown }}% (modified by Sylas' Ability Haste) of the enemy's ultimate's Cooldown, with a minimum of {{ minimumenemycooldown }} seconds, during which time Sylas cannot hijack them again.

abilities.name: Abscond / Abduct
abilities.mechanics_description: Abscond/Abduct (E) is a **two-part skillshot** ability. First, Sylas **skillshots a dash** to a target location, and for a short duration, he gains the **ability to recast**. Upon recasting, he **fires his chains in a line**, and if they **hit an enemy champion**, he is **pulled to them**, dealing magic damage and applying a knock-up. Primarily used for **offensive engagement and repositioning** after a successful chain hit, it can also be used defensively to escape if the initial dash isn't blocked.
abilities.original_description:
Sylas dashes to a location. Sylas can recast the ability to throw his chains out, pulling himself to an enemy he hits. Sylas quickly dashes, and prepares a Recast for 3.5 seconds.

Recast: Sylas throws his chains, pulling himself to the first enemy hit, dealing {{ damage }} magic damage, and Knocking Up for {{ knockupduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Death Defied
abilities.mechanics_description: **Death Defied (Passive):** When Karthus dies, he enters an incorporeal state for a duration, during which he can freely cast his spells as if he were still alive. This allows Karthus to continue dealing damage and applying pressure even after being defeated.
abilities.original_description: Upon dying, Karthus enters a spirit form that allows him to continue casting spells.

abilities.name: Lay Waste
abilities.mechanics_description: Lay Waste is a **skillshot** that requires Karthus to **target a location** or enemy. It deals **magic damage** to enemies hit, with a **damage bonus against isolated targets**, making it a core **offensive** tool for Karthus's poke and damage output.
abilities.original_description: Karthus unleashes a delayed blast at a location, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Deals increased damage to isolated enemies.  Karthus creates a blast of magic, dealing <magicDamage>{{ qdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. If the blast hits only one enemy, it instead deals <magicDamage>{{ qsingletargetdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Wall of Pain
abilities.mechanics_description: Karthus's Wall of Pain is a **linear skillshot** that creates a wall of energy. Enemies passing through it are **slowed** and have their **Magic Resist reduced**, making them vulnerable to subsequent damage.
abilities.original_description: Karthus creates a passable screen of leeching energy. Any enemy units that walk through the screen have their Move Speed and Magic Resist reduced for a period. Karthus creates a wall that lasts for {{ e4 }} seconds. Enemies that pass through lose <scaleMR>{{ e1 }}% Magic Resist</scaleMR> for {{ e5 }} seconds and are <status>Slowed</status> by {{ e3 }}% decaying over the duration.

abilities.name: Defile
abilities.mechanics_description: Defile is a **toggle aura** ability. When activated, Karthus deals **magic damage per second** to all enemies within a radius around him, primarily used **offensively** to zone and constantly pressure targets. While active, it also drains Karthus's mana, making its use a careful balance between damage output and resource management.
abilities.original_description:
Karthus passively steals energy from his victims, gaining Mana on each kill. Alternatively, Karthus can surround himself in the souls of his prey, dealing damage to nearby enemies, but quickly draining his own Mana. Passive: When Karthus kills a unit, he restores {{ e2 }} Mana.

Toggle: Karthus creates a necrotic aura, dealing {{ totaldps }} magic damage per second to nearby enemies.

abilities.name: Requiem
abilities.mechanics_description: Requiem is a global, auto-targeting ultimate. After a **3-second channel**, Karthus deals magic damage to all enemy champions on the map, making it a powerful tool for finishing off low-health targets across the map or securing kills in teamfights.
abilities.original_description: After channeling for 3 seconds, Karthus deals damage to all enemy champions. Karthus channels for 3 seconds, then deals <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to enemy champions, regardless of distance.

abilities.name: Fury of the North
abilities.mechanics_description: Fury of the North is Sejuani's passive. It activates automatically out of combat, granting her bonus Armor and Magic Resist, along with immunity to slows. This defensive buff persists briefly after taking damage and allows her to shatter stunned enemies with an auto-attack for bonus magic damage.
abilities.original_description: After being out of combat, Sejuani gains Frost Armor which grants Armor and Magic Resist and immunity to slows. Frost Armor persists for a short time after Sejuani takes damage.  Sejuani can damage a stunned enemy to shatter it, dealing massive magic damage.

abilities.name: Permafrost
abilities.mechanics_description: Permafrost is a **targeted spell** that consumes 4 stacks of "Frost" on an enemy champion to deal magic damage and stun them. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for crowd control and to set up engagements, as well as **utility** by applying a stun that can interrupt or lock down key targets.
abilities.original_description:
Sejuani freezes and stuns an enemy champion that has maximum Frost stacks. Passive: Nearby melee allied champions' Attacks apply a stack to champions and jungle monsters.

Active: Sejuani deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to target enemy with 4 stacks and Stuns them for {{ e1 }} second.

abilities.name: Arctic Assault
abilities.mechanics_description: **Arctic Assault (Q)** is a **linear skillshot dash** that Sejuani uses offensively. Upon hitting an enemy champion, the dash immediately stops, dealing magic damage to all enemies passed through and **knocking them airborne** for a short duration. This ability excels at initiating fights, closing gaps, and disrupting enemy formations by displacing multiple targets.
abilities.original_description: Sejuani charges forward, knocking enemies into the air. The charge stops after hitting an enemy champion. Sejuani charges, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage</magicDamage> to enemies and <status>Knocking</status> them <status>Up</status> for {{ e4 }} seconds. The charge ends after hitting an enemy champion.

abilities.name: Winter's Wrath
abilities.mechanics_description: **Winter's Wrath (W)** is a linear skillshot where Sejuani swings her flail in two distinct arcs, striking enemies in front of her. The first swing deals damage and knocks back minions and monsters, while the second swing deals damage and slows all hit enemies. Both swings apply stacks of her passive, Permafrost, making it a key tool for engaging, applying CC, and setting up her ultimate.
abilities.original_description:
Sejuani swings her mace twice, dealing damage, slowing enemies and applying Frost stacks. Sejuani swings her flail, dealing {{ firsthitdamagetooltip }} physical damage and Knocking Back minions and jungle monsters. She then lashes out again, dealing {{ secondhitdamagetooltip }} physical damage and briefly Slowing targets.

Both swings apply stacks of Permafrost.

abilities.name: Glacial Prison
abilities.mechanics_description: Glacial Prison is a linear skillshot that, upon hitting an enemy champion, stuns them and deals magic damage. If the projectile travels a minimum distance, it also creates a large area-of-effect slow around the target, applying damage and a strong slow to all enemies within it. This ability is primarily used for engage and crowd control, allowing Sejuani to initiate fights or peel for her team.
abilities.original_description:
Sejuani throws her bola that freezes and stuns the first champion hit and creates an ice storm that slows other enemies. Sejuani throws her True Ice bola, Stunning and revealing the first enemy champion hit for {{ e2 }} second and dealing {{ minordamagetooltip }} magic damage.

If the bola travels at least 25% of its range, it Stuns and reveals for {{ e6 }} seconds instead. It then also creates an ice storm that Slows surrounding enemies by {{ e4 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds. All affected enemies take {{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Pit Grit
abilities.mechanics_description: Sett's passive, Pit Grit, isn't directly cast but modifies his basic attacks. His auto-attacks alternate between a standard left punch and a slightly faster, more damaging right punch. Additionally, he gains bonus health regeneration that scales with his missing health, providing a defensive sustain tool.
abilities.original_description: Sett's basic attacks alternate between left and right punch. Right punch is slightly stronger and faster. Sett also hates losing, gaining additional health regeneration based off of his missing health.

abilities.name: Haymaker
abilities.mechanics_description: Haymaker (W) is a **cone-shaped skillshot** that Sett uses both offensively and defensively. Upon activation, Sett gains a shield based on damage previously taken (Grit) and then unleashes a powerful punch, dealing true damage in the center of the cone and physical damage on the sides.
abilities.original_description:
Sett passively stores damage he takes as Grit. On cast, Sett expends all stored Grit to gain a shield and punch an area, dealing true damage in the center and physical damage on the sides. Passive: Sett stores {{ damagestored*100 }}% of damage taken as Grit, up to {{ maxgrit }}. Grit decays quickly {{ adrenalinestoragewindow }} seconds after the damage was taken.

Active: Sett consumes all Grit, gaining a {{ shieldconversion*100 }}% Grit consumed Shield decaying over {{ shieldmaxduration }} seconds. Sett then delivers a massive punch, dealing {{ damagecalc }} plus {{ damageconversion }} Grit consumed true damage to enemies in the center (max {{ f1 }} damage). Enemies not in the center instead take physical damage.

abilities.name: Knuckle Down
abilities.mechanics_description: **Knuckle Down (Q)** is a **buff** that Sett applies to himself, empowering his **next two basic attacks** to deal bonus **physical damage** based on a percentage of the target's **maximum health**. While active, he also gains **bonus movement speed** when moving towards enemy champions.
abilities.original_description:
Sett's next two attacks deal additional damage based off of the target's max health. Sett also gains Move Speed while moving towards enemy champions. Sett itches for a fight, gaining {{ msamount*100 }}% Move Speed towards enemy champions for {{ msduration }} seconds.

Additionally Sett's next two Attacks deal an additional {{ basedamage }} plus {{ maxhealthdamagecalc }} max Health physical damage.

abilities.name: Facebreaker
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Facebreaker (E) Description:**

Facebreaker is a **cone-shaped skillshot** that targets enemies directly in front of Sett. When activated, Sett dashes forward, pulling in any enemies caught on *both* sides of him and slamming them together, dealing damage and stunning them. If he only pulls enemies from one side, they are instead damaged and slowed.

**Usage Patterns:**

Facebreaker is a primary offensive and crowd control tool for Sett. It's used to initiate fights, chain crowd control with other abilities, and deal burst damage, particularly when the stun condition is met.
abilities.original_description: Sett pulls in all enemies on opposite sides of him, dealing damage and stunning them. If enemies were only on one side, they are slowed instead of stunned. Sett smashes enemies on either side of him into each other, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ damagecalc }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. If Sett grabbed at least one enemy on each side, all enemies are <status>Stunned</status> for {{ stunduration }} second.

abilities.name: The Show Stopper
abilities.mechanics_description:
**The Show Stopper (R)** is a target-based **skillshot** that Sett uses offensively. He **grabs a single enemy champion** with a short-range wind-up, suppressing them and carrying them forward a set distance before slamming them down. This deals **physical damage** in an area around the landing spot, with damage decreasing based on enemy distance from the epicenter, and applies a **slow** to all affected enemies.

**Mechanics & Usage:**

*   **Usage:** **Targeted skillshot** (requires an enemy champion within range). Sett initiates a short cast animation before dashing forward with the grabbed target.
*   **Offensive:** Deals significant **area damage** and applies a **crowd control slow** to multiple enemies. It's primarily used to engage, disrupt enemy positioning, and secure kills.
abilities.original_description: Sett carries an enemy champion through the air and slams them into the ground, dealing damage and slowing all enemies near where they land. Sett grabs an enemy champion and <status>Suppresses</status> them as he carries them forward, then slams them into the ground, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ damagecalc }} plus {{ maxhealthdamage*100 }}% of the grabbed enemy's bonus Health physical damage</physicalDamage> to surrounding enemies and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second. Enemies take less damage the further they are from where Sett lands.

abilities.name: Eternal Hunger
abilities.mechanics_description: Warwick's passive, Eternal Hunger, enhances his basic attacks to deal bonus magic damage. This damage offensively contributes to his combat effectiveness and defensively provides a self-heal, with the healing significantly amplified when he is at low health.
abilities.original_description: Warwick's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. If Warwick is below 50% health, he heals the same amount. If Warwick is below 25% health, this healing triples.

abilities.name: Infinite Duress
abilities.mechanics_description: **Infinite Duress (R)** is a ranged, linear **skillshot** that Warwick uses offensively. He leaps a significant distance, **suppressing** and attacking the first champion he hits, while healing based on the damage dealt.
abilities.original_description: Warwick leaps in a direction (scaling with his bonus Move Speed), suppressing the first champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds. Warwick leaps a huge distance that scales with his <speed>Move Speed</speed>, <status>Suppressing</status> the first champion he collides with while he channels for {{ rduration }} seconds. He attacks that champion 3 times over the duration, dealing <magicDamage>{{ damagecumulative }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Warwick <healing>heals for 100% of all damage dealt</healing> during the channel.

abilities.name: Jaws of the Beast
abilities.mechanics_description: Jaws of the Beast (Q) is a **dash** that can be cast as a **tap** or **hold**. Tapping Q makes Warwick dash a short distance to a target, dealing damage based on their max HP and healing him for a portion of the damage. Holding Q makes him dash to a target and latch onto them, following their movement until he releases, at which point he deals the same damage and healing. It's primarily used offensively for damage and sustain, and the hold aspect offers unique engagement and repositioning utility.
abilities.original_description:
Warwick lunges forward and bites his target, dealing damage based on their maximum health and healing for damage dealt. Tap: Warwick lunges forward and bites, dealing {{ basebitedamage }} plus {{ targetpercenthpdamage }}% max Health magic damage and healing for {{ e3 }}% of the damage dealt.

Hold: Warwick lunges and clamps his jaws on the target, leaping behind them. While clamped, Warwick follows all movement of the target. After releasing his hold, he does the same damage and healing.

abilities.name: Blood Hunt
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Blood Hunt (W):** This is a **passive** ability with an **active** component.

*   **Passive:** Warwick automatically gains bonus movement speed and attack speed when near enemies who are below 50% health, with these bonuses tripling when enemies fall below 25% health.
*   **Active:** Warwick can briefly activate Blood Hunt manually to sense all enemies. For 8 seconds, he gains the passive bonuses against the closest champion detected, regardless of their health. If no champions are nearby, the active's cooldown is reduced.

**Concise description:** Blood Hunt passively grants Warwick bonus movement speed and attack speed towards low-health enemies, tripling when they are critically wounded. Its active allows him to locate and pursue the nearest champion for a short duration, always benefiting from enhanced stats.
abilities.original_description:
Warwick senses enemies below 50% health, gaining Move Speed toward and attack speed against them. When they fall below 25% health, he frenzies and these bonuses triple. Passive: Warwick can sense champions below 50% Health, gaining {{ passivemsbonus }}% Move Speed towards them. Spells and attacks against enemies below 50% Health grant {{ passiveasbonus }}% Attack Speed. These effects are increased by 200% against enemies below 25% Health.

Active: Warwick can briefly sense all enemies, and gains this Ability's passive effect against the closest champion for 8 seconds, regardless of Health. If no champions are found, this Ability's cooldown is reduced by 30%.

abilities.name: Primal Howl
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Primal Howl (E):** A point-and-click ability that Warwick channels for up to 2.5 seconds. While channeling, he gains significant damage reduction. Upon ending the channel (either by time expiring or manual recasting), he emits a short-range AoE fear on nearby enemies.

**Mechanical Description:** Primal Howl is a channeled ability with a damage reduction buff and a fear crowd control effect. It is initiated with a single cast and can be ended early with a recast. The CC and damage reduction are centered on Warwick.

**Usage:** This ability is used both offensively and defensively. The damage reduction allows Warwick to survive burst damage or engage into unfavorable situations, while the fear provides crowd control to lock down enemies for himself or his team, or to disengage from a fight.
abilities.original_description: Warwick gains damage reduction for 2.5 seconds. At the end, or if re-activated, he howls, causing nearby enemies to flee for 1 second. Warwick gains {{ e1 }}% damage reduction for 2.5 seconds. After it ends, Warwick howls, <status>Fearing</status> nearby enemies for {{ e3 }} second. Warwick can <recast>Recast</recast> to end the Ability early.

abilities.name: Hextech Affinity
abilities.mechanics_description: **Hextech Affinity (Passive)** is a passive ability that **automatically grants Heimerdinger bonus movement speed** when he is within a certain range of allied towers or his own deployed Hextech Turrets. It is used **defensively** and for **utility**, allowing Heimerdinger to reposition more quickly to safety or to quickly rejoin fights while near his turrets.
abilities.original_description: Gain Move Speed while near allied towers and turrets deployed by Heimerdinger.

abilities.name: Hextech Micro-Rockets
abilities.mechanics_description: Hextech Micro-Rockets is a linear skillshot that fires a spread of rockets that converge on a target location. It's primarily used offensively to deal burst damage and can also grant his turrets charge when hitting champions.
abilities.original_description:
Heimerdinger fires long-range rockets that converge on his cursor. Heimerdinger unleashes a barrage of {{ rockets }} rockets that deal {{ damage }} magic damage to the first enemy hit. Additional rocket hits deal reduced damage.

Max Damage: {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

Nearby Turrets gain 20% charge per rocket that hits a champion.

abilities.name: H-28 G Evolution Turret
abilities.mechanics_description: Heimerdinger's "H-28 G Evolution Turret" (Q) is an **auto-targeting deployable** that attacks nearby enemies. It is primarily used **offensively** to zone and deal sustained damage, but can also be used **defensively** to deter enemy engages or protect objectives.
abilities.original_description:
Heimerdinger lays down a rapid-fire cannon turret equipped with a secondary pass-through beam attack (turrets deal half damage to towers). Heimerdinger constructs a Turret that attacks nearby enemies. Heimerdinger can have {{ maxturrets }} turrets active at once. Turrets slowly build up charge. At max charge, they fire a stronger attack.

If Heimerdinger gets too far away, his Turrets will deactivate after 8 seconds.

This Ability has {{ maxkits }} charges.

abilities.name: CH-2 Electron Storm Grenade
abilities.mechanics_description: CH-2 Electron Storm Grenade is a **skillshot** that Heimerdinger throws to a target location. It deals magic damage in an area, **stunning** enemies in the epicenter and **slowing** those in the outer radius. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for damage and crowd control, and for the utility of charging his nearby turrets upon hitting a champion.
abilities.original_description:
Heimerdinger lobs a grenade at a location, dealing damage to enemy units, as well as stunning anyone directly hit and slowing surrounding units. Heimerdinger hurls a grenade that deals {{ damage }} magic damage in an area and Slows by {{ slowpercent.0*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. Enemies in the center are also Stunned for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

Hitting a champion fully charges nearby Turrets.

abilities.name: UPGRADE!!!
abilities.mechanics_description:
**UPGRADE!!! (R) - Heimerdinger**

*   **How to hit/use:** This is a **self-cast buff** that empowers Heimerdinger's next basic ability (Q, W, or E). After casting R, Heimerdinger must then cast his chosen basic ability to trigger the empowered effect.
*   **How it is used:** UPGRADE!!! is used **both offensively and for utility**. It significantly enhances the damage and/or crowd control of his next Q, W, or E. The specific enhancement depends on which basic ability is cast after R:
    *   **Q (H-28Q Apex Turret):** Summons a powerful, temporary turret with increased damage, splash damage, and a slow.
    *   **W (Hextech Rocket Swarm):** Fires rockets with increased damage, dealing more damage to individual targets.
    *   **E (CH-3X Lightning Grenade):** Throws a grenade with an increased stun and slow area.

**Concise Description:** UPGRADE!!! is a self-cast buff that empowers Heimerdinger's next basic ability, significantly increasing its damage, utility, or both depending on the chosen ability. It is a crucial tool for amplifying his offensive pressure or crowd control in various situations.
abilities.original_description:
Heimerdinger invents an upgrade, causing his next spell to have increased effects. Heimerdinger upgrades his next non-ultimate Ability.

H-28Q Apex Turret: Place an upgraded Turret for 8 seconds that doesn't count towards Heimerdinger's max turrets, deals {{ qultdamage }} magic damage per shot and {{ qultdamagebeam }} magic damage per charged shot. Its attacks deal damage in an area, Slow by 25% for 2 seconds, and it is immune to crowd control.

Hextech Rocket Swarm: Fires 4 waves of rockets that each deal {{ wultdamage }} magic damage. Champions and jungle monsters hit by additional rockets take reduced damage, and minions take increased damage. Max Damage: {{ wulttotaldamage }} magic damage.

CH-3X Lightning Grenade: Throws a bouncing grenade that discharges three times, dealing {{ eultdamage }} magic damage. The Stun and Slow areas are larger.

Recast: Cancel this Ability.

abilities.name: Power Chord
abilities.mechanics_description: **Power Chord (Passive):** Sona's next auto-attack after casting a basic ability deals bonus magic damage and applies an additional effect based on the last basic ability used: Q grants bonus damage, W grants a team heal/shield, and E grants a movement speed buff. This is an auto-targeted effect that empowers her basic attacks.
abilities.original_description:
Accelerando: Sona gains non-Ultimate ability haste permanently for her basic abilities as she uses her abilities well, up to a cap. Beyond that cap, further successful uses reduce her ultimate's remaining cooldown instead.

Power Chord: Every few spell casts, Sona's next attack will deal bonus magic damage in addition to an additional effect based on what basic Ability Sona last activated.

abilities.name: Aria of Perseverance
abilities.mechanics_description: Aria of Perseverance is an **auto-targeted** ability that **heals** Sona and the closest wounded allied champion. Following the heal, Sona gains a temporary **aura** that **shields** all allied champions within its radius.
abilities.original_description:
Sona plays the Aria of Perseverance, sending out protective melodies, healing Sona and a nearby wounded ally. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone a temporary shield. Active: Sona restores {{ totalheal }} Health to herself and a nearby allied champion, prioritizing the most wounded. She then begins a new Melody.

Melody: Sona gains an aura for {{ auraduration }} seconds, granting allied champions {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

Gain a stack of Accelerando whenever you heal another injured ally and every time you protect another ally from at least {{ accelerandoshieldbreakpoint }} damage with this shield.

Power Chord - Diminuendo: Power Chord also reduces physical and magic damage dealt by the target by {{ totaldiminuendoweakenpercent }} for {{ diminuendoduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Hymn of Valor
abilities.mechanics_description: **Hymn of Valor (Q)** is a **point-and-click** ability that deals magic damage to the two nearest enemies, prioritizing champions. It also grants Sona a temporary aura that empowers nearby allies' next auto-attack with bonus magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Sona plays the Hymn of Valor, sends out bolts of sound, dealing magic damage to two nearby enemies, prioritizing champions and monsters. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone bonus damage on their next attack against enemies. Sona deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the nearest two enemies, prioritizing champions. She then begins a new Melody. Gain a stack of Accelerando for every champion you damage with this.

Melody: Sona gains an aura for {{ auraduration }} seconds, granting allied champions an additional {{ totalonhitdamage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% on their next Attack within {{ onhitduration }} seconds.

Power Chord - Staccato: Power Chord bonus damage ({{ totalstaccatodamage }} total magic damage).

abilities.name: Song of Celerity
abilities.mechanics_description: **Song of Celerity (E)** is an **auto-targeted aura** ability. When activated, Sona grants herself and nearby allied champions a significant burst of **bonus Move Speed**. This allows for rapid repositioning, engaging fights, or escaping dangerous situations. Her empowered **Power Chord - Tempo** also applies a strong slow to a single enemy target, further enhancing its utility in chase or escape scenarios.
abilities.original_description:
Sona plays the Song of Celerity, granting nearby allies bonus Move Speed. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allied champions tagged by the zone bonus Move Speed. Active: She begins a new Melody and grants herself {{ totalselfmovementspeed }} Move Speed for {{ selfmovementspeeddurationmin }} seconds, extended to up to {{ selfmovementspeeddurationmax }} seconds if she doesn't take damage.

Melody: Sona gains an aura for {{ auraduration }} seconds that grants allied champions {{ totalallymovementspeed }} Move Speed for {{ allymovementspeedduration }} seconds.

Power Chord - Tempo: Power Chord also Slows the target by {{ totaltempomovespeedslow }} for {{ tempoduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Crescendo
abilities.mechanics_description: Crescendo is a linear skillshot that travels forward from Sona, dealing magic damage and stunning all enemy champions hit. It's primarily used defensively to peel for allies or offensively to initiate a fight and lock down targets for a short duration.
abilities.original_description: Sona plays her ultimate chord, stunning enemy champions and forcing them to dance and dealing magic damage to them. Sona strikes an irresistible chord, <status>Stunning</status> enemy for {{ stunduration }} seconds and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Loaded Dice
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Loaded Dice (Passive)**

*   **How it's used:** This is a passive ability that triggers automatically upon killing any unit.
*   **Usage:** Twisted Fate gains bonus gold when a unit dies near him, with the amount varying randomly between 1 to 6 gold. This passively increases his gold income throughout the game, allowing him to acquire items faster.
abilities.original_description: Upon killing a unit, Twisted Fate rolls his 'lucky' dice receiving 1 to 6 bonus gold.

abilities.name: Wild Cards
abilities.mechanics_description: **Wild Cards (Q)** is a linear skillshot that Twisted Fate throws in a target direction, firing three cards in a spread. Each card deals magic damage to any enemy unit it passes through, making it a primary tool for poke and wave clear.
abilities.original_description: Twisted Fate throws three cards, dealing damage to each enemy unit they pass through. Twisted Fate throws three cards that deal <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> each.

abilities.name: Pick a Card
abilities.mechanics_description: Twisted Fate's "Pick a Card" (W) is a **channeled, targeted ability** that lasts for a short duration. After a brief cast, he can **recast it to lock in one of three cards: Blue (mana restore/magic damage), Red (AoE magic damage/slow), or Gold (single target magic damage/stun)**, which empowers his next auto-attack. This ability is primarily used for **utility and burst damage**.
abilities.original_description:
Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects. Twisted Fate begins shuffling his deck, allowing him to Recast to lock in one of three cards and enhance his next Attack.
  • The Blue Card deals {{ bluedamage }} magic damage and restores {{ e6 }} Mana.
  • The Red Card deals {{ reddamage }} to nearby enemies and Slows by {{ e2 }}% for 2.5 seconds.
  • The Gold Card deals {{ golddamage }} and Stuns for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Stacked Deck
abilities.mechanics_description: Stacked Deck is a **passive ability** that automatically triggers on Twisted Fate's 4th consecutive auto-attack. It empowers this attack to deal **bonus magic damage** and also provides a permanent **increase to his Attack Speed**. Twisted Fate uses this to amplify his sustained damage output, especially during extended trades and skirmishes.
abilities.original_description: Every 4 attacks, Twisted Fate deals bonus damage. In addition, his Attack Speed is increased. <spellPassive>Passive:</spellPassive> Twisted Fate gains <attackSpeed>{{ attackspeedbonus }}% Attack Speed</attackSpeed> and every 4th Attack deals an additional <magicDamage>{{ bonusdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Destiny
