abilities.mechanics_description: Twisted Fate's ultimate, Destiny, is an **auto-targeting** ability that reveals all enemy champions on the map for a duration. Once activated, Twisted Fate can **recast** it to teleport to any target location within a large radius, functioning as a powerful initiation or escape tool.
abilities.original_description:
Twisted Fate predicts the fortunes of his foes, revealing all enemy champions and enabling the use of Gate, which teleports Twisted Fate to any target location in 1.5 seconds. Twisted Fate focuses on his cards, granting True Sight of all enemy champions on the map for {{ e1 }} seconds and allowing him to Recast.

Recast: Twisted Fate teleports up to {{ e4 }} units away.

abilities.name: Fury of the Xer'Sai
abilities.mechanics_description: Fury of the Xer'Sai is Rek'Sai's passive that **accumulates Fury as she deals damage with auto-attacks and abilities.** This Fury is then **consumed while Burrowed to regenerate health**, offering a potent sustain tool for aggressive plays and survivability.
abilities.original_description: Rek'Sai generates Fury by Attacking and hitting with basic Abilities. She consumes this Fury while Burrowed to restore health.

abilities.name: Burrow / Un-burrow
abilities.mechanics_description: Rek'Sai's **W - Burrow / Un-burrow** is a **toggle** ability. While **Unburrowed**, she can **activate** it to burrow underground, losing her ability to attack but gaining movement speed and tremorsense to detect moving enemies. While **Burrowed**, she can **reactivate** it to emerge, **knocking up** and damaging nearby enemies in a circular AoE around her.
abilities.original_description:
Rek'Sai burrows into the ground, gaining new abilities and increased Move Speed. Her vision range is reduced and she cannot use basic attacks.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai may cast Unburrow to knock up and damage nearby enemies. Unburrowed: Rek'Sai burrows into the ground, gaining access to new Abilities but cannot Attack. She gains {{ burrowedmovespeed }} Move Speed, {{ visionradiusmod*-100 }}% reduced vision range, and nearby enemies that move and are otherwise unseen will have their positions revealed to Rek'sai and her allies.

abilities.name: Queen's Wrath / Prey Seeker
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Queen's Wrath:** This is a passive effect where Rek'Sai's next three basic attacks, while unburrowed, deal bonus physical damage to nearby enemies and grant bonus attack speed.

**Prey Seeker:** While burrowed, this is a linear skillshot that launches a tremor, dealing damage and revealing enemies hit.

**Mechanics and Usage:** Rek'Sai's Q has two forms based on her burrowed state. Unburrowed, it enhances her next three auto-attacks with bonus damage and attack speed, making it a core tool for offensive skirmishing and trading. Burrowed, it becomes a linear skillshot for poke, wave clear, and a unique way to gain vision and track enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Rek'Sai's next 3 basic attacks deal bonus Physical Damage to nearby enemies.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai launches a burst of void-charged earth that damages and reveals enemies hit. Unburrowed: Rek'Sai's next 3 Attacks within {{ buffduration }} seconds gain {{ attackspeed*100 }}% Attack Speed and deal an additional {{ totaldamagetooltip }} physical damage to nearby enemies. Attacks refresh the duration of this Ability.

abilities.name: Furious Bite / Tunnel
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Furious Bite (Unburrowed):** This is a point-and-click targeted ability used offensively for physical damage. If Rek'Sai has max Fury, the bite consumes it to deal bonus true damage, emphasizing burst potential.

**Tunnel (Burrowed):** This is a utility ability with a two-part placement mechanic to create a tunnel. It's used for rapid repositioning, both offensively to engage and defensively to escape, with destructible entrances adding a strategic layer.
abilities.original_description:
Rek'Sai bites her target, dealing physical damage, or bonus true damage if she has max Fury.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai creates a re-usable, long lasting tunnel. Enemies can destroy it by standing on top of either entrance. Unburrowed: Rek'Sai bites a target, dealing {{ spell.reksaie:basedamage }} physical damage. At max Fury, the bite deals {{ spell.reksaie:empowereddamage }} true damage instead.

abilities.name: Void Rush
abilities.mechanics_description: **Void Rush (R)** is a targeted dash that requires Rek'Sai to have previously damaged an enemy champion within the last 5 seconds. Upon activation, she becomes untargetable and then leaps to the marked target, dealing significant physical damage based on their maximum health, and refreshing the cooldown on her Burrow/Un-burrow ability. This ability is primarily used offensively for executing low-health targets or engaging from a safe distance, offering a powerful finishing tool.
abilities.original_description: Rek'Sai passively marks targets by damaging them. She can activate this ability to become briefly untargetable and lunge at a marked target for heavy damage based on their maximum health. Rek'Sai targets an enemy damaged by her in the last {{ preymarkduration }} seconds and then dives underground, becoming Untargetable. Moments later, she leaps unstoppably at her target, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ rbasedamagecalc }} plus {{ percenthealthdamage }}% max Health physical damage</physicalDamage> and resets the cooldown of <keywordMajor>Burrow / Un-burrow</keywordMajor>.

abilities.name: Absolution
abilities.mechanics_description: Senna's passive, Absolution, is a **proc-based system** where souls of fallen enemies periodically drop near her. Senna **physically attacks** these souls to collect them, which increases her Attack Damage, Attack Range, and Critical Strike Chance. Her basic attacks are also **empowered**, dealing bonus mist damage and granting a brief movement speed steal from her target.
abilities.original_description:
When units die near Senna, their souls are periodically trapped by the Black Mist. Senna can attack these souls to free them, absorbing the Mist that held them in death. Mist fuels her Relic Cannon's power with increased Attack Damage, Attack Range, and Critical Strike Chance.

Attacks from Senna's Relic Cannon take longer to fire, deal bonus damage, and briefly grant her a portion of her target's Move Speed.

abilities.name: Last Embrace
abilities.mechanics_description: Last Embrace is a linear skillshot that damages and roots the first enemy hit and nearby enemies after a delay. It's primarily used defensively to CC enemies and escape, or to set up kills by rooting targets for Senna and her team to follow up on.
abilities.original_description: Senna sends forth a wave of Black Mist. If it hits an enemy it latches onto them hungrily, rooting them and everything nearby after a brief delay. Senna sends forth the Black Mist, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ damage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> to the first enemy hit. After a {{ delaytime }} second delay the target and other nearby enemies are <status>Rooted</status> for {{ rootduration }} second(s).

abilities.name: Piercing Darkness
abilities.mechanics_description: Piercing Darkness is a linear skillshot that Senna fires in a chosen direction. It damages and slows the first enemy hit, while also healing the first allied champion passed through.
abilities.original_description:
From the twin barrels of her Relic Cannon, Senna fires a unified beam of light and shadow through a target, healing allies and damaging enemies. Senna shoots a bolt of piercing shadow through an ally or enemy, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to enemies and Slowing them by {{ totalslow }} for {{ slowduration }} second(s). Restores {{ totalheal }} Health to allied champions.

Attacks reduce this Ability's Cooldown by {{ cdreductiononhit }} second.

abilities.name: Curse of the Black Mist
abilities.mechanics_description: "Curse of the Black Mist" is a **circular skillshot** that Senna can cast at a target location. It provides **defensive utility** by granting allies within the mist **invulnerability to targeted abilities and increased movement speed**, while also making them **untargetable and invisible** to enemies unless enemies are nearby.
abilities.original_description: Senna draws the Mist she has stored in her weapon into a storm around her, embracing darkness and becoming a wraith within. Allies who enter the area are camouflaged and also appear as wraiths as the Mist shrouds them. Wraiths gain increased Move Speed, are unselectable, and hide their identities. Senna dissolves into a cloud of Black Mist for {{ buffduration }} seconds, becoming a Wraith. Allied champions who enter the Mist are <keywordStealth>Camouflaged</keywordStealth> and become Wraiths when they leave. Wraiths gain <speed>{{ totalms }} Move Speed</speed>, are Unselectable, and hide their identities as long as no enemy champions are nearby.

abilities.name: Dawning Shadow
abilities.mechanics_description: Dawning Shadow is a global, linear skillshot that Senna fires. It deals physical damage to all enemies struck in its path and provides a moderate shield to all allies hit in a significatnly wider area, making it a powerful tool for both engage and disengage across the map.
abilities.original_description: Senna calls upon the relic stones of fallen Sentinels, splitting her relic cannon into a holy array of shadow and light. She then fires a global beam that shields allies from harm, while damaging enemies caught in the center. Senna fires a beam of light that deals <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> to all enemy champions hit. Allied champions hit in a wider area receive <shield>{{ totalshield }} Shield</shield> for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Backstab
abilities.mechanics_description: Shaco's passive, **Backstab**, is an auto-target mechanic that triggers on his basic attacks and his ability **Two-Shiv Poison**. It deals bonus damage when Shaco attacks an enemy champion from behind, making it an offensive tool primarily used for maximizing damage output in skirmishes and assassinations.
abilities.original_description: Shaco's basic attacks and Two-Shiv Poison deal additional damage when striking from behind.

abilities.name: Two-Shiv Poison
abilities.mechanics_description: "Two-Shiv Poison" is an auto-target ability with both passive and active effects. Passively, Shaco's auto-attacks apply a slow, while actively, he throws a shiv to deal magic damage, slow, and execute targets below 30% health.
abilities.original_description:
Shaco's Shivs passively poison targets on hit, slowing their Move Speed. He can throw his Shivs to deal damage and poison the target. The thrown Shiv deals bonus damage if the target is below 30% health. Passive: While this Ability is off Cooldown, Shaco's Attacks Slow the target by {{ slowamount*-100 }}% for {{ slowdurationpassive }} seconds.

Active: Shaco throws a shiv, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Slowing by {{ slowamount*-100 }}% for {{ slowdurationactive }} seconds. If the target has less than {{ executehealththreshold*100 }}% Health, the shiv deals {{ totalexecutedamage }} damage instead.

abilities.name: Jack In The Box
abilities.mechanics_description: **Jack in the Box (W)** is a **placed trap** ability. Shaco places a hidden Jack-in-the-Box at a target location, which triggers when an enemy gets close, **fearing** them and then attacking nearby enemies for magic damage over time. It's primarily used for crowd control, zone denial, and setting up ambushes, with a secondary role in dealing damage.
abilities.original_description:
Shaco creates a hidden animated Jack-in-the-Box. When triggered, it will fear and attack nearby enemies. Shaco creates a trap that stealths itself after {{ e5 }} seconds and lasts for {{ trapduration }} seconds. It activates when an enemy comes near or when revealed, Fearing nearby enemy Champions for {{ fearduration }} seconds, or {{ minionfearduration }} seconds for minions and jungle monsters.

Once activated, the trap fires at all nearby enemies for 5 seconds, dealing {{ aoedamage }} magic damage, or {{ stdamage }} damage if focused on a single target.

Jack in the Box's attacks deal an additional {{ monsterbonusdamage }} damage to monsters.

abilities.name: Deceive
abilities.mechanics_description: **Deceive (Q)** is an auto-target ability that allows Shaco to instantly teleport a short distance to a target location and become invisible. His next attack while invisible is empowered with bonus physical damage, and critically strikes if he hits his target from behind, making it a potent tool for initiating combat, securing kills, and evading danger.
abilities.original_description:
Shaco becomes Invisible and teleports to target location.

His first attack while Invisible is empowered, dealing bonus damage and critically striking if he attacks from behind. Shaco teleports and becomes Invisible for {{ stealthduration }} seconds. Using Jack In The Box or Hallucinate does not break Invisibility.

Shaco's next Attack while Invisible deals an additional {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. If striking from behind, this Attack critically strikes for {{ qcritdamagemod }} damage.

abilities.name: Hallucinate
abilities.mechanics_description: Hallucinate is activated by Shaco, generating a controllable clone of himself for a duration. This clone mirrors Shaco's basic attacks and has its own health bar. Upon its destruction, the clone explodes, dealing AoE magic damage and summoning three smaller Jack-in-the-Boxes that instantly fear and damage nearby enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Shaco creates an illusion of himself near him, which can attack nearby enemies (Deals reduced damage to turrets). Upon death, it explodes, spawning three mini Jack in the Boxes and dealing damage to nearby enemies. Shaco briefly disappears, then reappears with a clone that lasts {{ clonelifetime }} seconds and detonates when it dies, dealing {{ explosiontotaldamage }} magic damage and spawning three mini Jack in the Boxes that trigger immediately. The clone deals {{ cloneaadamagepercent*100 }}% of Shaco's damage and receives {{ cloneincomingdamagepercent*100 }}% increased damage.

Mini Jack in the Boxes deal {{ aoedamage }} magic damage, or {{ stdamage }} magic damage if firing at only one enemy, and Fear for {{ boxfearduration }} second.

abilities.name: Hextech Capacitor
abilities.mechanics_description: Hextech Capacitor is Jayce's passive ability. It is an **auto-target** buff that triggers automatically when Jayce switches between his Hammer Stance and his Mercury Cannon Stance. This ability is primarily used **offensively** and for **utility**, granting a burst of movement speed that allows Jayce to quickly reposition for engages, disengages, or to chase down opponents after swapping forms.
abilities.original_description: When Jayce swaps weapons he gains Move Speed for a short duration.

abilities.name: Lightning Field / Hyper Charge
abilities.mechanics_description: Jayce's Mercury Hammer (W) is a toggle that, in Hammer Stance, passively restores mana on auto-attacks. In Cannon Stance, it's an auto-target buff providing a significant attack speed boost for a short duration, primarily used offensively to empower auto-attack sequences.
abilities.original_description:
Hammer Stance: Passive: Restores Mana per strike. Active: Creates a field of lightning damaging nearby enemies for several seconds.

Cannon Stance: Gains a burst of energy, increasing Attack Speed to maximum for several attacks. Mercury Hammer - Passive: Jayce's Hammer Attacks grant {{ spell.jaycestaticfield:managain }} Mana.

Mercury Hammer - Active: Jayce creates an electric aura dealing {{ spell.jaycestaticfield:damage }} magic damage over {{ spell.jaycestaticfield:duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: To the Skies! / Shock Blast
abilities.mechanics_description:
**To the Skies!** (Hammer Stance): This is a linear **skillshot** where Jayce leaps to a target, dealing physical damage to them and a small AoE burst to surrounding enemies, applying a moderate slow. Its primary use is **offensive**, serving as an engagement tool to close distance and initiate fights with damage and CC.

**Shock Blast** (Cannon Stance): This is a linear **skillshot** that travels a fixed distance. Upon impact with an enemy or reaching its maximum range, it **detonates**, dealing physical damage to all enemies within the explosion radius. It is primarily used **offensively** to poke and harass from a safe distance, and can also be used to clear waves or hit multiple targets.
abilities.original_description:
Hammer Stance: Leaps to an enemy dealing physical damage and slowing enemies.

Cannon Stance: Fires an orb of electricity that detonates upon hitting an enemy (or reaching the end of its path) dealing physical damage to all enemies hit. Mercury Hammer: Jayce leaps to an enemy, dealing {{ spell.jaycetotheskies:damage }} physical damage to surrounding enemies and Slowing them by {{ spell.jaycetotheskies:slow*-100 }}% for {{ spell.jaycetotheskies:slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Mercury Cannon / Mercury Hammer
abilities.mechanics_description:
Jayce's ultimate is a **stance swap**.

*   **Mercury Cannon (R) - Cannon Stance:** Transforms Jayce into his Mercury Cannon, gaining increased attack range and the ability to cast new ranged abilities. His first auto-attack after transforming reduces the target's Armor and Magic Resist. This stance is primarily used for **offensive poke and longer-range damage**.

*   **Mercury Hammer (R) - Hammer Stance:** Transforms Jayce into his Mercury Hammer, gaining increased Armor and Magic Resist and the ability to cast new melee abilities. His first auto-attack after transforming deals bonus magic damage. This stance is primarily used for **closer-range burst damage and survivability**.

**Concise Description:** Jayce's ultimate is a stance swap between his Mercury Cannon (long-range poke, armor/MR shred on first auto) and Mercury Hammer (melee burst, on-hit magic damage on first auto). This allows him to adapt his damage profile and engage from different ranges.
abilities.original_description:
Hammer Stance: Transforms the Mercury Hammer into the Mercury Cannon gaining new abilities and increased range. The first attack in this form reduces the target's Armor and Magic Resist.

Cannon Stance: Transforms the Mercury Cannon into the Mercury Hammer gaining new abilities and increasing Armor and Magic Resist. The first attack in this form deals additional magic damage. Mercury Hammer: Jayce transforms his weapon into the Mercury Cannon, gaining Attack Range and new Abilities. Jayce's next Attack removes {{ spell.jaycestancehtg:rangedformshred }} Armor and Magic Resist for {{ spell.jaycestancehtg:shredduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Thundering Blow / Acceleration Gate
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Thundering Blow (Hammer Stance):** This is a **point-and-click** ability that deals magic damage, scales with max health, and applies an immediate **knockback** to a targeted enemy. It's primarily used offensively for peeling or disrupting enemy positioning.

**Acceleration Gate (Cannon Stance):** This deploys a stationary **AoE projectile** (a line skillshot that expands slightly in width). Allies passing through gain a significant but decaying **movement speed buff**. If Jayce's next Shock Blast (Q) is fired through the gate, it gains significantly increased missile speed, range, and damage. This is a core utility and damage amplification tool, enabling faster engagements, disengagements, or devastating long-range poke and burst.
abilities.original_description:
Hammer Stance: Deals magic damage to an enemy and knocks them back a short distance.

Cannon Stance: Deploys an Acceleration Gate increasing the Move Speed of all allied champions who pass through it. If Shock Blast is fired through the gate the missile speed, range, and damage will increase. Hammer Form: Jayce swings his hammer, Knocking Back his target and dealing {{ spell.jaycethunderingblow:flatdamage }} plus {{ spell.jaycethunderingblow:perchpdamage*100 }}% max Health magic damage.

abilities.name: Living Forge
abilities.mechanics_description: **Living Forge (Passive):** Ornn passively gains bonus Armor and Magic Resist. He can also use this passive to forge items and upgrade them to Masterwork versions anywhere on the map, providing him and his allies with permanent stat bonuses in addition to item effects.
abilities.original_description:
Ornn gains an additional bonus Armor and Magic Resist from all sources.

Ornn can spend gold to forge non-consumable items anywhere.

Additionally, he can create masterwork items for himself and for his allies.

abilities.name: Volcanic Rupture
abilities.mechanics_description: **Volcanic Rupture (Q)** is a linear skillshot that Ornn sends forward, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. At its destination, the fissure erupts into a pillar of rock after a short delay, which Ornn can use to dash forward by reacting quickly. It's primarily used offensively for damage and crowd control, with the potential for follow-up engage via the pillar's dash.
abilities.original_description: Ornn slams the ground, sending out a fissure dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. After a small delay, a magma pillar forms at the end location. Ornn slams the ground, creating a fissure dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> by {{ e5 }}% for {{ e6 }} seconds. A pillar of rock forms at the fissure's end for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Searing Charge
abilities.mechanics_description: Searing Charge is a **skillshot dash** that damages enemies passed through. If it **collides with terrain**, Ornn triggers a post-dash **shockwave** that deals area damage and **knocks up** enemies. This ability is used both **offensively** for damage and CC lockdown, and **defensively** for escape or repositioning during engagements.
abilities.original_description:
Ornn charges, dealing damage to enemies he passes through. If Ornn collides with terrain while charging, the impact creates a shockwave around him which deals damage and knocks up enemies. Ornn charges, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. If Ornn rams into terrain, he creates a shockwave that Knocks Up enemies for {{ knockupduration }} seconds and applies the same damage to those not hit by the charge.

Ornn's charge destroys magma pillars and terrain created by enemies.

abilities.name: Bellows Breath
abilities.mechanics_description: Ornn's W, Bellows Breath, is a **linear skillshot** that damages enemies caught in a cone in front of him. It's primarily used **offensively** for sustained damage and to apply the **Brittle** debuff. Enemies affected by Brittle take bonus damage from Ornn's next attack, which also **knocks them back** and amplifies the duration of any immobilizing crowd control applied to them.
abilities.original_description:
Ornn advances, breathing fire. Enemies hit by the final gout of flame become Brittle. Ornn stomps forward Unstoppably while breathing fire, dealing {{ maxpercenthpperticktooltip }}% max Health magic damage over {{ breathduration }} seconds. Enemies hit by the final bout of flame become Brittle for {{ brittleduration }} seconds.

Immobilizing effects on Brittle targets have their duration increased by 30% and deal an additional {{ brittlepercentmaxhpcalc }} max Health magic damage. Ornn's Attacks against Brittle targets Knock them Back, dealing the additional damage.

abilities.name: Call of the Forge God
abilities.mechanics_description: Call the Forge God is a **linear skillshot** where Ornn summons an elemental that travels towards him, damaging, slowing, and applying Brittle to enemies hit. Ornn can **recast** to dash and headbutt the elemental, redirecting it in his current direction, knocking up enemies and reapplying Brittle. This ability is primarily **offensive and utility-focused**, used for engaging, crowd control, and setting up follow-up attacks.
abilities.original_description:
Ornn summons a massive elemental at a location which travels toward him with increasing speed. Enemies run over by the elemental take damage, are slowed and are made Brittle. Ornn can recast the ability to charge into the elemental, redirecting it in the direction he hits it, causing the elemental to affect any enemies it runs over to be knocked up, dealing the same damage and re-applying Brittle. Ornn summons a massive lava elemental, which stampedes towards him, dealing {{ rdamagecalc }} magic damage, applying Brittle to, and Slowing enemies hit by {{ rslowpercentbasepremath }}% for {{ brittledurationtooltiponly }} seconds.

Ornn can Recast to dash with a headbutt. If he dashes into the elemental, he redirects and empowers it, causing it to Knock Up the first champion for {{ rstunduration }} second and subsequent champions for {{ minstun }} seconds. The elemental also deals {{ rdamagecalc }} magic damage and reapplies Brittle.

abilities.name: Mark of the Storm
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Kennen's Passive: Mark of the Storm**

Mark of the Storm is an auto-target debuff applied by Kennen's abilities and empowered auto-attacks. After consuming three stacks of the mark on a target, Kennen applies a stun.
abilities.original_description: Kennen stuns enemies he hits 3 times with his abilities.

abilities.name: Thundering Shuriken
abilities.mechanics_description: Thundering Shuriken is a **linear skillshot** that Kennen throws at a target location. It deals **magic damage** to the first enemy hit and applies a **Mark of the Storm**, which is Kennen's primary way of setting up his crowd control and follow-up damage.
abilities.original_description: Kennen throws a fast moving shuriken towards a location, causing damage and adding a Mark of the Storm to any opponent that it hits. Kennen throws a shuriken, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to the first enemy hit.

abilities.name: Slicing Maelstrom
abilities.mechanics_description: Slicing Maelstrom is a **circular area-of-effect (AoE) ultimate ability** Kennen casts on himself. It deals damage over time to all enemies within the storm's radius, with damage amplified on subsequent hits to the same target, and also grants Kennen bonus Armor and Magic Resist for its duration.
abilities.original_description: Kennen summons a storm that strikes at nearby enemy champions for magical damage. Kennen unleashes a magical storm, dealing <magicDamage>{{ pertickdamagecalculated }} magic damage</magicDamage> to all nearby enemies every {{ kennenrtickrate }} seconds, and gaining <scaleArmor>{{ kennenrdefenses }} Armor</scaleArmor> and <scaleMR>{{ kennenrdefenses }} Magic Resist</scaleMR> for {{ kennenrduration }} seconds. Successive hits deal {{ damageamp*100 }}% increased damage for each hit the enemy has already suffered.

abilities.name: Electrical Surge
abilities.mechanics_description: **Electrical Surge (W)** is a circular, area-of-effect ability that Kennen activates to deal magic damage to nearby enemies who are currently afflicted with his Mark of the Storm. It's primarily used offensively to proc Marks, dealing burst damage and potentially stunning multiple targets if they are all marked.
abilities.original_description:
Kennen passively deals extra damage and adds a Mark of the Storm to his target every few attacks, and he can activate this ability to damage and add another Mark of the Storm to targets who are already marked. Passive: Every 5th Attack deals an additional {{ totaldamagepassive }} magic damage.

Active: Kennen sends out a blast of electricity, dealing {{ totaldamageactive }} magic damage to nearby enemies affected by Mark of the Storm.

abilities.name: Lightning Rush
abilities.mechanics_description: **Lightning Rush (E):** This ability is a targeted dash that allows Kennen to pass through units. It deals magic damage to any enemies he passes through, applies a Mark of the Storm on the first target hit, and grants him bonus movement speed while active. Recasting the ability ends it early, granting Kennen a period of bonus attack speed.
abilities.original_description:
Kennen morphs into a lightning form, enabling him to pass through units and apply a Mark of the Storm. Kennen gains Move Speed when entering this form, and attack speed when leaving it. Kennen turns into a ball of lightning, gaining {{ movementspeed*100 }}% Move Speed, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to enemies he passes through, and becoming Ghosted for {{ durationasball }} seconds. If Kennen damages at least one enemy, he gains {{ energyrefund }} Energy.

After this ability ends, Kennen gains {{ attackspeed*100 }}% Attack Speed for {{ durationafterball }} seconds. Kennen can Recast to end this Ability early.

abilities.name: Living Vengeance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Living Vengeance (Passive):** This is an **auto-target** passive ability. Upon scoring a kill or an assist on an enemy, Varus **temporarily gains bonus Attack Damage and Ability Power**. The bonus is significantly larger when the target is a champion, offering a powerful offensive snowballing effect that enhances both his auto attacks and abilities for a short duration.
abilities.original_description: On kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Damage and Ability Power. This bonus is larger if the enemy is a champion.

abilities.name: Blighted Quiver
abilities.mechanics_description: Blighted Quiver is a **passive ability** that enhances Varus's basic attacks to deal bonus magic damage and apply Blight stacks. These Blight stacks can then be detonated by Varus's other abilities for significant magic damage based on the target's maximum health, also reducing his basic ability cooldowns.
abilities.original_description:
Passive: Varus' basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and apply Blight. Varus' other abilities detonate Blight, dealing magic damage based on the target's maximum Health. Active: Varus empowers his next Piercing Arrow. Passive: Varus' Attacks deal an additional {{ onhitdamage }} magic damage and apply a Blight stack for {{ e3 }} seconds (max {{ e4 }} stacks).

Varus' other Abilities detonate Blight stacks dealing {{ percenthpperstack }} max Health magic damage per stack (max {{ maxpercenthpperstack }} max Health damage). Detonating Blight on champions and epic monsters also reduces his basic Abilities' Cooldowns by {{ cdrperblightstack*100 }}% of their Maximum per stack.

Active: Varus' next Piercing Arrow deals an additional {{ qempowerpercenthp }} missing Health magic damage, increased up to {{ maxqempowerpercenthp }} missing Health damage based on charge time.

abilities.name: Piercing Arrow
abilities.mechanics_description: **Piercing Arrow (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that Varus charges to increase its range, damage, and the potency of its Blight debuff. It is primarily used **offensively** to poke enemies from a distance, secure kills, and stack Blight for devastating subsequent abilities.
abilities.original_description:
Varus readies and then fires a powerful shot that gains extra range and damage the longer he spends preparing to fire. Begin Charging: Varus draws back his next shot, Slowing himself by {{ e7 }}%. After {{ e5 }} seconds, if not fired, Varus will cancel the Ability and refund {{ e4 }}% of its Mana cost.

Release: Varus releases the arrow, dealing {{ totaldamagemintooltip }} physical damage, reduced by {{ e3 }}% per enemy hit (minimum {{ e9 }}%). Damage and Blight detonation effects are increased by up to {{ maxchargeamp*100 }}% based on charge time (maximum {{ totaldamagemax }}) .

abilities.name: Hail of Arrows
abilities.mechanics_description: Hail of Arrows is a linear skillshot that deals physical damage, slows enemies, and applies Grievous Wounds to them in a target area on the ground. It's primarily used offensively for damage and crowd control, but the slow and Grievous Wounds also provide utility for engaging, disengaging, or setting up kills.
abilities.original_description: Varus fires a hail of arrows that deal physical damage and desecrate the ground. Desecrated ground slows enemies' Move Speed and reduces their self healing and regeneration. Varus fires a hail of arrows that deals <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and desecrates the ground for {{ e3 }} seconds, <status>Slowing</status> enemies by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% and applying {{ grievousamount*100 }}% Grievous Wounds.

abilities.name: Chain of Corruption
abilities.mechanics_description: Chain of Corruption is a **linear skillshot** ability. It is used **offensively** to deal damage and apply significant crowd control (a root) to multiple enemy champions, with the primary target being rooted for the full duration while others are rooted if the corruption reaches them.
abilities.original_description:
Varus flings out a damaging tendril of corruption that immobilizes the first enemy champion hit and then spreads towards nearby uninfected champions, immobilizing them too on contact. Varus flings out a tendril of corruption, Rooting the first champion hit for {{ e2 }} seconds and dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. Rooted enemies gain {{ e4 }} Blight stacks over the duration.

The corruption spreads from its target to uninfected enemy champions. If it reaches them, they take the same damage and Root.

abilities.name: Riptide
abilities.mechanics_description: **Riptide (E)** is a **skillshot** that originates from Nautilus, expanding outwards in three concentric, rapidly growing circles. It is primarily used **offensively** to deal damage and apply a **slow** to multiple enemies, setting up for further engagement or disengaging.
abilities.original_description: Nautilus creates three exploding waves around himself. Each explosion damages and slows enemies. Nautilus creates three exploding waves around himself, each dealing <magicDamage>{{ damagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> to enemies in the area and <status>Slows</status> them by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Dredge Line
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Type:** Linear Skillshot

**Usage:** Nautilus hurls his anchor in a line. If it hits an enemy champion or monster, it deals magic damage, briefly stuns them, and pulls both Nautilus and the target towards each other. If the anchor hits terrain, Nautilus is instead pulled towards that terrain. This ability is primarily used for engagement, pick potential, and repositioning for Nautilus or his team.
abilities.original_description: Nautilus hurls his anchor forward.  Colliding with an enemy pulls them and Nautilus together, dealing magic damage.  Colliding with terrain pulls Nautilus towards it. Nautilus hurls his anchor forward. If it hits an enemy, Nautilus drags himself and the target together, dealing <magicDamage>{{ qdamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Stunning</status> them briefly. If the anchor hits terrain, Nautilus will drag himself towards it.

abilities.name: Depth Charge
abilities.mechanics_description: Depth Charge is a linear skillshot that Nautilus launches towards a target enemy champion. It travels a set distance, knocking up and stunning any enemies it passes through, and then detonates on its primary target, knocking them up and stunning them for a longer duration. This ability is primarily used for offensive initiation and crowd control, capable of locking down multiple enemies or securing a primary target from range.
abilities.original_description: Nautilus fires a shockwave into the earth that chases an opponent. This shockwave rips up the earth above it, knocking enemies into the air. When it reaches the opponent, the shockwave erupts, knocking his target into the air and stunning them. Nautilus fires a shockwave that chases an enemy champion, dealing <magicDamage>{{ primarytargetdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, <status>Knocking</status> them <status>Up</status> and <status>Stunning</status> them for {{ stunduration }} seconds. Other enemies hit by the shockwave are also <status>Knocked Up</status> and <status>Stunned</status> and take <magicDamage>{{ secondarytargetdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Titan's Wrath
abilities.mechanics_description: Titan's Wrath is an **auto-target** ability that grants Nautilus a **shield** and empowers his next few **auto-attacks** to deal **damage over time** to his target and nearby enemies. This ability is used **defensively** for survivability and **offensively** to add bonus AoE damage to his auto-attack based trading and engage.
abilities.original_description: Nautilus gains a temporary Shield.  While it persists, his Attacks deal damage over time to his target and surrounding enemies. Nautilus gains a <shield>{{ shieldcalc }} Shield</shield> for {{ shieldduration }} seconds. While the <shield>Shield</shield> persists, Nautilus' Attacks deal an additional <magicDamage>{{ dotdamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> over 2 seconds to his target and all surrounding enemies.

abilities.name: Staggering Blow
abilities.mechanics_description: Nautilus's auto-attacks apply "Stacks of Depth Charge" to enemies. After three stacks, his next basic attack **automatically auto-targets** the enemy, dealing bonus on-hit magic damage and **rooting** them for a short duration. This passive functions **offensively** by providing additional damage and a powerful crowd control effect, and is primarily used to set up plays or lock down targets.
abilities.original_description: Nautilus' first Attack against a target deals increased physical damage and roots them briefly.

abilities.name: Junkyard Titan
abilities.mechanics_description: Rumble's passive, **Junkyard Titan**, is an aura-like mechanic tied to his resource system. Casting his abilities generates Heat, which passively buffs his existing spell kit when above 50% (Danger Zone) and grants bonus attack speed and empowered auto-attacks when he reaches 100% (Overheat), at the cost of spell casting lockout. This passive is used offensively by empowering his spells and increasing his auto-attack damage during Overheat, and defensively by providing utility through empowered abilities in the Danger Zone, making Rumble's gameplay revolve around managing his Heat for optimal damage output and spell effects.
abilities.original_description: Every spell Rumble casts gives him Heat. When he reaches 50% Heat he reaches Danger Zone, granting all his basic abilities bonus effects. When he reaches 100% Heat, he starts Overheating, gaining bonus Attack Speed and granting his basic attacks bonus damage, but making him unable to cast spells for a few seconds.

abilities.name: Flamespitter
abilities.mechanics_description: **Flamespitter (Q)** is a **cone skillshot** that Rumble activates **continuously** for 3 seconds, dealing sustained magic damage to enemies in front of him. It is primarily used **offensively** to apply pressure and deal damage, with its effectiveness significantly amplified when Rumble is within his **Danger Zone**.
abilities.original_description:
Rumble torches opponents in front of him, dealing magic damage in a cone for 3 seconds. While in Danger Zone this damage is increased. Rumble ignites his flamethrower, dealing {{ flatdamage }} plus {{ healthdamage*100 }}% max Health magic damage over {{ flamespitterduration }} seconds, reduced to {{ minionmod*100 }}% against minions.

Danger Zone: Damage is increased to {{ empowereddamage }} plus {{ empoweredhealth }} max Health.

Percent damage is limited to {{ monstercap }} damage on Monsters.

abilities.name: Scrap Shield
abilities.mechanics_description: **Scrap Shield (W)** is a self-cast ability that grants Rumble a shield and a temporary movement speed boost. The shield's strength and the duration of the speed boost are significantly increased when Rumble is within his Danger Zone. It is primarily used defensively to absorb damage and reposition, but the speed boost can also be utilized offensively to chase or escape.
abilities.original_description:
Rumble pulls up a shield, protecting him from damage and granting him a quick burst of speed. While in Danger Zone, the shield strength and speed bonus is increased. Rumble tosses up a barrier, gaining {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ shieldduration.1 }} seconds and {{ movespeed*100 }}% Move Speed for {{ movespeedduration }} second.

Danger Zone: The barrier grants {{ empoweredshield }} Shield and {{ empoweredms }} Move Speed instead.

abilities.name: The Equalizer
abilities.mechanics_description: The Equalizer is a **directional skillshot** that Rumble uses **offensively** to zone enemies and deal sustained damage. He clicks and drags to dictate the path of a line of rockets that creates a damaging and slowing fire trail.
abilities.original_description:
Rumble fires off a group of rockets, creating a wall of flames that damages and slows enemies. Rumble launches a line of rockets, creating a burning trail that lasts {{ trailduration }} seconds, Slowing by {{ slowamount }}% and dealing {{ damagepersecond }} magic damage per second.

Rumble can control the direction of the trail by clicking and dragging while casting this Ability.

abilities.name: Electro Harpoon
abilities.mechanics_description: Rumble fires a linear skillshot that deals magic damage, applies a slow, and reduces Magic Resist. Hitting a slowed target or using it within his Danger Zone empowers the damage, slow, and Magic Resist reduction. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage, to set up other abilities, and to amplify his magic damage output.
abilities.original_description:
Rumble launches a harpoon, electrocuting his target with magic damage, slowing their Move Speed, and reducing their Magic Resist. Rumble can carry 2 harpoons at a time. While in Danger Zone the damage and slow percentage is increased. Rumble launches an electrified harpoon, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage, Slowing by {{ baseslowamount }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds, and reducing the enemy's Magic Resist by {{ percmagicpen*100 }}% for {{ shredduration }} seconds.

Hitting an enemy who's already Slowed by this Ability increases the Slow to {{ empoweredslowamount }}% and reduces the enemy's Magic Resist by {{ enhancedmagicpen*100 }}%

Danger Zone: The harpoon deals {{ empdamage }} magic damage instead and the Slow and reduced Magic Resist are increased by 50%.

abilities.name: Obliterate
abilities.mechanics_description: **Obliterate (Q)** is a **cone-shaped skillshot**. Upon activation, Mordekaiser slams his mace in a target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies struck. The damage is significantly amplified if the cone hits only a **single enemy champion**, making it a potent offensive tool for both trading and finishing off isolated targets.
abilities.original_description: Mordekaiser smashes the ground with his mace dealing damage to each enemy struck. Damage is increased when hitting a single enemy. Mordekaiser smashes the ground with Nightfall dealing <magicDamage>{{ qdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, increased to <magicDamage>{{ empowereddamagetooltip }}</magicDamage> if it hits only a single enemy.

abilities.name: Darkness Rise
abilities.mechanics_description: **Darkness Rise (Passive):** This is an **auto-target** passive that activates when Mordekaiser lands **three instances of damage** (from attacks or abilities) on enemy champions or monsters. Once active, it creates a **damage aura** around Mordekaiser for a duration, dealing **magic damage** to nearby enemies and **increasing Mordekaiser's movement speed**, allowing for sustained offensive pressure and chase potential.
abilities.original_description: Mordekaiser gains a powerful damage aura and Move Speed after landing 3 attacks or spells against champions or monsters.

abilities.name: Death's Grasp
abilities.mechanics_description: **Death's Grasp (E)** is a **circular skillshot** that Mordekaiser activates. Upon impact, it **pulls all enemies** within its radius towards him, dealing magic damage and **acting as a CC tool for initiation or disruption**.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser pulls all enemies in an area. Passive: Mordekaiser gains {{ magicpen*100 }}% Magic Penetration.

Active: Mordekaiser pulls enemies in his direction, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Indestructible
abilities.mechanics_description: Mordekaiser's W, "Indestructible," is a **self-cast ability** that consumes all stored damage (both dealt and taken) to grant him a **regenerating shield**. He can **recast** the ability to heal for a percentage of his current shield's health. This ability serves a **defensive utility** role, allowing Mordekaiser to sustain through fights and survive poke.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser stores damage he deals and takes to create a shield. He may consume the shield to heal. Passive: Mordekaiser stores {{ damageconversion*100 }}% of the damage he deals and {{ damagetakenconversion*100 }}% of the damage he takes.

Active: Mordekaiser gains the stored damage as Shield. He may Recast this Ability to restore {{ healingpercent*100 }}% of the remaining Shield as Health.

Minimum Shield: {{ minhealthtooltip }}
Maximum Shield: {{ maxhealthtooltip }}

abilities.name: Realm of Death
abilities.mechanics_description: Mordekaiser's ultimate, **Realm of Death**, is a **point-and-click** ability that **banishes** himself and a target enemy champion to a **separate dimension** for a set duration. This ability is used both **offensively** to isolate and duel an enemy champion, dealing damage and potentially stealing stats if he secures a kill, and **defensively** by removing a threat from the main battlefield.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser drags his victim to a different dimension with him and steals a portion of their stats. If he kills them, he keeps the stats until the victim respawns. Mordekaiser banishes a champion to the Death Realm with him for {{ spiritrealmduration }}s, stealing {{ statstealpercentscalar*100 }}% of their core stats for the duration.

If Mordekaiser kills that enemy in the Death Realm he consumes their soul, keeping the stats he stole until the target respawns.

abilities.name: Flurry
abilities.mechanics_description: **Flurry (Passive):** After casting any ability, Lee Sin's next two basic attacks within a short window gain bonus attack speed and refund energy. This passive is automatically triggered by ability usage, encouraging an aggressive, combo-oriented playstyle with rapid auto-attack weaving for sustained damage and energy regeneration.
abilities.original_description: After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain Attack Speed and return Energy.

abilities.name: Tempest / Cripple
abilities.mechanics_description: Tempest is a linear skillshot that deals magic damage and grants vision. If it hits an enemy, Lee Sin can recast Tempest within a short window to apply a decaying slow to all enemies hit by the initial shockwave. This ability is used offensively for damage and to set up further engages or disengages with the slow.
abilities.original_description:
Tempest: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple.
Cripple: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Move Speed. Move Speed recovers gradually over the duration. Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals {{ initialdamage }} magic damage and reveals them for {{ slowduration }} seconds. If this hits an enemy, Lee Sin can Recast for the next {{ reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin Slows nearby enemies struck by the shockwave by {{ slowamount }}% decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Safeguard / Iron Will
abilities.mechanics_description: Safeguard is a **point-and-click** movement ability that allows Lee Sin to **dash to a target ally, granting both himself and the ally a shield**. This makes it primarily a **defensive and utility** tool for engaging, disengaging, or repositioning. The recast, **Iron Will**, is a **toggle** that enhances Lee Sin's combat sustainability by granting him **Life Steal and Spell Vamp** for a duration, offering both **offensive and defensive** benefits during extended fights.
abilities.original_description:
Safeguard: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will.
Iron Will: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp. Lee Sin dashes to an ally or ward. If the target is a champion, Lee Sin grants them and himself {{ shieldamount }} Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds and reduces this Ability's Cooldown by {{ w1cooldownrecovered*100 }}%. Lee Sin may Recast for the next {{ w1reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin gains {{ lifestealandspellvamp }}% Life Steal and Spell Vamp for {{ lifestealandspellvamptime }} seconds.

abilities.name: Sonic Wave / Resonating Strike
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Sonic Wave / Resonating Strike (Q)** is a two-part ability.

1.  **Usage:** **Sonic Wave** is a linear skillshot that deals damage and reveals the first enemy hit with true sight. **Resonating Strike** is a recast that is a dash to the marked target, dealing execute damage based on missing health.
2.  **Purpose:** This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and engage, allowing Lee Sin to open fights or chase down targets.
abilities.original_description:
Sonic Wave: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.
Resonating Strike: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage based on the target's missing Health. Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound, dealing {{ initialdamage }} physical damage to the first enemy hit, granting True Sight of them, and allows Lee Sin to Recast for the next {{ reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by the sound wave, dealing between {{ recastdamage }} to {{ empowereddamage }} physical damage scaling with the target's missing Health.

abilities.name: Dragon's Rage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dragon's Rage (R)** is a point-and-click ability that launches the target enemy champion a significant distance in a straight line, dealing physical damage to them and any enemies they collide with. Those enemies are then knocked up. Its primary uses are offensive for single-target damage and CC, or for disruptive engage/disruptive peeling by kicking an enemy into their team.
abilities.original_description:
Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map. Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick Knocking Back an enemy champion and dealing {{ damage }} physical damage.

Enemies the target collides with are briefly Knocked Up and take {{ damage }} plus {{ percenthpcarrythrough }}% of the kicked enemy's bonus Health as physical damage.

abilities.name: Spirit Abjuration
abilities.mechanics_description: Spirit Abjuration is a passive ability that **automatically applies a "spirit" debuff to enemies damaged by Aurora's abilities and auto-attacks**. These spirits then **orbit Aurora, providing her with periodic healing**.
abilities.original_description: Aurora's spells and attacks exorcise spirits from the enemies she damages. Exorcised spirits follow Aurora around and heal her.

abilities.name: Across the Veil
abilities.mechanics_description: Across the Veil is a directional **skillshot** that Aurora uses to **dash**. Upon landing, she becomes **invisible** and gains bonus **movement speed** for a short duration, offering both **defensive disengage** and **utility for repositioning** or chasing. Takedowns reset its cooldown, encouraging aggressive plays.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora leaps in a direction of her choosing, entering the spirit realm upon landing, becoming invisible, and gaining Move Speed for a short duration of time. Hop in a direction. Upon landing, enter the spirit realm, becoming Invisible for {{ invisduration }} seconds and entering Realm Hopper, gaining {{ movespeedbonus }}% Move Speed.

Scoring a takedown on an enemy champion resets this Ability's Cooldown.

abilities.name: Twofold Hex
abilities.mechanics_description: **Twofold Hex (Q)** is a **skillshot** that fires a projectile in a target direction, dealing magic damage and applying a curse to enemies hit. Aurora can **recast** this ability to recall the curse, dealing bonus magic damage to enemies it passes through, with damage scaling based on missing health. This allows for flexible offensive zoning and a subsequent burst of damage, especially on weakened foes.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora sends out a missile that curses any enemies it hits. She can then recast the ability to draw active curses back toward herself, damaging foes who are hit along the way. Fire cursed energy in a direction, dealing {{ damage }} magic damage to enemies and cursing them for {{ markduration }} seconds.

Recast: End the curse, drawing back part of the enemy's spirit to Aurora, dealing up to {{ q2damagemax }} magic damage to enemies passed through based on their missing Health. Damage beyond the first hit is reduced to 20%.

If the duration runs out, Aurora will automatically Recast the Ability.

abilities.name: Between Worlds
abilities.mechanics_description: **Aurora's "Between Worlds" (R):** This ability starts with a directional **skillshot dash** that deals damage and applies a slow. Upon landing, she creates a circular area; while this area persists, Aurora gains the ability to **recast** the ability to instantly **teleport** to any point on its opposite edge, also slowing enemies who enter or leave the zone. Between Worlds is primarily a **utility and engagement** tool, offering chase potential, disengage, repositioning, and crowd control.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora leaps in a direction of her choosing, releasing a shockwave that damages and slows any enemies it hits. Afterward, she creates an area that slows enemies within it and allows Aurora to teleport from one side of the area to the other. Leap in a direction. Upon landing, Aurora converges the realms, sending out a pulse of spirit energy that deals {{ damagecalc }} magic damage and Slows enemies hit by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% for 2 seconds.

The area of convergence stays active for {{ areaduration }} seconds, granting Aurora Realm Hopper for {{ rbuffduration }} seconds, allowing her to jump from one edge of the area to another.

Enemies attempting to enter or leave the area are Slowed by {{ exitslowpercent*-100 }}% for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

Aurora can Recast this Ability to end the effect early.

abilities.name: The Weirding
abilities.mechanics_description: **The Weirding (E):** This is a **skillshot** that fires a linear projectile in the direction Aurora is facing. It deals magic damage and applies a decaying slow to enemies hit, while Aurora simultaneously **hops backward** a short distance after casting. This ability is primarily used for **offensive zoning and disengage**, allowing Aurora to damage and slow enemies while creating space.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora converges the realms, sending out a blast of spirit magic that damages and slows enemies before Aurora hops backward to safety. Converge the realms, sending out a blast of spirit magic dealing {{ damagecalc }} magic damage to enemies in the area and Slowing them by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% decaying over {{ slowduration }} second.

Aurora hops backwards a short distance after casting.

abilities.name: Phenomenal Evil Power
abilities.mechanics_description: Veigar's passive, Phenomenal Evil Power, is an **auto-target granted effect**. It passively grants Veigar permanent Ability Power whenever he damages an enemy champion with an ability or lands the killing blow on any enemy unit. This passive is used **offensively** by scaling Veigar's damage output significantly throughout the game.
abilities.original_description: Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.

abilities.name: Baleful Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Baleful Strike is a linear skillshot that Veigar fires to deal damage to the first two enemies struck. It's primarily used offensively for damage and to permanently increase Veigar's Ability Power by killing units.
abilities.original_description:
Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently. Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the first two enemies hit.

If Veigar kills an enemy with this Ability, he gains {{ spell.veigarpassive:dqkillstacks }} stack of Phenomenal Evil. Large minions and large monsters grant {{ spell.veigarpassive:dqkillstackslarge }} stacks instead.

abilities.name: Dark Matter
abilities.mechanics_description: Dark Matter is a circular skillshot that Veigar launches. Upon landing, it deals magic damage in an area. Its primary use is for damage and wave clear, with its cooldown being reduced by Veigar's passive, Phenomenal Evil, as he gathers stacks.
abilities.original_description:
Veigar calls a great mass of dark matter to fall from the sky to the target location, dealing magic damage when it lands. Stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce Dark Matter's cooldown. Veigar summons dark matter from the sky, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

Every {{ spell.veigarpassive:pstacksperdarkmattercdr }} stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce this Ability's Cooldown by {{ spell.veigarpassive:darkmattercdrincrement*100 }}%.

abilities.name: Event Horizon
abilities.mechanics_description: Event Horizon is a circular skillshot that, upon activation, creates a hexagonal cage on the ground after a short delay. Enemies who touch the perimeter of the cage are **stunned**. It's primarily used defensively to peel for Veigar or offensively to trap and lock down targets for his burst damage.
abilities.original_description: Veigar twists the edges of space, creating a cage that Stuns enemies that pass through. Veigar twists the edges of space, creating a cage that <status>Stuns</status> enemies that pass through for {{ e1 }} seconds. The cage lasts for 3 seconds.

abilities.name: Primordial Burst
abilities.mechanics_description: Primordial Burst is a **single-target skillshot** that deals magic damage to an enemy champion. It is used **offensively for high burst damage**, which is significantly amplified against low-health targets.
abilities.original_description: Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health. Veigar blasts an enemy champion with primal magic to deal between <magicDamage>{{ mindamage }} and {{ maxdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, increasing with the target's missing Health. Damage is maximized against enemies below 33% Health.

abilities.name: Bloodlust
abilities.mechanics_description: Bloodlust is a point-and-click activation and passive ability. Its passive grants Tryndamere bonus Attack Damage based on his missing health, while its active consumes Fury to heal him, making it a versatile tool for both offensive sustain and survivability.
abilities.original_description:
Tryndamere thrives on the thrills of combat, increasing his Attack Damage as he is more and more wounded. He can cast Bloodlust to consume his Fury and heal himself. Passive: Tryndamere thirsts for blood, gaining {{ flatad }} Attack Damage plus {{ adperonepercentmissinghp }} per 1% missing Health.

Active: Tryndamere consumes his Fury, restoring {{ baseheal }} plus {{ healperfury }} Health per Fury.

abilities.name: Mocking Shout
abilities.mechanics_description: Mocking Shout is an **AoE ability** that **slows** enemies caught within its radius. It is used **defensively and for utility**, as it reduces the Attack Damage of *all* nearby enemy champions and slows those facing away from Tryndamere, disrupting enemy engages and allowing for escapes.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere lets out an insulting cry, decreasing surrounding champions' Attack Damage. Enemies with their backs turned to Tryndamere also have their Move Speed reduced. Tryndamere hurls insults, reducing champions' Attack Damage by {{ adreduction*-1 }} for {{ reductionduration }} seconds. Enemy champions with their backs towards Tryndamere are <status>Slowed</status> by {{ slowpotency*-100 }}% for the same duration.

abilities.name: Battle Fury
abilities.mechanics_description: Battle Fury is Tryndamere's passive ability. It **automatically generates Fury** as he auto-attacks enemies, lands critical strikes, or secures kills. This Fury **passively increases his critical strike chance**, and can be **expended by his Q, Bloodlust, to heal himself and deal bonus magic damage**, making it a crucial resource for both sustain and offensive pressure.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere gains Fury for each attack, critical strike, and killing blow he makes. Fury passively increases his Critical Strike Chance and can be consumed with his Bloodlust spell.

abilities.name: Undying Rage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Undying Rage (R)** is a **self-cast, instant ability** that Tryndamere uses defensively and offensively. During its duration, he is immune to dying, as his health cannot drop below 1, and he gains Fury, allowing him to continue fighting without fear of being taken down.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere's lust for battle becomes so strong that he is unable to die, no matter how wounded he becomes. Tryndamere becomes completely immune to death for {{ e3 }} seconds, refusing to be reduced below {{ e2 }} Health, and instantly gains <keywordMajor>{{ e1 }} Fury</keywordMajor>.

abilities.name: Spinning Slash
abilities.mechanics_description: Spinning Slash is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Tryndamere to **damage enemies in a line** towards his target, generating Fury. It is primarily used **offensively** for damage and to build Fury, with its cooldown being significantly reduced by critical strikes, especially on champions.
abilities.original_description:
Tryndamere slices toward a target unit, dealing damage to enemies in his path. Tryndamere spins through his enemies, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and generating {{ nonchampfurygain }} Fury per enemy hit, increased to {{ champfurygain }} Fury against enemy champions.

This Ability's Cooldown is reduced by {{ nonchampcdrefund }} second when Tryndamere critically strikes, and reduced by {{ champcdrefund }} seconds when critically striking a champion.

abilities.name: Rootcaller
abilities.mechanics_description: Rootcaller is a linear skillshot that damages and roots the first enemy hit. Allies can then dash to the rooted target, and Ivern can recast the ability to dash to them himself, offering both crowd control and engage utility.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern conjures a vine, dealing damage and rooting enemy targets hit. Ivern's allies can dash to the rooted target. Ivern conjures a vine dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Rooting the first enemy hit for {{ rootduration }} seconds. Allies that Attack a Rooted enemy dash into Attack Range.

Recast: Ivern dashes directly onto the Rooted enemy.

Hitting non-epic monsters reduces Rootcaller's cooldown by 50%.

abilities.name: Friend of the Forest
abilities.mechanics_description: Ivern's passive, Friend of the Forest, is an **auto-target utility** ability that allows him to create magical groves on jungle camps. Once these groves are fully grown, Ivern can interact with them to free the monsters, granting him gold and experience without directly damaging them, and also allowing his allies to benefit once the monsters are freed.
abilities.original_description: Ivern cannot attack or be attacked by non-epic monsters. Ivern can create magical groves on jungle camps which grow over time. When the grove is fully grown, Ivern may free the monsters to receive gold and experience.

abilities.name: Triggerseed
abilities.mechanics_description: Triggerseed is a targeted shield that, after a short delay, explodes to damage and slow enemies in an area. If the shield doesn't hit any enemy champions upon detonation, it reapplies itself to the ally, making it a potent defensive and utility tool for sustained shielding or disengage.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern places a shield on an ally which explodes after a short duration slowing and damaging enemies. The shield refreshes if it hits no enemies. Ivern grants {{ totalshield }} Shield to an ally champion or Daisy. After {{ shieldduration }} seconds, it bursts, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Slowing enemies by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

If Triggerseed detonates and no enemy champions are hit while the shield still persists, the ally will be shielded for {{ totalshield }} for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Brushmaker
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Ivern's W (Brushmaker):**

This ability has a passive component and an active component.

*   **Passive:** When Ivern is in brush (or recently left it), his basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. Nearby allies also gain this bonus magic damage for a shorter duration when Ivern is in brush.
*   **Active:** Ivern creates a circular patch of brush at a target location. This brush lasts for a set duration or until vision is lost within it.

**Mechanics and Usage:** Brushmaker is primarily a **utility** ability. The active component allows Ivern to create his own vision and escape routes, or ambush opponents. The passive synergizes with the active by empowering Ivern and his allies' auto-attacks while within the new or existing brush, offering both **offensive** and **defensive** benefits through evasiveness and bonus damage.
abilities.original_description:
In brush, Ivern and his nearby allies attacks deal bonus magic damage. Ivern can activate this ability to create a patch of brush. Passive: While in brush and for {{ buffduration }} seconds after leaving, Ivern's Attacks deal an additional {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. Nearby allies will gain this effect for {{ allybuffduration }} seconds and deal {{ totalallydamage }} magic damage.

Active: Ivern grows a patch of Brush, revealing the area for {{ revealduration }} seconds. The Brush persists until Ivern's team loses vision within it, or up to {{ maxbrushduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Daisy!
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Ivern's R - Daisy!**

*   **How to hit/use:** Daisy! is summoned at a target location (similar to a point-and-click placement). It can then be re-cast to command Daisy to move to a new target location or attack a specific enemy.
*   **How it is used:** Daisy! is used for both offensive and utility purposes. It acts as a controllable, highly mobile pet that deals damage and provides crowd control. Daisy's 3rd consecutive attack on the same target triggers a shockwave that deals magic damage and knocks up nearby enemies, offering a powerful engage or peel tool.

Daisy! is an auto-targetted summon that can be commanded to move or attack. Its primary usage is to provide additional damage and a potent area-of-effect knock-up on its third attack, serving as both an offensive threat and a defensive crowd control tool.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern summons his Sentinel friend Daisy to fight with him. Re-cast command Daisy to attack or move. Ivern summons his sentinel friend Daisy to leap into the fray for {{ daisyduration }} seconds.

Daisy, Slam!: Daisy's 3rd consecutive Attack on the same champion or epic monster will launch a shockwave, dealing {{ totalshockwavedamage }} magic damage to all enemies hit as well as Knocking Up for {{ shockwaveccduration }} second. This effect can only occur once every {{ shockwavecd }} seconds.

Recast: Instruct Daisy to Attack or move.

abilities.name: Arcanopulse
abilities.mechanics_description: Arcanopulse is a linear skillshot that Xerath charges to increase its range and damage. It's used offensively to deal magic damage and poke enemies from a safe distance.
abilities.original_description:
Fires a long-range beam of energy, dealing magic damage to all targets hit. Begin Charging: Xerath begins charging an arcane beam, Slowing himself gradually up to 50%.

Release: Xerath fires the beam, dealing {{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage. The range increases with time charged.

abilities.name: Mana Surge
abilities.mechanics_description: **Mana Surge (Passive):** This is an **auto-target** ability that restores mana to Xerath when he hits an enemy champion with a basic attack. Killing a unit (minion, monster, or champion) reduces the cooldown of Mana Surge. It is used **defensively** to sustain mana for ability usage, allowing Xerath to cast more spells without running out of resource.
abilities.original_description: Xerath's basic attacks periodically restore Mana. Whenever Xerath kills a unit, this cooldown is reduced.

abilities.name: Shocking Orb
abilities.mechanics_description: Shocking Orb is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and stuns them. The stun duration increases based on the distance the orb travels before hitting its target, making it a tool for both **offensive damage and crowd control**, with longer-range applications offering more potent CC.
abilities.original_description: Deals magic damage to an enemy and stuns them. Xerath fires an orb of raw magic, <status>Stunning</status> the first enemy hit for up to {{ maxstunduration }} seconds based on distance travelled, and dealing <magicDamage>{{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Eye of Destruction
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Eye of Destruction (W)** is a circular skillshot that Xerath casts at a target location. It deals magic damage and applies a slow to all enemies hit, with a stronger slow and increased damage to those in the very center of the blast.

**Mechanics and Usage:**

*   **Type:** Circular Skillshot
*   **Usage:** Primarily offensive for damage and crowd control (slow). It's used to harass enemies, zone them out, or set up follow-up abilities. The sweet spot encourages accurate aiming for maximum impact.
abilities.original_description: Calls down a barrage of arcane energy, slowing and dealing magic damage to all enemies in an area. Targets in the middle receive additional damage and a stronger slow. Xerath calls down a blast of arcane energy, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. Enemies in the center take <magicDamage>{{ sweetspottotaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> instead and are <status>Slowed</status> by {{ sweetspotslowamount*100 }}%, decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Rite of the Arcane
abilities.mechanics_description: **Rite of the Arcane (R)** is a **linear skillshot** ability. Xerath **channels and can recast up to two more times**, launching powerful magical artillery for significant **offensive poke and burst damage** at extreme range.
abilities.original_description:
Xerath immobilizes himself and gains numerous long-range barrages. Xerath ascends to his true form and channels for {{ e1 }} seconds. During this time he may Recast up to {{ e2 }} times.

Recast: Xerath launches a magical artillery, dealing {{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage. For each champion hit, the artillery deals an additional {{ rampdamagecalc }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Damnation
abilities.mechanics_description: **Damnation (Passive):** Damnation is an auto-targeting passive ability. When an enemy dies within a radius of Thresh, a Soul will drop. Thresh automatically collects nearby Souls, permanently increasing his Armor and Ability Power without any active input needed.
abilities.original_description: Thresh can harvest the souls of enemies that die near him, permanently granting him Armor and Ability Power.

abilities.name: Flay
abilities.mechanics_description: Flay is a **linear skillshot** that Thresh swings in an arc. It can be used **offensively** to deal damage and apply a slow, or **defensively** to reposition enemies away from himself or allies.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh's attacks wind up, dealing more damage the longer he waits between attacks. When activated, Thresh sweeps his chain, knocking all enemies hit in the direction of the blow. Passive: Thresh's Attacks deal additional damage based on how long since he last Attacked. They deal between {{ pattackdamagemin }} and {{ pattackdamagemax }} magic damage.

Active: Thresh whips his chains, Pulling or Pushing enemies in the direction of the swing. Enemies hit are also Slowed by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e4 }} second and take {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Dark Passage
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Mechanics:** Dark Passage is a linear skillshot. Thresh throws his lantern a targetable distance.

**Usage:** Primarily a utility tool for mobility and defense. It allows allies to instantly dash to Thresh's location, enabling aggressive plays or escapes, and provides a temporary shield to both Thresh and the first ally to reach it.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh throws out a lantern that shields nearby allied Champions from damage. Allies can click the lantern to dash to Thresh. Thresh throws his lantern, allowing an ally to click on it to dash to Thresh.

The lantern also grants {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds to Thresh and the first ally champion to come in contact with it.

abilities.name: Death Sentence
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Death Sentence (Q) - Thresh Description:**

Death Sentence is a linear skillshot that, upon hitting an enemy champion, stuns them, deals magic damage, and pulls them towards Thresh. Thresh can then recast the ability to dash to their pulled location, making it a potent engage and pick tool.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh binds an enemy in chains and pulls them toward him. Activating this ability a second time pulls Thresh to the enemy. Thresh throws out his scythe, Stunning the first unit hit and Pulling them towards Thresh for {{ tauntlength }} seconds. The scythe does {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and also grants True Sight for the duration.

Thresh can Recast this Ability to pull himself to the enemy.

If this Ability hits, its Cooldown is reduced by {{ hitbonuscooldown }} seconds.

abilities.name: The Box
abilities.mechanics_description: **Thresh's "The Box" (R)** is a **circular skillshot** that deploys a large hexagonal cage of spectral walls around him. Each wall deals magic damage and applies a short slow; however, if an enemy champion breaks a wall, the remaining walls deal no further damage and their slow duration is halved. This ability is primarily used for **utility and crowd control**, creating a zone to trap enemies, peel for allies, or set up further engages by limiting enemy movement.
abilities.original_description: A prison of walls that slow and deal damage if broken. Thresh creates a prison of spectral walls, <status>Slowing</status> champions by {{ e3 }}% for {{ e2 }} seconds and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Walls break after one collision, and after one is broken, the rest deal no damage and <status>Slow</status> for half duration.

abilities.name: Blade's End
abilities.mechanics_description: Talon's passive, **Blade's End**, is an auto-target debuff applied by his basic attacks and *Rake* (Q). When a target accumulates 3 stacks of Wound, they take significant bonus damage over time. This passive is primarily used offensively to amplify Talon's burst damage and create kill pressure.
abilities.original_description: Talon's spells Wound champions and large monsters, stacking up to 3 times. When Talon attacks a champion with 3 stacks of Wound, they bleed for heavy damage over time.

abilities.name: Noxian Diplomacy
abilities.mechanics_description: Noxian Diplomacy is a **point-and-click** ability that Talon uses offensively. If used outside melee range, Talon will **dash** to the target before stabbing, dealing damage. If cast within melee range, it instead deals **critical damage**. Killing a target with this ability grants Talon health and a **cooldown refund**.
abilities.original_description:
Talon stabs the target unit. If they are within melee range, this attack deals critical damage. If they are outside melee range, Talon will leap at his target before stabbing them. Talon refunds some health and cooldown if this ability kills the target. Talon leaps to a target and deals {{ leapdamage }} physical damage. If used in melee range, this Ability instead critically strikes for {{ criticaldamage }} physical damage.

If this Ability kills the target, Talon restores {{ totalhealing }} Health and refunds {{ cooldownrefund*100 }}% of its Cooldown.

abilities.name: Rake
abilities.mechanics_description: **Rake (W)** is a **linear skillshot** that Talon throws forward, dealing physical damage to enemies it passes through. Upon returning to Talon, the blades deal increased physical damage and apply a **slow**, making it primarily an offensive tool for damage and setting up subsequent attacks.
abilities.original_description: Talon sends out a volley of daggers that then return back to him, dealing physical damage every time it passes through an enemy. The returning blades deal bonus damage and slow units hit. Talon tosses a volley of blades, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totalinitialdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. The blades then return to him, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totalreturndamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> by {{ movespeedslow*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second.

abilities.name: Shadow Assault
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Shadow Assault (R)** is a skillshot that Talon throws a ring of blades outward, becoming invisible and gaining movement speed. Upon reappearing, the blades return to Talon, dealing damage twice. He can also redirect the return to a target enemy if he cancels invisibility with an auto-attack or his Q.

**Mechanics:**

*   **Type:** Skillshot (circular outward, then inward)
*   **Usage:** Primarily offensive for burst damage, but the invisibility and movement speed also offer defensive repositioning and escape potential.
abilities.original_description:
Talon disperses a ring of blades and becomes Invisible while gaining additional Move Speed. When Talon emerges from Invisibility, the blades converge on his location. Each time the blades move, Shadow Assault deals physical damage to enemies hit by at least one blade. Talon disperses a ring of blades that deal {{ damage }} physical damage, gains {{ movespeed*100 }}% Move Speed, and becomes Invisible for {{ duration }} seconds.
