When the Invisibility ends, the blades return to Talon, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage again.

If Talon cancels the Invisibility with an Attack or with Noxian Diplomacy, the blades return to the target instead.

abilities.name: Assassin's Path
abilities.mechanics_description: Assassin's Path is a targeted dash that allows Talon to vault over any terrain or structure up to a set distance. It is primarily used for *mobility and repositioning* to chase down opponents, escape dangerous situations, or bypass obstacles, with the trade-off being a cooldown on the specific piece of terrain used.
abilities.original_description: Talon vaults over any terrain or structure, up to a max distance. This ability has a low cooldown, but puts the used terrain on a long cooldown. Talon vaults over the nearest terrain or structure. Talon cannot dash over the same terrain more than once every {{ wallcd }} seconds.

abilities.name: Arcane Mastery
abilities.mechanics_description: Ryze's passive, **Arcane Mastery**, is an auto-targeting bonus that enhances his offensive capabilities by increasing the damage of his abilities based on his bonus Mana. It also provides a defensive utility by converting Ability Power into bonus maximum Mana, indirectly increasing his survivability through Ryze's other Mana-scaling defensive abilities.
abilities.original_description: <mainText>Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.</mainText>

abilities.name: Realm Warp
abilities.mechanics_description: Realm Warp (R) is a **channeled skillshot** where Ryze designates a **target location** within a limited range. He then opens a portal at his current location and, after a brief channel, teleports himself and any nearby allied champions to the designated target location, making it a powerful **utility** tool for team repositioning.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Overload deals even more damage against targets with Flux.

On cast, Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location. Passive: Overload damage bonus against targets with Flux increased to {{ overloaddamagebonus }}%.

Active: Ryze opens a portal to another location. After {{ chargetimetooltip }} seconds, all allies near the portal are teleported to that location.

abilities.name: Overload
abilities.mechanics_description: Overload is a linear skillshot that damages the first enemy hit. Its primary use is offensive, dealing damage and consuming Flux to bounce to additional enemies, with a passive component that synergizes with Ryze's other abilities to grant movement speed when fully charged.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Ryze's other basic abilities reset the cooldown of Overload and charge a rune. When Ryze casts Overload with 2 runes charged, he gains a brief burst of Move Speed.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If the target has Flux on it, Overload deals extra damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux. Passive: Rune Prison and Spell Flux refresh this Ability's Cooldown and charge a rune for {{ runeduration }} seconds (max {{ maximumrunes }} runes).

Active: Ryze unleashes a blast, dealing {{ qdamagecalc }} magic damage to the first enemy hit. If the target has Flux on it, it is consumed, causing this Ability to deal {{ spell.ryzer:overloaddamagebonus }}% increased damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux.

Ryze also discharges all runes, granting Ryze {{ movementspeedamount }}% Move Speed for {{ movementspeedduration }} seconds if {{ maximumrunes }} runes were charged.

abilities.name: Rune Prison
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Rune Prison (W)** is a **skillshot** that Ryze fires in a **line**. It deals magic damage and applies a slow to the first enemy hit. If the target has Flux on them when hit, Rune Prison consumes the Flux and roots the target instead of slowing them.

**Usage:** Rune Prison is primarily used for offensive CC, either to set up further combos with Flux or to lock down a target. It also offers defensive utility by providing a root to disengage from threats.
abilities.original_description: Ryze traps a target in a cage of runes, damaging them and slowing their movement. If the target has Flux on it, they are instead rooted. Ryze deals <magicDamage>{{ wdamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slows</status> by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ ccduration }} seconds. If the target has <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor>, it is consumed and this Ability <status>Roots</status> instead of <status>Slowing</status>.

abilities.name: Spell Flux
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Spell Flux (E) - Ryze**

**Mechanics:** Spell Flux is a targeted skillshot that damages the primary target and applies a debuff called **Flux** to them and nearby enemies. If an enemy already affected by Flux is hit by Spell Flux again, the debuff spreads to more nearby enemies.

**Usage:** Spell Flux is primarily used offensively to deal damage and apply the essential Flux debuff, which enhances Ryze's other abilities, enabling his combo-based playstyle.
abilities.original_description: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs all nearby enemies. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy. Ryze fires an orb, dealing <magicDamage>{{ edamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> and applies <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> for {{ debuffduration }} seconds to the target and nearby enemies. Enemies already afflicted with <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> will cause it to spread further.

abilities.name: Siphon Power
abilities.mechanics_description: Siphon Power is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit. It also grants Viktor a shield and empowers his next basic attack to deal bonus magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor blasts an enemy unit with magic damage, which grants him a shield and empowers his next basic attack.

Augment: Siphon Power's shield is increased by 60% and Viktor gains bonus move speed after casting the Ability.
Viktor blasts an enemy, dealing {{ totalmissiledamage }} magic damage and granting Viktor {{ shieldlevelscaling }} Shield for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

Viktor's next Attack within 4 seconds deals {{ attacktotaldmg }} magic damage.

Upgraded: Grants {{ totalaugmentedshieldvalue }} Shield and Viktor additionally gains {{ augmentmovespeedbonus }}% Move Speed for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Glorious Evolution
abilities.mechanics_description: Viktor's passive, Glorious Evolution, is an **auto-targeting buff** that permanently augments his abilities as he accumulates Hex Fragments from enemy kills. It's used **offensively and for utility**, with each augmentation enhancing an ability's damage, range, or adding new effects.
abilities.original_description: Viktor gains Hex Fragments whenever he kills an enemy. With every 100 Hex Fragments he obtains, Viktor permanently augments an active ability. After upgrading all of his basic abilities, he can gather 100 Hex Fragments to augment his ultimate ability.

abilities.name: Gravity Field
abilities.mechanics_description: Gravity Field is a **circular skillshot** that deploys a zone. It's used for **offensive crowd control** to slow and potentially stun enemies, and for the Augment, it adds a **debuff slow** to all of Viktor's abilities.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor conjures a heavy gravitational field that slows enemies caught within its radius. Enemies who stay in the field for too long become stunned.

Augment: Viktor's spells apply a slow to enemies.
Viktor deploys a gravitational imprisonment device for {{ fieldduration }} seconds, Slowing enemies inside it by {{ slowpotency*-1 }}%. Enemies who remain within its radius for 1.25 seconds are Stunned for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

Upgraded Passive: Viktor's Abilities Slow by {{ augmentslow }}% for 1 second.

abilities.name: Hextech Ray
abilities.mechanics_description: Hextech Ray is a linear skillshot that damages all enemies it passes through. It is primarily used offensively for damage and wave clear, with the Augment adding a powerful area-of-effect burst upon impact.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor uses his biomechanical arm to fire a Hextech Ray that cuts across the field in a line, dealing damage to all enemies in its path.

Augment: An explosion follows in the Hextech Ray's wake, dealing magic damage.
Viktor fires a hextech ray in a chosen direction, dealing {{ laserdamage }} magic damage to any enemies it hits.

Upgraded: An aftershock follows Hextech Ray, dealing {{ aftershockdamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Arcane Storm
abilities.mechanics_description: **Viktor's R - Chaos Storm** is a semi-autonomous circular skillshot that can be manually repositioned. It deals initial burst magic damage to all enemies within its area, then continuously damages and *slows* nearby enemies. After casting, the storm will automatically follow any champions it has recently damaged for a short duration, but Viktor can recasting the ability to forcibly reposition it to a new target location.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor conjures an Arcane Storm on the field, dealing magic damage and interrupting enemy channels. The storm periodically does magic damage to all nearby enemies and can be redirected by Viktor.

Augment: The Arcane Storm moves 25% faster, and whenever champions die after taking damage from it, the storm grows and increases in its duration.

Viktor conjures an Arcane Storm in an area for {{ stormduration }} seconds, which instantly deals {{ initialburstdamage }} magic damage followed by {{ subsequentburstdamage }} magic damage per second to surrounding enemies. The storm automatically follows champions it has recently damaged.

Recast: Viktor can manually move the storm.

Upgraded: The storm moves {{ augmentboost*100 }}% faster. If a champion that the storm has damaged dies, the storm increases its size and its duration by {{ tooltip_durationextension }} seconds (up to {{ maxgrowths }} times).

abilities.name: Vow of the First Lands
abilities.mechanics_description: "Vow of the First Lands" is a passive ability that *automatically* enhances Yunara's auto-attacks. Every critical strike she lands triggers bonus magic damage, making her attacks more potent offensively.
abilities.original_description: Yunara's Critical Strikes deal bonus magic damage.

abilities.name: Cultivation of Spirit
abilities.mechanics_description: Yunara's Q, **Cultivation of Spirit**, is a **passive ability** that grants her bonus on-hit magic damage and causes her attacks to spread to nearby enemies. Its active component, **Transcendent State**, is an **instantaneous, short duration buff** that consumes "Unleash" to dramatically increase her Attack Speed and enhanced on-hit damage, causing her attacks to cleave in a wider area. This ability is primarily used offensively for sustained damage and wave clear.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara gains Attack Speed, bonus damage On-Hit, and her Attacks spread to nearby enemies. Passive: Yunara deal {{ calc_passive_damage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% On-Hit and attacking grants {{ resource_nonchampion }} Unleash ({{ resource_champion }} Unleash for champions).

Active: Yunara consumes {{ resource_max }} Unleash and for {{ buff_duration }} seconds gains {{ calc_attack_speed }} Attack Speed and deals an additional {{ calc_damage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% On-Hit. During this time, her Attacks spread to nearby enemies dealing them {{ calc_damage_spread }} physical damage.

Transcendent State: This Ability is instantly activated for {{ spell.yunarar:buff_duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Transcend One's Self
abilities.mechanics_description: Yunara's ultimate is a **self-buff** that, upon activation, upgrades her other basic abilities for a set duration. This allows her to utilize enhanced versions of her Q, W, and E abilities for increased damage, utility, or defensive capabilities during a fight.
abilities.original_description: Yunara enters a Transcendent State that upgrades her basic Abilities. Yunara enters a <keywordMajor>Transcendent State</keywordMajor> for {{ buff_duration }} seconds upgrading her basic Abilities for the duration.

abilities.name: Arc of Judgment | Arc of Ruin
abilities.mechanics_description: Arc of Judgment is a **linear skillshot** that deals initial magic damage and a decaying slow to enemies hit. While in her Transcendent State, Arc of Ruin functions similarly but fires a **laser** that deals more damage and a stronger decaying slow. This ability is primarily used **offensively** to damage and control enemy positioning.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara fires a spinning prayer bead that deals damage and slows enemies. While in her Transcendent State she instead fires off a laser that deals damage and slows enemies. Yunara lets rip a prayer bead that deals {{ calc_damage_initial }} magic damage and Slows by {{ calc_slow }} decaying over {{ slow_duration }} seconds. It deals an additional {{ calc_damage_per_second }} magic damage per second.

Transcendent State - Arc of Ruin: Yunara fires a laser that deals {{ spell.yunarar:calc_rw_damage }} magic damage and Slows by {{ spell.yunarar:calc_rw_slow_amount }} decaying over {{ spell.yunarar:rw_slow_duration }} second.

abilities.name: Kanmei's Steps | Untouchable Shadow
abilities.mechanics_description: "Kanmei's Steps | Untouchable Shadow" (E) is a command-activated dash ability. When *not* in her Transcendent State, Yunara uses it to gain decaying movement speed, making her Ghosted for better positioning or escape. While in her Transcendent State, it becomes a directional dash that can be aimed to engage or reposition aggressively.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara gains decaying Move Speed and becomes Ghosted. While in her Transcendent State she instead dashes in a direction. Yunara gains {{ calc_move_speed }} Move Speed, increased to {{ calc_move_speed_enhanced }} Move Speed when moving toward an enemy champion, that decays over {{ buff_duration }} seconds.

Transcendent State - Untouchable Shadow: Yunara dashes in a direction.

abilities.name: Lunge
abilities.mechanics_description: Fiora's **Lunge (Q)** is a directional dash that allows her to stab the *closest* enemy, ward, or structure. It's primarily used offensively to deal damage and apply on-hit effects, with a significant cooldown reduction on hit making it a core tool for her mobility, engage, and sustained damage.
abilities.original_description:
Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects. Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs the closest enemy, ward, or structure, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. The strike will prioritize Vitals and enemies it will kill.

If Fiora strikes an enemy, this Ability's Cooldown is reduced by {{ cdrefundpercent*100 }}%.

abilities.name: Riposte
abilities.mechanics_description: Riposte (W) is a **point-and-click defensive stance** that, if activated successfully within its brief parry window, allows Fiora to **stab forward** in a chosen direction. This stab deals magic damage and applies a slow to the first enemy champion hit. If Fiora parries an **immobilizing crowd control effect**, the stab will instead **stun** the target.
abilities.original_description: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability. Fiora parries all incoming damage, disables, and negative effects for {{ parryduration }} seconds, then stabs. The stab deals <magicDamage>{{ stabdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to the first champion hit and <status>Slows</status> <speed>Move Speed</speed> by {{ msslowpercent*-100 }}%<attackSpeed> and Attack Speed by {{ attackslowpercent*-100 }}% </attackSpeed> for {{ ccduration }} seconds. If Fiora parries an <status>Immobilizing</status> effect, the stabbed enemy is <status>Stunned</status> rather than <status>Slowed</status>.

abilities.name: Bladework
abilities.mechanics_description: **Bladework (E)** is an **auto-attack reset** ability that Fiora uses offensively. Upon activation, her next two attacks gain bonus attack speed. The first auto-attack in this sequence slows the target, while the second auto-attack will critically strike for significantly increased damage.
abilities.original_description: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike. Fiora gains <attackSpeed>{{ aspercent*100 }}% Attack Speed</attackSpeed> for her next two Attacks. The first Attack <status>Slows</status> by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second. The second Attack always critically strikes for <physicalDamage>{{ attacktwopercenttad*100 }}% damage</physicalDamage>.

abilities.name: Duelist's Dance
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Duelist's Dance (Passive)**

*   **How to hit/use:** Fiora's passive automatically targets and highlights one of four Vitals on nearby enemy champions. These Vitals are specific points on the enemy's body that appear as clickable weak spots.
*   **How it is used:** Upon hitting a Vital with an attack or ability, Fiora restores health and gains a temporary burst of movement speed. This makes it a crucial tool for both sustaining in extended trades and kiting or chasing opponents.
abilities.original_description: Fiora has revealed a <keywordMajor>Vital</keywordMajor> on this Champion. If she hits the <keywordMajor>Vital</keywordMajor>, she <healing>restores Health</healing> and gains <speed>Move Speed</speed>.

abilities.name: Grand Challenge
abilities.mechanics_description: **Grand Challenge (R)** is a point-and-click ability that Fiora uses on a single enemy champion. It reveals all four of their Vitals, granting Fiora bonus movement speed when near the target. Successfully striking all four Vitals within the duration, or killing the target after hitting at least one, provides Fiora and nearby allies with sustained healing.
abilities.original_description:
Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains Move Speed while near them. If Fiora hits all four Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds. Passive: Duelist's Dance Move Speed bonus is increased to {{ percentms*100 }}%.

Active: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on a champion for a max of {{ spell.fiorapassive:rdamagetotal }} max Health true damage and gains Duelist's Dance's Move Speed bonus while near the target.

If Fiora strikes all four Vitals within {{ markduration }} seconds or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora restores {{ healpersecondcalc }} Health per second to surrounding allied champions for {{ healduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Shurima's Legacy
abilities.mechanics_description: Shurima's Legacy is a **passive** ability that allows Azir to **summon a Disc of the Sun** on the ground near the ruins of any turret. This disc functions similarly to a **summoned unit** that Azir can command to attack enemies. It is used **offensively** to provide additional sustained damage and zone control.
abilities.original_description: Azir can summon the Disc of the Sun from the ruins of allied or enemy turrets.

abilities.name: Conquering Sands
abilities.mechanics_description: Conquering Sands is a **skillshot** ability. Azir commands his Sand Soldiers to dash in a straight line, dealing magic damage and applying a brief slow to enemies they pass through. This ability is primarily used **offensively** to poke, set up engages with the slow, or to help clear waves.
abilities.original_description: Azir sends all Sand Soldiers towards a location. Sand Soldiers deal magic damage to enemies they pass through and apply a slow for 1 second. Azir orders all <keywordMajor>Sand Soldiers</keywordMajor> to an area, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to enemies they pass through and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ e2 }}% for 1 second.

abilities.name: Arise!
abilities.mechanics_description: Arise! is a **targeted ability** (clicking on the ground) that summons a Sand Soldier for a duration. Azir can then **auto-attack** targets within the soldier's range, causing the soldier to also attack, replicating Azir's attack with bonus magic damage in a line. This ability is primarily used **offensively** to extend Azir's auto-attack range and deal additional damage, and it can also be used **defensively** to zone enemies or create a barrier with multiple soldiers.
abilities.original_description:
Azir summons a Sand Soldier to attack nearby targets for him, replacing his basic attack against targets within the soldier's range. Their attacks deal magic damage to enemies in a line. Azir summons a Sand Soldier for {{ e1 }} seconds. When Azir Attacks an enemy near a Sand Soldier, he instead orders the soldiers to stab, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage in their direction.

This Ability has {{ maxammo }} charges.

abilities.name: Emperor's Divide
abilities.mechanics_description: Emperor's Divide is a **linear skillshot** that Azir activates by targeting a location. It **knocks back enemies hit by the charging soldiers and deals magic damage**, serving as both **offensive crowd control and a zoning tool** to block enemy paths.
abilities.original_description: Azir summons a wall of soldiers which charge forward, knocking back and damaging enemies. Azir summons a wall of armored soldiers that charges forward, <status>Knocking Back</status> enemies and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. The soldiers remain, blocking enemy paths for {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Shifting Sands
abilities.mechanics_description: Shifting Sands is a **targeted dash** that Azir uses to displace himself to a nearby Sand Soldier. It deals magic damage to enemies passed through and breaks the dash, preventing further movement. If Azir hits an enemy champion during the dash, he gains a Sand Soldier charge, making it a tool for both **mobility** and **damage**, with potential for **engage** or **disengage**.
abilities.original_description:
Azir shields himself briefly and dashes to one of his Sand Soldiers, damaging enemies. If he hits an enemy champion, he instantly readies a new Sand Soldier for deployment and halts his dash. Azir grants himself {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ e6 }} seconds and dashes to one of his Sand Soldiers, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to enemies he passes through.

If Azir hits an enemy champion, he stops and gains a Sand Soldier charge.

abilities.name: Paddle Star!
abilities.mechanics_description: **Paddle Star! (Q):** This is a **skillshot** that Zoe can **recast** to change its trajectory. It deals increasing damage based on its flight distance to the first enemy hit and splash damage to nearby enemies, primarily used for **offensive damage and burst**.
abilities.original_description:
Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight. Deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line. Zoe fires a star that deals increasing damage the further it travels to the first enemy hit and surrounding enemies -- between {{ totaldamagetooltip }} to {{ maxdamagetooltip }} magic damage.

Zoe can Recast this Ability to redirect the missile to a new position near Zoe.

abilities.name: More Sparkles!
abilities.mechanics_description:
**More Sparkles! (Passive)**

*   **How to hit/use:** Auto-target. This passive applies to Rumble's *next* basic attack after he casts an ability.
*   **How it is used:** Offensively (damage). It adds bonus magic damage to his auto-attack, enhancing his burst potential.

**Improved Description:**

Zoe's next auto-attack after casting any spell will automatically target an enemy and deal bonus magic damage, enhancing her burst damage.
abilities.original_description: Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.

abilities.name: Sleepy Trouble Bubble
abilities.mechanics_description: Zoe's E, "Sleepy Trouble Bubble," is a **skillshot** that travels in a straight line. It is used **offensively** for its ability to CC targets with sleep, debuff their Magic Resist, and enable a powerful double-damage burst on the first hit that wakes them.
abilities.original_description:
Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. While asleep, the target's Magic Resist is reduced. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap. Zoe dropkicks a bubble that deals {{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage, lingering as a trap if it hits nothing. The bubble's range is extended when flying over terrain.

After a delay, the victim falls Asleep and have their Magic Resist reduced by {{ percentpen*100 }}% for 2 seconds. Attacks and Ability hits wake them up but deal double damage, up to {{ breakdamagetooltip }} true damage.

abilities.name: Spell Thief
abilities.mechanics_description: Spell Thief is an **auto-target pickup ability** that allows Zoe to collect spell shards dropped by enemies using Summoner Spells or Active Items, or from specific minions. She can then **recast the collected ability once** for utility or damage, and whenever she casts a Summoner Spell, she gains bonus movement speed and unleashes 3 homing missiles that deal magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target. Passive: Enemies drop spell shards when casting a Summoner Spell or using an Active Item. Specific minions also drop a spell shard when Zoe or a nearby ally kills them. Zoe can pick up this shard to cast that ability once.

Passive: When Zoe casts this Ability or any Summoner Spell, she gains {{ e9 }}% Move Speed for {{ e0 }} seconds and tosses 3 missiles at the target she Attacked most recently. These missiles deal {{ missiledamagetooltip }} magic damage each.

Active: Cast the Ability from a spell shard Zoe has picked up.

abilities.name: Portal Jump
abilities.mechanics_description: **Portal Jump (R)** is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Zoe to blink to a target location within a small radius for 1 second. While in her phased state, Zoe can cast abilities and auto-attack, but cannot move. This ability is primarily used for **offensive burst** by enabling safe positioning to land crucial abilities, and secondarily for **defensive repositioning** or baiting enemy cooldowns.
abilities.original_description: Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back. Zoe teleports to a nearby position for 1 second. Afterwards, she teleports back. Zoe can use Abilities and Attack, but can't move during this time.

abilities.name: Relentless Assault
abilities.mechanics_description: Relentless Assault is a passive ability that does not require active casting. It automatically grants Jax bonus Attack Speed on his next basic attack after hitting an enemy with a basic attack. This is used offensively to increase Jax's sustained damage output and attack speed for extended combat.
abilities.original_description: Jax's consecutive basic attacks continuously increase his Attack Speed.

abilities.name: Leap Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: **Leap Strike (Q)** is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Jax to leap to any allied or enemy unit, including minions, monsters, champions, and wards. If Jax leaps to an enemy unit, he **deals physical damage**. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for gap closing and damage, but can also be used **defensively** to escape by leaping to a friendly unit or ward.
abilities.original_description: Jax leaps toward a unit. If they are an enemy, he strikes them with his weapon. Jax leaps to a friendly or enemy unit or ward, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> if it is an enemy.

abilities.name: Empower
abilities.mechanics_description: Jax activates Empower (W) as an **auto-attack reset**, allowing him to cast it instantly after his next basic attack. This ability is primarily used **offensively** to significantly increase his burst damage on a single target.
abilities.original_description: Jax charges his weapon with energy, causing his next attack to deal additional damage. Jax charges his weapon with energy, causing his next Attack or <spellName>Leap Strike</spellName> to deal an additional <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Grandmaster-at-Arms
abilities.mechanics_description: Grandmaster-at-Arms is an **auto-target** ability that enhances Jax's combat. Its passive makes his **third consecutive attack deal bonus magic damage**, while its active allows him to **slam his lantern downwards, dealing AoE magic damage** and granting him **significant bonus Armor and Magic Resist** if he hits champions. The active also changes the passive to apply to every **second attack** instead of every third, maintaining offensive pressure.
abilities.original_description:
Every third consecutive attack deals additional Magic Damage. Additionally, Jax can activate this ability to deal damage around himself and strengthen his resolve, increasing his Armor and Magic Resist for a short duration. Passive: Every third Attack within {{ passivefallofftime }} seconds deals an additional {{ onhitdamage }} magic damage.

Active: Jax slams his lantern down, dealing {{ swingdamagetotal }} magic damage to nearby enemies. If he hits a champion he gains {{ basearmor }} Armor and {{ basemr }} Magic Resist plus {{ bonusarmor }} Armor and {{ bonusmr }} Magic Resist per additional champion hit for {{ duration }} seconds. During this time every second Attack deals additional magic damage instead of every third.

abilities.name: Counter Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: **Counter Strike (E)** is activated by Jax and has a short cast time before entering a defensive stance. While in this stance, Jax dodges all basic attacks and takes reduced damage from area-of-effect abilities for its duration. Upon recasting or when the duration ends, Jax unleashes a magic damage attack that stuns nearby enemies, with the damage increased based on the number of basic attacks dodged during the stance.
abilities.original_description:
Jax's combat prowess allows him to dodge all incoming attacks for a short duration and then quickly counterattack, stunning all surrounding enemies. Jax enters a defensive stance for up to {{ dodgeduration }} seconds, dodging incoming Attacks and taking {{ aoedamagereduction }}% less damage from area of effect Abilities. After {{ dodgeduration }} seconds or Recasting, Jax deals {{ totaldamage }} + {{ percenthealthdamage }}% max Health magic damage and Stuns nearby enemies for {{ stunduration }} second.

The damage is increased by {{ percentincreasedperdodge*100 }}% per Attack dodged, up to a maximum of {{ maxdamage }} + {{ maxpercenthealthdamage }}% max Health.

abilities.name: Savagery
abilities.mechanics_description: Savagery is a **point-and-click** empowered auto-attack that deals bonus damage. Its empowered **Ferocity** version deals significantly more damage, critically strikes on the first hit, and grants bonus attack speed for a short duration.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar's next Attack brutally stabs his target for bonus damage.

Ferocity effect: deals increased damage and grants Attack Speed. Rengar's next 2 Attacks gain {{ e5 }}% Attack Speed. The first Attack critically strikes for {{ F4 }} (%i:scaleAD%%i:scaleCrit%) physical damage.

Max Ferocity: The first Attack critically strikes for {{ F5 }} (%i:scaleLevel%%i:scaleAD%%i:scaleCrit%) physical damage and grants Rengar {{ empoweredqas }} Attack Speed for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Unseen Predator
abilities.mechanics_description: **Unseen Predator (Passive):** Rengar's basic attacks **from brush** transform into a **dash** that deals damage. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for gap-closing and burst damage, while also passively generating **Ferocity** from other abilities to empower his next jump or spell.
abilities.original_description:
While in Brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack.

Rengar generates Ferocity whenever he casts an ability. At Max Ferocity, his next ability is empowered.

Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, granting bonus attack damage.

abilities.name: Bola Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: **Rengar's Bola Strike (E)** is a linear skillshot that damages and slows the first enemy hit. When empowered by Ferocity, it deals increased damage and roots the target instead of slowing.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar throws a bola, slowing the first target hit for a short duration.

Ferocity effect: roots the target. Rengar throws a bola, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to the first enemy hit, revealing and Slowing them by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds.

Max Ferocity: Deals {{ totalempowereddamage }} physical damage and Roots for {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Battle Roar
abilities.mechanics_description: **Battle Roar (W)** is a point-and-click AoE ability that Rengar uses offensively for damage and defensively for healing based on recent damage taken. When empowered by Ferocity, it also breaks crowd control effects.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar lets out a battle roar, damaging enemies and healing for some of the recent damage he has taken.

Ferocity effect: additionally breaks crowd control effects. Rengar roars, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to nearby enemies and restoring {{ damagepercentagehealed }}% of the damage taken in the last {{ e3 }} seconds as Health.

Max Ferocity: Deals {{ totaldamageempowered }} magic damage and additionally cleanses Rengar of crowd control.

abilities.name: Thrill of the Hunt
abilities.mechanics_description: **Thrill of the Hunt (R)** is a **self-cast** ability that makes Rengar **invisible** and **reveals the nearest enemy champion** within a large radius. While active, Rengar gains **bonus movement speed** and can **leap to the revealed target**, dealing bonus damage, reducing their armor, and breaking his stealth. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for engagement, assassination, and gap closing.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar's predatory instincts take over, Camouflaging him and revealing the nearest enemy champion in a large radius around him. During Thrill of the Hunt, Rengar gains Move Speed and he can leap to the tracked enemy without being in brush, reducing their armor. Passive: Rengar will also leap Attack when Camouflaged.

Active: Rengar gains {{ stealthms }}% Move Speed and True Sight in a small area around the nearest enemy champion for {{ stealthduration }} seconds.

After {{ fadetime }} seconds, Rengar becomes Camouflaged and can leap without being in Brush. Leaping to the nearest champion deals an additional {{ bonusdamage }} physical damage, shreds {{ armorshred }} Armor for {{ armorshredduration }} seconds, and ends this Ability.

abilities.name: Rock Surfing
abilities.mechanics_description: **Rock Surfing (Passive):** Taliyah gains a significant burst of decaying Movement Speed when she **approaches or moves away from terrain**. This passive is passively triggered by proximity to walls and is primarily used **defensively** to reposition, escape danger, or close gaps quickly.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah gains Move Speed near walls.

abilities.name: Seismic Shove
abilities.mechanics_description: Seismic Shove is a **skillshot** that Taliyah **blasts** enemies in a targeted direction. It's primarily used for **utility and crowd control**, as it **knocks enemies back**, allowing Taliyah to reposition her enemies or create space for herself and her team.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah causes an area of ground to erupt and throws enemies within it in a direction of her choosing. Taliyah quakes the earth, <status>Knocking</status> enemies in an area in the chosen direction.

abilities.name: Threaded Volley
abilities.mechanics_description: Threaded Volley is a linear skillshot that throws a volley of 5 rocks, dealing magic damage in an area. If cast on "Worked Ground" (created by the ability itself or her ultimate), it consumes the ground to launch a single, stronger boulder that slows enemies and deals more damage, with a reduced cooldown and mana cost. This ability is primarily used offensively for poke and wave clear, with the boulder providing a valuable slow for setting up plays or escaping.
abilities.original_description:
Taliyah throws a volley of rocks in a target direction, moving freely as she casts. This creates Worked Ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on Worked Ground, she consumes the ground to throw a stronger boulder that slows enemies. Taliyah hurls 5 rocks, each dealing {{ rockdamage }} magic damage in an area around the first enemy hit while creating Worked Ground at that area. Subsequent hits against the same enemy deal {{ extramissilereduceddamagepercent }}% less damage.

Casts on worked ground cost {{ e7 }} Mana and have {{ workedgroundcdr*100 }}% less Cooldown, consume the Worked Ground, and hurl a boulder that Slows enemies it hits by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds, dealing {{ bigrockdamage }} magic damage to the primary target. Monsters hit by the boulder are Stunned for {{ monsterstunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Unraveled Earth
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Unraveled Earth (E)** is a **skillshot** ability that lays down a minefield in a target area. The mines deal initial magic damage and apply a slow. Enemies who **dash or are knocked** through the area will trigger a mine, stunning them for the remaining dash/knockup duration plus a fixed stun duration, and dealing additional magic damage.

This ability is primarily used **offensively and for utility**, serving as a zoning tool to punish aggressive enemy dashes or to set up crowd control for Taliyah or her allies.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah creates a slowing minefield. If enemies dash through it or are knocked through it, the mines explode and stun them. Taliyah scatters loose stones in an area, <status>Slowing</status> enemies hit by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% and dealing <magicDamage>{{ scatterdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. The stones detonate when enemies dash or are <status>Knocked</status> through them, <status>Stunning</status> for the remaining movement duration + {{ stunduration }} seconds and dealing <magicDamage>{{ detonationdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Weaver's Wall
abilities.mechanics_description: **Taliyah's Weaver's Wall (R)** is a linear skillshot that creates a massive, impassable wall that travels a significant distance. She can then recast the ability to surf along this wall, gaining movement speed and stopping if she collides with enemy champions or is immobilized. Weaver's Wall is primarily used for utility, such as sectioning off areas of the map, enabling aggressive engages by trapping enemies, or providing escape routes for her team.
abilities.original_description:
Taliyah creates a very long wall and then surfs it. Taliyah creates a massive earthen wall for {{ e1 }} seconds. If she immediately Recasts, she will ride along the wall as it unravels. Moving or being immobilized will end the ride.

This ability cannot be cast if Taliyah has taken damage from Champions or structures within the last {{ damagelockouttime }} seconds.

abilities.name: Night Hunter
abilities.mechanics_description: "Night Hunter" is **auto-target only** and has **no active cast**. It provides a **defensive and utility buff**: Vayne gains bonus Movement Speed when moving towards any nearby enemy champion.
abilities.original_description: Vayne ruthlessly hunts evil-doers, gaining Move Speed when moving toward nearby enemy champions.

abilities.name: Tumble
abilities.mechanics_description: **Tumble (Q)** is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Vayne to reposition a short distance. It is primarily used **offensively** to dodge incoming abilities and immediately follow up with an empowered auto-attack that deals bonus physical damage.
abilities.original_description:
Vayne tumbles, maneuvering to carefully place her next shot. Her next attack deals bonus damage. Vayne rolls a short distance, and deals an additional {{ adratiobonus }} physical damage on her next Attack.

This Ability triggers spell effects upon dealing damage.

abilities.name: Silver Bolts
abilities.mechanics_description: Silver Bolts is a passive ability. It triggers on Vayne's third consecutive basic attack or ability cast against the same target. This empowers her third hit to deal bonus **true damage** based on a percentage of the target's maximum health, making it an offensive tool for sustained damage and bursting down tankier enemies.
abilities.original_description: Vayne tips her bolts with a rare metal, toxic to evil things. The third consecutive attack or ability against the same target deals a percentage of the target's max health as bonus true damage. <spellPassive>Passive</spellPassive>: Every third consecutive Attack or Ability against an enemy deals an additional <trueDamage>{{ totaldamage }} max Health true damage</trueDamage>.

abilities.name: Condemn
abilities.mechanics_description: Condemn is a **linear skillshot** that knocks back the first enemy hit. Its primary use is to **physically displace enemies** and set up a **stun** by hitting them into terrain for bonus damage and crowd control.
abilities.original_description: Vayne draws a heavy crossbow from her back, and fires a huge bolt at her target, knocking them back and dealing damage. If they collide with terrain, they are impaled, dealing bonus damage and stunning them. Vayne fires a bolt that <status>Knocks Back</status> and deals <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. If the target collides with terrain, they take <physicalDamage>{{ empowereddamagett }} bonus physical damage</physicalDamage> and become <status>Stunned</status> for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Final Hour
abilities.mechanics_description: **Final Hour (R)** is a **buff** ability that Vayne **activates**. Upon activation, it grants her bonus Attack Damage and makes her **invisible for a short duration** after using her **Tumble (Q)**. It also reduces Tumble's cooldown and provides bonus movement speed. This makes Final Hour primarily an **offensive** tool for Vayne, allowing her to initiate fights with surprise attacks, chase down enemies, or reposition safely during combat.
abilities.original_description: Readying herself for an epic confrontation, Vayne gains increased Attack Damage, Invisibility during Tumble, reduced Tumble cooldown, and more bonus Move Speed from Night Hunter Vayne gains <physicalDamage>{{ bonusattackdamage }} Attack Damage</physicalDamage> for {{ baseduration }} seconds, extended by {{ durationtoadd }} seconds whenever a champion damaged by Vayne dies within {{ damagedmarkerduration }} seconds. Additionally, during the duration:<li><spellName>Night Hunter</spellName> instead grants <speed>{{ movementspeed }} Move Speed</speed>.<li>The Cooldown of <spellName>Tumble</spellName> is reduced by {{ tumblecdreduction }}%, and grants <keywordStealth>Invisibility</keywordStealth> for {{ tumblestealthduration }} second.

abilities.name: Shepherd of Souls
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick summons Mist Walkers when he kills enemy units, which then automatically attack nearby enemies. This passive allows Yorick to build up a swarm of minions to deal sustained damage and apply pressure to objectives or enemy champions.
abilities.original_description: <font color='#FF9900'>The Cursed Horde:</font> Yorick can summon Mist Walkers to swarm and attack nearby enemies.

abilities.name: Eulogy of the Isles
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick's ultimate, **Eulogy of the Isles**, is a point-and-click summon ability. It creates the Maiden of the Mist, who aids Yorick by automatically raising Mist Walkers from enemy deaths she causes and marking champions. Yorick can then recast the ability after 10 seconds to send the Maiden forward down a lane for extended pressure.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist that causes Yorick's attacks against the Maiden's target to deal bonus damage. The Maiden will also automatically raise Walkers from dead enemies. Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist with {{ yorickbigghoulhealth }} Health and {{ yorickbigghouldamage }} Magic Attack Damage plus {{ rghoulnumbers }} Mist Walkers. The Maiden automatically raises Mist Walkers from nearby enemy deaths and marks enemy Champions with her attacks. When Yorick damages the Maiden's target, he deals {{ rmarkdamagepercent }}% max Health magic damage.

After 10 seconds, Yorick can Recast this Ability to free the Maiden, sending her down the nearest lane.

abilities.name: Last Rites
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick's Q, "Last Rites," is a point-and-click melee attack that deals bonus damage and heals him, leaving a "grave" on champions, large monsters, or when a unit dies to the attack. Yorick can recast Q near 3+ graves to summon Mist Walkers from them. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and sustain.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick deals bonus damage on his next attack and heals himself. If the target is a champion or large monster or if the target dies, a grave will be dug. Yorick's next Attack deals an additional {{ bonusdamage }} physical damage and restores {{ qheal }} plus {{ missinghealthratio }}% of his missing Health, reduced by {{ healreduction }}% against non-Champions. If this Attack hits a Champion or large Monster or kills the target, it leaves a grave.

When there are 3 or more graves nearby and this Ability has already been used, Yorick can Recast to raise Mist Walkers from all nearby graves.

abilities.name: Dark Procession
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dark Procession (W)** is a **circular skillshot** that Yorick uses primarily for **utility** and **utility/CC**. Upon activation, Yorick summons a ring of spectral mist at the target location. Enemies who touch the mist are briefly **impaired** (rooted) and take maigcal damage, while allies are unaffected. The wall then solidifies for a duration, physically blocking both enemy and allied movement but can be destroyed by enemies.
abilities.original_description: Yorick summons a destructible wall at target location that will block enemy movement. Yorick summons a wall of spirits blocking enemies' path, but not allies'. The wall has <healing>{{ wallhealthtooltip }} Health</healing> and disappears after {{ circleduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Mourning Mist
abilities.mechanics_description: **Mourning Mist (E)** is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage, slows, and applies an armor reduction debuff to enemies hit. It also marks champions and large monsters, causing Yorick and his summoned undead to gain bonus movement speed towards them and making nearby inactive graves awaken into Mist Walkers. This ability is used offensively for damage and to facilitate engages by slowing enemies and buffing Yorick and his spectral army.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that reduces armor, damages, slows and marks enemies. Summoned units gain move speed when moving towards marked targets. Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that deals {{ calc_healthdamage }} max Health magic damage, Slows by {{ calc_slow }} for {{ slowduration }} seconds and marks champions and monsters for {{ markduration }} seconds. Marked enemies continuously Awaken nearby graves (but not exceeding the maximum of {{ spell.yorickpassive:yorickpassiveghoulmax }}) and suffer {{ armorshred*100 }}% reduced Armor.

Yorick and his summoned units gain {{ hasteamount*100 }}% Move Speed toward the mark. Mist Walkers will leap once at marked enemies that get away from them.

abilities.name: Cosmic Binding
abilities.mechanics_description: Cosmic Binding is a linear skillshot. It first slows the initial enemy struck, and if it then hits a second enemy or a wall, it stuns both targets for its duration, making it a versatile tool for crowd control, engagement, and peel.
abilities.original_description:
Bard fires a missile which will slow the first enemy struck, and continue onward. If it strikes a wall, it will stun the initial target; if it strikes another enemy, it will stun them both. Bard fires an energy bolt, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the first two enemies hit. The first target hit is Slowed by {{ slowamountpercentage }}% for {{ slowduration }}s.

If the bolt hits a second enemy or a wall, any enemies hit are Stunned for {{ stunduration }}s.

abilities.name: Traveler's Call
abilities.mechanics_description: **Traveler's Call (Passive)** is an **auto-target** ability that enhances Bard's basic attacks with bonus magic damage from summoned **Meeps**. As Bard collects **Chimes** that randomly spawn across the map, his Meeps gain an **area-of-effect** damage and **slow** on hit, while the Chimes also provide experience, mana, and out-of-combat movement speed.
abilities.original_description:
Meeps: Bard attracts lesser spirits that assist with his basic attacks to deal extra magic damage. When Bard has collected enough Chimes, his meeps will also deal damage in an area and slow enemies hit.

Chimes: Ancient chimes randomly appear for Bard to collect. These grant experience, restore mana, and provide out of combat Move Speed.

abilities.name: Caretaker's Shrine
abilities.mechanics_description: **Caretaker's Shrine (W)** is a **point-and-click** ability that Bard places on the ground. It's primarily used for **defensive utility**, healing and providing a decaying movement speed buff to allies who step on it, with the healing increasing over time. Bard can have multiple shrines active simultaneously, allowing for pre-emptive healing and map control.
abilities.original_description:
Reveals a Health shrine which powers up over a short time, disappearing after healing and speeding up the first ally that touches it. Bard creates a Health shrine that grants {{ calc_movespeed }} Move Speed decaying over {{ movespeed_duration }} seconds and restores at least {{ initialheal }} Health to the first ally to enter. The shrine grows to restore {{ maxheal }} Health after existing for {{ chargeuptime }} seconds.

Bard can have up to {{ maxpacks }} shrines at once. If an enemy champion enters a shrine, it is destroyed.

This ability has {{ ammo_limit }} charges.

Current Active Shrines: {{ f1 }} / {{ f2 }}

abilities.name: Magical Journey
abilities.mechanics_description: **Magical Journey (E)** is a **skillshot** that creates a one-way portal through terrain. It is primarily used for **utility**, allowing Bard and his allies to traverse walls for strategic repositioning, escapes, or aggressive engages, while also creating a path for enemies that can be used defensively or offensively by predicting their movement.
abilities.original_description: Bard opens a portal in nearby terrain. Allies and enemies alike can take a one-way trip through that terrain by moving into the portal. Bard opens a one-way portal through Terrain for {{ e1 }} seconds. Any champion can enter the portal by moving onto it while near the entrance.

abilities.name: Tempered Fate
abilities.mechanics_description: Tempered Fate is a circular skillshot that, upon impact, places all units and structures within its area of effect into stasis for a duration, rendering them invulnerable and unable to act. This ability is primarily used for **utility**, able to disrupt enemy engagements, save allies from certain death, or even set up powerful crowd control chains.
abilities.original_description: Bard sends spirit energy arcing to a location, putting all champions, minions, monsters, and turrets hit into stasis for a brief time. Bard hurls magical protective energy to an area, placing all units and structures hit into Stasis for {{ rstasisduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Concussive Blows
abilities.mechanics_description: Concussive Blows is an **auto-target** passive that Braum and his allies apply to enemies through basic attacks, stacking up to four times. Upon reaching four stacks, **Concussive Blows** is triggered, applying a **stun** crowd control effect and bonus magic damage to the target, while also debuffing them to take increased magic damage from Braum for a short duration.
abilities.original_description:
Braum's basic attacks apply Concussive Blows. Once the first stack is applied, ally basic attacks also stack Concussive Blows.

Upon reaching 4 stacks, the target is stunned and takes magic damage. For the next few seconds they cannot receive new stacks, but take bonus magic damage from Braum's attacks.

abilities.name: Winter's Bite
abilities.mechanics_description: **Winter's Bite (Q)** is a linear skillshot that Braum fires from his shield. It deals magic damage to the first enemy hit, slows them, and applies a stack of his passive, Concussive Blows. This ability is primarily used offensively to initiate trades, set up for allies, or chase down fleeing enemies due to its damage and CC.
abilities.original_description:
Braum propels freezing ice from his shield, slowing and dealing magic damage.

Applies a stack of Concussive Blows. Braum propels freezing ice from his shield, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the first enemy hit and Slowing them by {{ e2 }}% decaying over {{ e5 }} seconds.

Applies a stack of Concussive Blows.

abilities.name: Stand Behind Me
abilities.mechanics_description: "Stand Behind Me" is a **point-and-click dash** used **defensively and for utility**. Braum can target an allied champion or minion to **instantly leap to their location**. Upon arrival, both Braum and the ally gain a significant boost to their Armor and Magic Resist, allowing Braum to intercept damage or reposition to protect his teammate.
abilities.original_description: Braum leaps to a target allied champion or minion. On arrival, Braum and the ally gain Armor and Magic Resist for a few seconds. Braum leaps to an allied champion or minion. On arrival, Braum grants the target <scaleArmor>{{ grantedallyarmor }} Armor</scaleArmor> and <scaleMR>{{ grantedallymr }} Magic Resist</scaleMR> for {{ e1 }} seconds. Braum grants himself <scaleArmor>{{ grantedbraumarmor }} Armor</scaleArmor> and <scaleMR>{{ grantedbraummr }} Magic Resist</scaleMR> for the same duration.

abilities.name: Unbreakable
abilities.mechanics_description: **Unbreakable (E)** is a **directional skillshot** that Braum activates by facing a specific direction. It is primarily **defensive**, forming a stationary shield for several seconds that intercepts enemy projectiles. The first projectile blocked negates all damage, while subsequent ones are significantly reduced, and Braum gains movement speed while the shield is active.
abilities.original_description:
Braum raises his shield in a direction for several seconds, intercepting all projectiles causing them to hit him and be destroyed. He negates the damage of the first attack completely and reduces the damage of all subsequent attacks from this direction. Braum raises his shield for {{ e2 }} seconds, intercepting enemy missiles from the chosen direction, causing them to hit Braum and then be destroyed. The first missile Braum blocks deals no damage, and subsequent projectiles deal {{ e3 }}% reduced damage.

Braum gains {{ e4 }}% Move Speed while his shield is raised.

abilities.name: Glacial Fissure
abilities.mechanics_description:
**How it's used:** Glacial Fissure is a **linear skillshot** that Braum casts in a target direction.

**Usage:** It functions **both offensively and defensively**. Braum slams the ground, dealing magic damage and **knocking up** all enemies in his immediate vicinity and along the fissure's path. The primary target is knocked up for a longer duration that scales with distance traveled from Braum. The fissure then persists as a slowing zone, hindering enemy movement and providing a crucial utility tool for crowd control and engagement/disengagement.
abilities.original_description:
Braum slams the ground, knocking up enemies nearby and in a line in front of him. A fissure is left along the line that slows enemies. Braum slams the ground sending forth a fissure that Knocks Up enemies in its path and nearby Braum, and deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. The first target hit is Knocked Up for between {{ minknockup }} and {{ maxknockup }} seconds, increasing with distance from Braum. All others hit are Knocked Up for {{ minknockup }} seconds.

The fissure also creates a zone for {{ slowzoneduration }} seconds, that Slows by {{ movespeedmod }}%.

abilities.name: Call of the Freljord
abilities.mechanics_description: This is a passive ability that automatically benefits Nunu and a nearby ally, enhancing both their attack speed and movement speed. Additionally, it causes Willump's basic attacks to deal a small amount of area-of-effect damage around his primary target.
abilities.original_description: Nunu increases the attack speed and Move Speed of Willump and a nearby ally, and causes Willump's basic attacks to damage enemies around the target.

abilities.name: Absolute Zero
abilities.mechanics_description: Absolute Zero is a channeled AoE damage and crowd control ultimate that Nunu & Willump can recast to end early. While channeling, it applies a growing slow to enemies and grants Nunu & Willump a decaying shield, culminating in a large burst of magic damage upon detonation based on channel duration.
abilities.original_description:
Nunu & Willump create a powerful blizzard in an area that slows enemies and deals massive damage at the end. Nunu and Willump channel a powerful blizzard for up to {{ channelduration }} seconds. Enemies inside are Slowed by {{ slowstartamount*-100 }}%, increasing to {{ maxslowamount*-100 }}% over the duration. Nunu and Willump also gain {{ totalshieldamount }} Shield for the duration before decaying over {{ shielddecayduration }} seconds afterwards.

When the blizzard ends, it detonates, dealing up to {{ maximumdamage }} magic damage based on channel time. Nunu and Willump can Recast to end the blizzard early.

abilities.name: Biggest Snowball Ever!
abilities.mechanics_description: **Biggest Snowball Ever! (W)** is a **linear skillshot** that Nunu & Willump can cast. They charge and roll a snowball that grows in size, speed, and damage the further it travels, eventually becoming an unstoppable force that knocks up and damages enemies it collides with or breaks upon hitting terrain. Players can choose to let the snowball fly early, or manage their turning speed to steer it for maximum impact.
abilities.original_description:
Willump creates a snowball that grows in size and speed as he rolls it. The snowball damages and knocks up enemies. Nunu and Willump create a snowball that grows in size and speed as they roll it. They turn slower while rolling it, but can increase turning speed by holding the turn.

The snowball does between {{ noimpactsnowballdamage }} and {{ maximumsnowballdamage }} magic damage, and Knocks Up for between {{ baseknockupduration }} and {{ maximumstunduration }} seconds when it collides with a champion, large monster or wall. These values scale up with distance rolled.

Nunu and Willump can Recast to let the snowball go early.

abilities.name: Snowball Barrage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Snowball Barrage (E)** is a **skillshot** that Nunu uses offensively to deal damage and apply a slowing debuff. Nunu throws up to three snowballs in a line, each dealing magic damage and slowing enemies. If all three snowballs hit the same target, or if an enemy is affected by all three within a short duration, they are **rooted** and take additional damage after a brief delay, making it a strong tool for setting up engages or peeling for allies.
abilities.original_description:
Nunu throws multiple snowballs that damage enemies. When he's finished, Willump roots any champions or large monsters that were hit by a snowball. Nunu throws three snowballs, dealing {{ totalsnowballdamage }} magic damage per snowball and Slowing enemies hit by all three by {{ slowamount*-100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second. Nunu can Recast this up to twice more.

After {{ totalspellduration }} seconds, Nunu Roots all nearby enemies that had been Slowed by the snowballs for {{ rootduration }} seconds and deals an additional {{ totalrootdamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Consume
abilities.mechanics_description:
1.  **How to hit/use the ability:** Nunu & Willump target a single enemy unit (minion, monster, or champion) with a point-and-click ability.
2.  **How it is used:** This ability is used both offensively for damage and defensively for healing. It deals bonus true damage and restores significantly more health when used on jungle monsters or minions, and it provides a larger healing bonus when Nunu & Willump are low on health.

**Concise Description:** Nunu & Willump's Q is a point-and-click ability that allows them to consume a target, dealing damage and healing themselves. It provides substantial bonus true damage and healing against monsters and minions, and its healing is amplified at low health, making it a crucial tool for sustain and jungle clearing.
abilities.original_description:
Willump takes a bite out of a minion, monster, or enemy champion, dealing damage and healing himself. Nunu asks Willump to take a bite of an enemy, dealing {{ monsterminiondamage }} true damage and restoring {{ monsterhealing }} Health when used against a minion or jungle monster. Against a champion, it instead deals {{ totalchampiondamage }} magic damage and restores {{ championhealing }} Health.

The healing is increased by {{ lowhealthhealingscalar*100 }}% when Nunu and Willump are below {{ lowhealththreshhold*100 }}% Health.

abilities.name: Trial by Fire
abilities.mechanics_description: Trial by Fire is an auto-attack enhancement that triggers every few seconds. Upon activation, Gangplank's next melee attack targets an enemy champion, dealing bonus magic damage over time.
abilities.original_description: Every few seconds, Gangplank's melee strike will set his opponent on fire.

abilities.name: Parrrley
abilities.mechanics_description: Parrrley is a **point-and-click** ability used **offensively** to deal damage. If Parrrley kills a unit, Gangplank plunders bonus Gold.
abilities.original_description: Shoots target, plundering Gold for each enemy unit killed. {{Spell_GangplankQWrapper_Tooltip_{{ gamemodeinteger }}}}

abilities.name: Remove Scurvy
abilities.mechanics_description: Remove Scurvy is a self-cast ability where Gangplank instantly consumes citrus. It primarily acts as a defensive and utility tool, removing all disables (stuns, roots, etc.) and providing a significant heal that scales with missing health.
abilities.original_description: Eats citrus to cure crowd control effects and restore Health. Gangplank consumes a large amount of citrus fruit, removing all <status>Disabling</status> effects and restoring <healing>{{ basehealth }} plus {{ e2 }}% missing Health</healing>.

abilities.name: Cannon Barrage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Cannon Barrage (R)** is a **circular skillshot** that Gangplank can cast from anywhere on the map. Upon activation, his ship bombards a targeted area with multiple, successive waves of damaging cannonballs, applying a slow to enemies hit. Its primary use is **offensive**, dealing sustained magic damage and providing crowd control, but it can also offer **utility** through upgrades that grant allies movement speed or deal true damage.
abilities.original_description:
Gangplank signals his ship to bombard an area, slowing and damaging enemies. Gangplank signals his ship to fire {{ totalwavestooltip }} waves of cannonballs anywhere on the map over {{ zoneduration }} seconds. Each wave Slows by {{ slowpercent }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds and deals {{ onewavedamage }} magic damage. Maximum damage: {{ totaldamagetooltip }}

This Ability can be upgraded in the shop via Parrrley.

Fire at Will: Fires 6 additional waves of cannonballs.
Death's Daughter: Fires a Mega-Cannonball that deals {{ deathsdaughterdamage }} true damage and Slows by {{ deathsdaughterslow }}% for {{ deathsdaughterslowduration }} second.
Raise Morale: Allies inside Cannon Barrage gain {{ raisemoralehaste }}% Move Speed for {{ raisemoralehasteduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Powder Keg
abilities.mechanics_description: **Powder Keg (E)** is a **deployable unit** that Gangplank places at a target location via a **targeted ground placement**. It can be **attacked by Gangplank and enemy champions**. When Gangplank attacks and destroys it, the keg explodes, dealing **area-of-effect physical damage** that also **slows** enemies and ignores a percentage of their armor. Additionally, if an explosion detonates another Powder Keg within its blast radius, the chain reaction can deal significant burst damage and a chain slow, making it both an **offensive tool for damage and CC** and a **strategic utility for zone control and combo setup**.
abilities.original_description:
Gangplank uncovers a powder keg at target location. If he attacks it, it explodes, spreading the attack's damage to enemies in the area, slowing them. Gangplank places a powder keg that can be attacked by Gangplank and enemy champions for {{ e5 }} seconds. When an enemy destroys it, the keg is defused. When Gangplank destroys it, it explodes, Slowing by {{ finalslowamount }}% for {{ e2 }} seconds and dealing the Attack's damage, ignoring {{ e0 }}% Armor. Champions take an additional {{ e3 }} physical damage.

Keg health decays every {{ f5 }} seconds. Keg explosions detonate other kegs with overlapping blast zones, but don't deal damage to the same target more than once. Keg explosions triggered by Parrrley will grant the bonus gold for targets killed.

abilities.name: Draw a Bead
abilities.mechanics_description: Draw a Bead is a passive ability that automatically increases Tristana's base Attack Range as she levels up. This means her auto-attacks can reach targets from further away without Tristana needing to perform any active input.
abilities.original_description: Increases Tristana's Attack Range as she levels.

abilities.name: Rapid Fire
abilities.mechanics_description: Tristana's Rapid Fire (Q) is a **self-buff** ability that significantly **increases her Attack Speed** for a short duration. This allows her to deal **burst damage** by rapidly auto-attacking enemies, making it a core offensive tool for trading and finishing off opponents.
abilities.original_description: Tristana fires her weapon rapidly, increasing her Attack Speed for a short time. Tristana goes full-auto, gaining <attackSpeed>{{ attackspeedmod*100 }}% Attack Speed</attackSpeed> for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Rocket Jump
abilities.mechanics_description: **Rocket Jump (W)** is a **dash** ability Tristana targets a location within range. Upon landing, she deals magic damage and applies a brief slow to surrounding enemies. This ability is used offensively for closing gaps and initiating trades, and defensively to escape danger. Crucially, takedowns and detonate Explosive Charge on champions grant Tristana a cooldown refund, allowing for chain jumps.
abilities.original_description:
Tristana fires at the ground to propel her to a distant location, dealing damage and slowing surrounding units for a brief period where she lands. Tristana launches herself, dealing {{ landingdamage }} magic damage and Slowing by {{ slowmod*-100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds upon landing.

Champion takedowns and max stack Explosive Charge detonations on champions refresh this Ability's Cooldown.

abilities.name: Buster Shot
abilities.mechanics_description: Buster Shot is a linear skillshot that deals magic damage and knocks back the primary target. It also stuns any enemy units hit by the projectile's knockback effect.
abilities.original_description: Tristana loads a massive cannonball into her weapon and fires it at an enemy unit. This deals Magic Damage and knocks the target back. If the target is carrying the Explosive Charge bomb, the bomb detonation radius is doubled. Tristana fires a massive cannonball, dealing <magicDamage>{{ damagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> to the target, <status>Knocking Back</status> and <status>Stunning</status> them and surrounding enemies for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Explosive Charge
abilities.mechanics_description: Explosive Charge is a **point-and-click ability** that Tristana can cast on an enemy or turret. It functions both **offensively** for damage through its active component, and indirectly **offensively** through its passive, which causes her killing blows to deal AoE damage. The active bomb's damage can be amplified by multiple hits before it explodes, rewarding aggressive attacking.
abilities.original_description:
When Tristana kills a unit, her cannonballs burst into shrapnel, dealing damage to surrounding enemies. Can be activated to place a bomb on a target enemy that explodes after a short duration dealing damage to surrounding units. Passive: Tristana's Attacks that kill enemies deal {{ passivedamage }} magic damage to surrounding enemies.

Active: Tristana attaches a bomb to an enemy or turret that deals {{ activedamage }} physical damage to surrounding enemies after {{ activeduration }} seconds. The damage is increased by {{ critchanceamp*100 }}% Critical Strike Chance and by {{ activeperstackamp*100 }}% each time Tristana hits an Attack or Ability (max 4 stacks).

At {{ activemaxstacks }} stacks, the bomb explodes immediately (max {{ activemaxdamage }} physical damage).

abilities.name: Hextech Munitions
abilities.mechanics_description: Hextech Munitions is a passive ability that automatically adds bonus true damage to Corki's basic attacks. This passive enhances his offensive capabilities by increasing his overall damage output in trades and skirmishes.
abilities.original_description: A percentage of Corki's basic attack damage is dealt as bonus <trueDamage>true damage</trueDamage>.

abilities.name: Phosphorus Bomb
abilities.mechanics_description: **Phosphorus Bomb (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that Corki fires at a target location, dealing magic damage and revealing enemies within the impact area for a duration. It is primarily used **offensively** to deal damage and provide vision, especially in the early game, but can also be used defensively to reveal incoming ganks or invisible enemies.
abilities.original_description: Corki fires a flash bomb at a target location, dealing magic damage to enemies in the area. This attack additionally reveals units in the area for a duration. Corki lobs a bomb, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. The area and champions hit are revealed for {{ revealduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Gatling Gun
abilities.mechanics_description: Gatling Gun is a **linear skillshot** that Corki fires in a cone in front of him. It is primarily used **offensively** to deal sustained **physical damage** and apply a **debuff**, reducing both enemy Armor and Magic Resist, making subsequent attacks more potent.
abilities.original_description: Corki's gatling gun rapidly fires in a cone in front of him, dealing damage and reducing enemy Armor and Magic Resist. Corki fires a gatling gun in front of him, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> over {{ sprayduration }} seconds and shredding up to <scaleArmor>{{ shredmax*-1 }} Armor</scaleArmor> and <scaleMR>Magic Resist</scaleMR>.

abilities.name: Valkyrie
abilities.mechanics_description: **Valkyrie (W)** is a short-range **linear skillshot** that Corki uses to **mobility and zone control**. He dashes forward, leaving a trail of fire that deals **periodic magic damage** to enemies who remain within it for its duration.
abilities.original_description: Corki flies a short distance, dropping bombs that create a trail of fire that damages opponents who remain in it. Corki flies over and scorches a path, burning it for {{ trailduration }} seconds. Enemies in the fire take up to <magicDamage>{{ maximumdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> over the duration.

abilities.name: Missile Barrage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Missile Barrage (R)** is a **skillshot** that Corki fires towards a target location. It deals area-of-effect **physical damage** to enemies struck by the explosion. Every third missile fired is a "Big One," dealing significantly **increased damage**, making it a potent **offensive** tool for poke and burst, and its increasing damage potential with charges encourages consistent use.
abilities.original_description:
Corki fires a missile toward his target location that explodes on impact, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Corki stores missiles over time, up to a maximum. Every 3rd missile fired will be a Big One, dealing extra damage. Corki fires a missile that explodes on the first enemy hit, dealing {{ rsmallmissiledamage }} physical damage to surrounding enemies. Every third missile instead deals {{ rbigmissiledamage }} physical damage.

This Ability has up to {{ maxammotooltip }} charges. Basic attacks against champions reduce the time between charges by {{ attackrefund }} seconds on hit.

abilities.name: Void Shift
abilities.mechanics_description: Void Shift is a passive ability that automatically grants Malzahar damage reduction and crowd control immunity after not taking damage or being crowd controlled for a short duration. This defensive buff, which lingers briefly after he takes damage, allows him to engage or survive unfavorable situations by mitigating incoming damage and preventing subsequent crowd control.
abilities.original_description: When he hasn't recently taken damage or been crowd controlled, Malzahar gains massive damage reduction and crowd control immunity, lingering for a short period after taking damage.

abilities.name: Malefic Visions
abilities.mechanics_description: **Malefic Visions (E)** is an auto-targeting ability that deals damage over time to a single enemy unit. It refreshes its duration if Malzahar hits the same target with another ability and can spread to nearby enemies if the target dies, restoring Mana to Malzahar.
abilities.original_description:
Malzahar infects his target's mind with cruel visions of their demise, dealing damage over time. Using Malzahar's other spells on the target will refresh the visions.

If the target dies while afflicted by the visions, they pass on to a nearby enemy unit and Malzahar gains Mana. Malzahar's Voidlings are attracted to affected units. Malzahar inflicts terrible visions, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage over {{ duration }} seconds. Applying Call of the Void or Nether Grasp to the victim during this time refreshes the visions.

If the victim dies, Malzahar gains {{ manarestore }} Mana and the visions spread to the nearest enemy.

Malefic Visions executes minions below {{ minionexecutethreshold }} Health.

abilities.name: Void Swarm
abilities.mechanics_description: Void Swarm is an **auto-targeting summon ability** used **offensively** to deal sustained magic damage. Malzahar summons Voidlings that automatically attack nearby enemies, with the number of Voidlings summoned increasing based on how many of his *other* abilities he has recently cast.
abilities.original_description:
Malzahar summons Voidlings to attack nearby enemies. Passive: Malzahar's other Abilities give him a stack when cast (max {{ stackcap }}).

Active: Malzahar summons a Voidling plus an additional Voidling per stack. Voidlings last {{ voidlingduration }} seconds and deal {{ voidlingbonusdamagetooltip }} magic damage each hit.

abilities.name: Call of the Void
abilities.mechanics_description:
**1. How to use:** Call of the Void is a **skillshot** that fires two projectiles in a slightly spread linear path from Malzahar's location.

**2. How it is used:** This ability is primarily used **offensively** for **damage** and to apply a **silence** debuff on enemy champions, preventing them from casting spells. It can also be used for **utility** to zone enemies or secure kills from a distance.

**Concise Description:** Call of the Void is a linear skillshot that fires two Void projectiles, dealing magic damage and silencing enemy champions hit by both. It's a core damage and disruption tool for Malzahar.
abilities.original_description: Malzahar opens up two portals to the Void. After a short delay, they fire projectiles that deal Magic Damage and silence enemy champions. Malzahar opens two portals to the Void that fire projectiles inward, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Silencing</status> for {{ e2 }} second(s).

abilities.name: Nether Grasp
abilities.mechanics_description: **Nether Grasp (R)** is a point-and-click ultimate ability that targets a single enemy champion. It suppresses the target, preventing them from moving or casting most abilities, while dealing damage over time. A damaging zone also forms around the target, dealing damage based on their maximum health over its duration.
abilities.original_description: Malzahar channels the essence of the Void to suppress an enemy champion over a zone of damaging negative energy. Malzahar <status>Suppresses</status> an enemy champion and deals <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage</magicDamage> over {{ e4 }} seconds. A zone of negative energy is created around his target dealing <magicDamage>{{ zonedamagetooltip }} max Health magic damage</magicDamage> over {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Happy Hour
abilities.mechanics_description: Gragas's passive, **Happy Hour**, is an **auto-target** ability. Whenever Gragas casts any of his abilities, he **heals himself for a small amount**, providing a defensive layer and sustain in lane.
abilities.original_description: Gragas periodically heals upon using a skill.

abilities.name: Drunken Rage
abilities.mechanics_description: Drunken Rage (W) is a channelled self-buff for Gragas, not a skillshot or targeted ability. While channelling for 1 second, Gragas takes reduced damage, and upon completion, his next basic attack deals bonus magic damage to the target and nearby enemies, making it a versatile tool for both trading and survivability.
abilities.original_description: Gragas samples his latest brew for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes boisterous and belligerent, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received. Gragas samples his brew, reducing incoming damage by {{ damagereduction }} for {{ defenseduration }} seconds and empowering his next Attack to deal an additional <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }}</magicDamage> plus <magicDamage>{{ maxhppercentdamage }}% max Health magic damage</magicDamage> to the target and surrounding enemies.

abilities.name: Barrel Roll
abilities.mechanics_description: Barrel Roll (Q) is a **linear skillshot** where Gragas rolls a cask that travels to a target location.
