Empowered Attacks gain {{ bonusattackspeed }} Attack Speed, {{ onhitdamage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% On-Hit, {{ bonusattackrange }} range, and the first one to hit an enemy refunds {{ cdrefund*100 }}% of this Ability's Cooldown.

abilities.name: Hallowed Mist
abilities.mechanics_description: Hallowed Mist is a ground-targeted circular zone that Gwen can deploy. While inside the mist, Gwen becomes untargetable to enemies outside of it and gains bonus Armor and Magic Resist; she can recast the ability to pull the mist to her if she attempts to leave the zone. This ability is primarily used defensively for survivability and repositioning, but can also be used offensively to isolate targets or create favorable engagement conditions.
abilities.original_description:
Gwen summons mist that protects her from enemies outside of it. She can only be targeted by enemies who enter the mist. Gwen summons the Hallowed Mist, making her Untargetable to all enemies (except towers) outside the zone for {{ zoneduration }} seconds or until she leaves it. While in the Mist, Gwen gains {{ totalresists }} Armor and Magic Resist.

Gwen can Recast this Ability once to call the Mist to her. This will automatically Recast the first time Gwen attempts to leave the zone.

abilities.name: Needlework
abilities.mechanics_description: Gwen's ultimate, Needlework, is a **linear skillshot** that fires a needle, slowing and damaging the first enemy hit. She can recast it up to two additional times within a short window, each cast launching more needles in the same line for increased damage. This ability is used offensively to deal burst magic damage and apply a potent slow to catch enemies or secure kills.
abilities.original_description:
Gwen hurls a needle that slows enemies hit, deals magic damage, and applies A Thousand Cuts to champions hit.

This ability can be cast up to two more times, with each cast throwing additional needles and dealing more damage. First Cast: Hurl a needle that deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage, Slows by {{ initialslow*-100 }}% for {{ debuffduration }} seconds, and applies A Thousand Cuts to all enemies hit. Gwen can Recast this ability up to 2 additional times within 6 seconds ({{ lockouttime }}s cooldown between casts).

Second Cast: Fire three needles to deal {{ totaldamage3 }} magic damage
Third Cast: Fire five needles to deal {{ totaldamage5 }} magic damage

abilities.name: Whimsy
abilities.mechanics_description: "Whimsy" is a targeted ability that can be cast on allies or enemies. On allies, it provides a movement and attack speed buff. On enemies, it applies a Polymorph debuff, preventing them from attacking or casting spells.
abilities.original_description:
If cast on an ally, grants them Attack Speed and Move Speed for a short time. If cast on an enemy, turns them into an adorable critter that can't attack or cast spells. When used on an ally, Lulu grants {{ totalms }} Move Speed and {{ e7 }}% Attack Speed for {{ e5 }} seconds.

When used on an enemy, Lulu Polymorphs them for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Pix, Faerie Companion
abilities.mechanics_description: Pix is an auxiliary entity that automatically fires homing bolts at the target of Lulu's auto-attacks. These bolts deal magic damage and can be intercepted by other units, meaning they hit the first enemy unit in their path. Pix's damage acts as a passive offensive support to Lulu's basic attacks, adding consistent, albeit interceptable, poke.
abilities.original_description: Pix fires magical bolts of energy whenever the champion he's following attacks another enemy unit. These bolts are homing, but can be intercepted by other units.

abilities.name: Glitterlance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Glitterlance (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that fires two piercing bolts of magical energy. It is primarily used **offensively** to deal damage and apply a significant, decaying slow to enemy champions, often initiating fights or setting up plays.
abilities.original_description:
Pix and Lulu each fire a bolt of magical energy that damages and heavily slows all enemies it hits. Lulu and Pix each fire a piercing bolt dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Slowing by {{ slowamount*-100 }}%, decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

Enemies take {{ bonusmissiledamage }} magic damage from additional bolts.

abilities.name: Help, Pix!
abilities.mechanics_description: **Help, Pix! (E)** is a **point-and-click ability** that can be cast on an allied champion or an enemy champion. When cast on an ally, Pix shields them, grants them a temporary companion, and follows them to aid their attacks. When cast on an enemy, Pix damages them and grants Lulu true sight of that enemy.
abilities.original_description:
If cast on an ally, commands Pix to jump to an ally and shield them. He then follows them and aids their attacks. If cast on an enemy, commands Pix to jump to an enemy and damage them. He then follows them and grants you vision of that enemy. When used on an ally, Pix jumps to them and grants Pix, Faerie Companion for {{ e1 }} seconds. If the ally is a champion, Pix also grants {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ e7 }} seconds.

When used on an enemy champion, Pix hampers them, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and granting True Sight of them for {{ e6 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Wild Growth
abilities.mechanics_description: Wild Growth (R) is a targeted ability used defensively on an allied champion. It knocks up nearby enemies, grants the ally bonus health, and applies a slowing aura to enemies around them.
abilities.original_description: Lulu enlarges an ally, knocking nearby enemies into the air and granting the ally a large amount of bonus health. For the next few seconds, that ally gains an aura that slows nearby enemies. Lulu enlarges an ally, <status>Knocking Up</status> surrounding enemies for {{ knockbackduration }} second. The enlarged ally gains <healing>{{ totalbonushealth }} max Health</healing> and <status>Slows</status> surrounding enemies by {{ slowpercent }}% for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Voracity
abilities.mechanics_description: **Voracity (Passive)** is an auto-target ability triggered by enemy champion deaths. When an enemy Katarina has recently dealt damage to dies, her ability cooldowns are significantly reduced, enabling rapid follow-up ability casts and resets. Additionally, picking up *Daggers* (a mechanic tied to her other abilities) allows her to cleave through nearby enemies, dealing magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Whenever an enemy champion dies that Katarina has damaged recently, her remaining ability cooldowns are dramatically reduced.

If Katarina picks up a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing magic damage.

abilities.name: Bouncing Blade
abilities.mechanics_description: **Bouncing Blade (Q)** is a **point-and-click** ability that deals magic damage to the initial target and up to two nearby enemies, then leaves a dagger on the ground. It's primarily used **offensively** to initiate damage on a target and spread damage to clustered enemies, setting up for follow-up attacks and dagger resets.
abilities.original_description: Katarina throws a <font color='#FFF673'>Dagger</font> at the target that then bounces to nearby enemies before ricocheting onto the ground. Katarina throws a <keywordMajor>Dagger</keywordMajor>, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to the target and {{ maxbounces }} nearby enemies. The <keywordMajor>Dagger</keywordMajor> then ricochets onto the ground behind the primary target.

abilities.name: Death Lotus
abilities.mechanics_description: **Death Lotus (R)** is a channeled, auto-targeting ability where Katarina spins, rapidly throwing daggers at the three nearest enemies, dealing significant magic and physical damage. It's an offensive tool primarily used for high burst damage during prolonged engagements.
abilities.original_description:
Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, dealing massive magic damage while she channels to the 3 nearest enemy champions. Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, rapidly attacking the three nearest enemy champions with a flurry of knives. Each knife deals {{ damagecalc }} magic damage and {{ addamagecalc }} physical damage, and applies {{ grievousamount*100 }}% Grievous Wounds for {{ grievousduration }} seconds.

Total over {{ duration }} seconds to each enemy: {{ totaldamagecalc }} magic damage and {{ totaladdamagecalc }} physical damage.

abilities.name: Preparation
abilities.mechanics_description: Katarina's **Preparation (W)** is an **auto-target** ability that, when activated, instantly throws a dagger directly above her and grants her a decaying burst of movement speed. This allows her to quickly reposition or chase down targets while setting up for subsequent dagger resets.
abilities.original_description: Katarina gains a burst of Move Speed, tossing a <font color='#FFF673'>Dagger</font> into the air directly above herself. Katarina tosses a <keywordMajor>Dagger</keywordMajor> into the air and gains <speed>{{ e4 }}% Move Speed</speed> decaying over {{ e2 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Shunpo
abilities.mechanics_description: Shunpo is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Katarina to instantly teleport to a target ally, enemy, or nearby Dagger. It is used both **offensively** to close distances for damage and **defensively** to escape, with its cooldown significantly reduced when targeting a Dagger, allowing for rapid repositioning and damage cycling.
abilities.original_description:
Katarina blinks to the target, striking it if its an enemy, or striking the nearest enemy otherwise. Katarina blinks in the wink of an eye to the target ally, enemy, or Dagger. If it is an enemy, Katarina strikes for {{ totaldamage }} magic damage - otherwise she strikes the nearest enemy in range.

Picking up a Dagger will reduce this Ability's Cooldown by {{ daggercooldownreduction }} seconds ({{ tooltipdaggerreduction }}). Katarina can blink to any location near the target.

abilities.name: Prophet of an Elder God
abilities.mechanics_description: **Prophet of an Elder God (Passive):** Tentacles are automatically summoned on impassible terrain near Illaoi or the Vessels she creates. These Tentacles are persistent and passively swing at nearby enemies that are Spirits, Vessels, or targets of her abilities, dealing physical damage and healing Illaoi if they strike a champion.
abilities.original_description: Illaoi and the <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font> she creates spawn Tentacles on nearby impassible terrain. Tentacles swing at spirits, <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font>, and victims of Illaoi's Harsh lesson. Tentacles deal physical damage to enemies hit, and will heal Illaoi if they damage a champion.

abilities.name: Tentacle Smash
abilities.mechanics_description: Tentacle Smash is a linear skillshot that Illaoi targets with her cursor. It deals physical damage and, thanks to its passive, is Illaoi's primary source of sustained damage, helping her pressure lanes and teamfight.
abilities.original_description:
Increases the damage dealt by Tentacles. When activated, Illaoi smashes down a Tentacle that deals physical damage. Passive: Slam damage is increased by {{ spell.illaoiq:tentacledamageamp*100 }}% (currently {{ spell.illaoiq:tentacledamagetotal }} physical damage).

Active: Illaoi swings her idol, causing a Tentacle to Slam forward.

abilities.name: Harsh Lesson
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Harsh Lesson (W) - Illaoi**

Harsh Lesson is an **auto-attack reset** and **mobility** tool. Illaoi leaps a short distance towards her target, dealing **physical damage** and causing nearby Tentacles to also slam the target. She can then immediately follow up with an empowered basic attack for bonus damage based on the target's max health. It is primarily used **offensively** to close gaps, deal burst damage, and trigger Tentacle slams.
abilities.original_description: Illaoi leaps to her target, dealing physical damage and causing nearby Tentacles to also swing at the target. Illaoi's next Attack causes her to leap at the target, dealing an additional <physicalDamage>{{ healthpercenttotal }} max Health physical damage</physicalDamage>. When she strikes, nearby Tentacles will <keywordMajor>Slam</keywordMajor> at the target.

abilities.name: Test of Spirit
abilities.mechanics_description: **Test of Spirit (E)** is a linear skillshot that rips a target's spirit from their body, allowing Illaoi to damage it directly. Damaging the spirit echoes a percentage of that damage to the original target, and if the spirit dies or the target moves too far away, they become a **Vessel**, spawning Tentacles that slam at them.
abilities.original_description:
Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a Vessel and begin spawning Tentacles. Illaoi pulls the spirit from an enemy champion for {{ spiritduration }} seconds. The spirit can be damaged like a champion, with {{ echopercent }} of that damage echoing to its owner.

If the spirit dies or the target leaves its range, the target becomes marked for {{ vesselduration }} seconds and is Slowed by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. Marked enemies spawn Tentacles if possible.

Tentacles will automatically Slam at spirits and marked enemies once every {{ timebetweenvesseltentacleslams }} seconds.

abilities.name: Leap of Faith
abilities.mechanics_description: Leap of Faith is an **area of effect (AoE) skillshot** that Illaoi uses offensively to deal physical damage to nearby enemies. It also spawns a **Tentacle for each enemy champion hit**, significantly empowering her subsequent attacks and ability cooldowns for a short duration.
abilities.original_description:
Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies. A Tentacle spawns for each enemy champion hit. Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing {{ damagecalc }} physical damage to nearby enemies and spawning a Tentacle for each enemy champion hit.

For the next {{ duration }} seconds, Tentacles are untargetable and Slam 50% faster, and Harsh Lesson has a {{ spell.illaoiw:cooldownduringr }} second cooldown.

abilities.name: Break the Mold
abilities.mechanics_description: "Break the Mold" is Rell's passive ability. Her auto-attacks and damaging abilities grant bonus magic damage and a temporary steal of Armor and Magic Resist from the target. This passive is used offensively to increase her damage output and make her and her allies more resilient against magic-resistant targets.
abilities.original_description: Rell's Attacks and Abilities deal additional magic damage and steal Armor and Magic Resist on hit.

abilities.name: Shattering Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: **Shattering Strike (Q)** functions as a linear skillshot that Rell thrusts her lance through. Upon hitting an enemy, it deals magic damage, breaks any active shields on them, and stuns them for a short duration, making it a potent tool for engaging, disrupting, and peeling.
abilities.original_description: Rell deals magic damage to units in a line, breaking their shields and stunning them.  Rell thrusts her lance, <status>Stunning</status> targets for {{ stunduration }} seconds, destroying all <shield>Shields</shield>, and dealing <magicDamage>{{ damage }} magic damage.</magicDamage>

abilities.name: Ferromancy: Crash Down
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Ferromancy: Crash Down (W)** is a **point-and-click** ability when mounted, and an **auto-target** ability when dismounted.

Mounted use is an **offensive** and **defensive** tool: it initiates combat by knocking up enemies in a small area around Rell and granting her a significant shield. Dismounted use is **offensive utility**, knocking up the next enemy she attacks to allow for follow-up crowd control or to peel for herself.
abilities.original_description:
Mounted: Rell Dismounts, crashing down in her armor, Knocking enemies up and gaining a large Shield. While dismounted, she gains Armor, Magic Resist, Attack Speed, and Attack Range, but is Slowed.

Dismounted: Rell forms her Mount, gaining a burst of speed and Knocking Up the next enemy she attacks.

Passive - Mounted Alacrity: Rell gains {{ spell.rellw_dismount:mountedmovespeed }} Move Speed while mounted.

Active - Ferromancy: Crash Down: Rell leaps off her mount, Knocking Up enemies and dealing {{ spell.rellw_dismount:dismountdamage }} magic damage. Rell gains {{ spell.rellw_dismount:shield }} Shield, which lasts until she remounts.

Rell then enters her armored form, gaining {{ spell.rellw_dismount:resistanceincrease*100 }}% increased Armor and Magic Resist, {{ spell.rellw_dismount:dismountedasboost*100 }}% Attack Speed and {{ spell.rellw_dismount:dismountedrangeboost }} Attack Range. In this armored form, she can use Ferromancy: Mount Up.

abilities.name: Full Tilt
abilities.mechanics_description: Rell's "Full Tilt" (E) is a **point-and-click** ability that creates a temporary movement speed buff for herself and a targeted ally, which is amplified when moving towards enemies or each other. This buff is primarily used for **utility and setting up offensive engages**, as her next enhanced attack deals significant magic damage based on a percentage of the target's maximum health, consuming the buff.
abilities.original_description:
Passive: Rell gains out of combat Move Speed.

Active: Rell and an ally gain ramping Move Speed, doubled toward enemies and each other. Her next Attack explodes, dealing magic damage.
Rell and an ally charge, gaining {{ minms*100 }}% Move Speed, increased to {{ maxms*100 }}% when facing enemy champions or each other for {{ duration }} seconds. Rell's next Attack or Shattering Strike explodes in an area for {{ maxhealthdamagecalc }} max Health magic damage.

abilities.name: Magnet Storm
abilities.mechanics_description: Magnet Storm is a circular area-of-effect (AoE) ability that begins with an **instantaneous pull** of all enemies within range towards Rell, followed by a **channeled, persistent pull** that continues to drag enemies inwards and deals damage over time. It is primarily used for **offensive crowd control (CC)**, setting up devastating combos and disrupting enemy positioning.
abilities.original_description: Rell explodes in a magnetic fury, violently Pulling nearby enemies toward herself. Then Rell constantly Drags nearby enemies toward herself for a short while, dealing magic damage over time. Rell explodes in a magnetic fury, violently <status>Pulling</status> nearby enemies towards herself. Then Rell constantly <status>Drags</status> nearby enemies towards herself and deals <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> over the next {{ duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Deathbringer Stance
abilities.mechanics_description: Aatrox's basic attacks periodically activate his passive, **Deathbringer Stance**, dealing bonus magic damage and healing him based on the target's maximum health. This passive enhances his sustained damage and survivability in combat.
abilities.original_description: Periodically, Aatrox's next basic attack deals bonus <magicDamage>magic damage</magicDamage> and heals him, based on the target's max health.

abilities.name: Umbral Dash
abilities.mechanics_description: **Umbral Dash (E)** is a **linear skillshot dash**. It is primarily used **offensively** to position for his other abilities and deal damage, but it also offers **utility** by allowing him to reposition and engage or disengage.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Aatrox heals when damaging enemy champions. On activation, he dashes in a direction. Passive: Aatrox heals for {{ totalevamp }} of the damage he deals to Champions.

Active: Aatrox dashes. He can use this Ability while winding up his other Abilities.

abilities.name: The Darkin Blade
abilities.mechanics_description: Aatrox's Q, "The Darkin Blade," is a **triple-cast linear skillshot** that can be used offensively for high damage and knock-up CC. Each cast is slightly delayed and deals progressively more physical damage, with enemies hit by the edge of each swing being briefly knocked up.
abilities.original_description: Aatrox slams his greatsword down, dealing physical damage. He can swing three times, each with a different area of effect. Aatrox slams his greatsword, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ qdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. If they are hit on the edge, they are briefly <status>Knocked Up</status> and they take <physicalDamage>{{ qedgedamage }}</physicalDamage> instead. This Ability can be <recast>Recast</recast> twice, each one changing shape and dealing 25% more damage than the previous one.

abilities.name: World Ender
abilities.mechanics_description: **World Ender (R)** is a self-buff ability cast by Aatrox. It activates his demonic form, granting him bonus Attack Damage, significantly increased healing from all sources, bonus decaying Movement Speed, and briefly fearing nearby minions. Champion takedowns extend the duration of this ultimate and refresh the Movement Speed bonus.
abilities.original_description:
Aatrox unleashes his demonic form, fearing nearby enemy minions and gaining attack damage, increased healing, and Move Speed. If he gets a takedown, this effect is extended. Aatrox reveals his true demonic form, Fearing nearby minions for {{ rminionfearduration }} seconds and gaining {{ rmovementspeedbonus*100 }}% Move Speed decaying over {{ rduration }} seconds. He also gains {{ rtotaladamp*100 }}% Attack Damage and increases self-healing by {{ rhealingamp*100 }}% for the duration.

Champion takedowns extend the duration of this effect by {{ rextension }} seconds and refresh the Move Speed effect.

abilities.name: Infernal Chains
abilities.mechanics_description: Infernal Chains is a linear skillshot that damages the first enemy hit. If the target is a champion or large monster, they are **slowed** by the initial hit and must reach the edge of the impact zone within a short time frame, or they will be **pulled back to the center** and take damage again. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and crowd control, chaining enemies for extended aggression.
abilities.original_description: Aatrox smashes the ground, dealing damage to the first enemy hit. Champions and large monsters have to leave the impact area quickly or they will be dragged to the center and take the damage again. Aatrox fires a chain, <status>Slowing</status> the first enemy hit by {{ wslowpercentage*-100 }}% for {{ wslowduration }} seconds and dealing <physicalDamage>{{ wdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. Champions and large jungle monsters have {{ wslowduration }} seconds to leave the impact area or be <status>Pulled</status> back to the center and damaged again for the same amount.

abilities.name: Blooming Blows
abilities.mechanics_description: Blooming Blows (Q) is a **circular skillshot** where Lillia swings her censer. It's used **offensively** to deal magic damage, with a bonus true damage "sweet spot" on the outer edge that also grants movement speed from its passive.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Lillia gains stacking Move Speed when hitting enemies with spells. She can activate this to deal magic damage to nearby enemies, dealing extra true damage on the edge. Passive: Lillia's Ability hits grant {{ prancespeed }} Move Speed for {{ pranceduration }} seconds, stacking up to {{ prancemaxstacks }} times.

Active: Lillia whirls her censer, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage, plus an additional {{ bonustruedamage }} true damage at the outer edge.

abilities.name: Watch Out! Eep!
abilities.mechanics_description: "Watch Out! Eep!" is a circular skillshot that deals damage in an area around Lillia. Enemies hit in the center of the ability's radius take significantly more damage, making it a potent tool for both damaging and bursting down opponents when positioned correctly.
abilities.original_description: Lillia deals damage in a nearby area, dealing heavy damage in the center. Lillia winds up a huge strike, dealing <magicDamage>{{ flatdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Enemies in the center take <magicDamage>{{ flatdamagesweetspot }} damage</magicDamage> instead.

abilities.name: Dream-Laden Bough
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dream-Laden Bough (Passive):** Lillia's abilities and basic attacks apply a stack of "Dream Dust" on enemy champions and monsters for a short duration. Hitting a target already afflicted with Dream Dust with another ability consumes all stacks to deal a burst of magic damage based on their maximum health. This passive is primarily used offensively to deal significant bonus damage, especially against tankier targets, and can be chained with her other abilities for burst potential.
abilities.original_description: Hitting a champion or monster with a skill will deal additional max Health damage over time.

abilities.name: Swirlseed
abilities.mechanics_description:
Swirlseed is a **skillshot** that Lillia throws in a parabolic arc. It deals damage and applies a significant slow to enemies it hits, and if it misses, it continues to roll along the ground until it hits an enemy or terrain, also applying the slow.

Swirlseed is primarily used for **offensive** zoning and damage, and for its strong **utility** in slowing targets to help Lillia stick to them or to escape.
abilities.original_description: Lillia hurls a seed that damages and slows those it lands on. If it doesn't hit anything, it will continue rolling until it hits a wall or target. Lillia lobs a swirlseed overhead, dealing <magicDamage>{{ impactdamagetotal }} magic damage</magicDamage> where it lands and revealing and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. If no enemies are hit, the seed rolls until it hits an enemy or collides with terrain.

abilities.name: Lilting Lullaby
abilities.mechanics_description: Lilting Lullaby is a circular skillshot that applies a stacking debuff called Dream Dust to enemies hit. Enemies who have accumulated enough Dream Dust from Lillia's other abilities will be put to sleep, and will take bonus magic damage if woken by an attack or ability.
abilities.original_description:
Lillia causes all enemies with Dream Dust on them to become Drowsy before falling asleep. Those enemies will take extra damage on being forcibly woken up. Lillia causes all enemy champions with Dream Dust to become Drowsy for {{ drowsyduration }} seconds. Afterward, they fall Asleep for {{ sleepduration }} seconds.

When awakened by damage, they take an additional {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Deadly Spines
abilities.mechanics_description: **Deadly Spines (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage to enemies hit. If Zyra casts Deadly Spines near one of her seeds, it instead grows a **Thorn Spitter plant**, granting ranged damage utility.
abilities.original_description:
Thick vines spread through the ground and explode into spines, dealing magic damage to enemies within the area. If cast near a seed, Deadly Spines grows a Thorn Spitter plant, which fires at enemies from afar. Zyra causes thick vines to spread and explode into spines, dealing {{ initialdamage }} magic damage.

If this Ability is cast near a Seed, the Seed grows into a Thorn Spitter that deals {{ spell.zyrap:plantdamage }} magic damage and lasts {{ spell.zyrap:plantduration }} seconds. Thorn Spitters have 575 range.

abilities.name: Garden of Thorns
abilities.mechanics_description: Garden of Thorns is a passive ability that periodically spawns **seeds** in a small radius around Zyra. Zyra can cast her **Q (Deadly Spines)** or **E (Grasping Roots)** near these seeds to make them **transform into plants**. These plants then **automatically attack nearby enemies**, primarily for offensive damage and zoning.
abilities.original_description: Seeds spawn around Zyra periodically, becoming faster with level. Zyra can cast Deadly Spines or Grasping Roots near seeds to grow plants, who fight for Zyra.

abilities.name: Rampant Growth
abilities.mechanics_description: Zyra throws a seed as a ranged, circular skillshot that lands at a targeted location. This seed grants True Sight to detect nearby enemy champions and acts as a platform for Zyra's other damaging abilities to spawn powerful plants.
abilities.original_description:
Zyra plants a seed, lasting up to 60 seconds. Deadly Spines and Grasping Roots cast near seeds will turn them into plants who fight for Zyra. Zyra can store multiple seeds at once, and killing enemies reduces Rampant Growth's recharge time. Zyra plants a Seed that lasts {{ e6 }} seconds. These Seeds grant True Sight of enemy champions that step on them for {{ e3 }} seconds, but are still destroyed.

This Ability has 2 charges with a {{ ammorechargetime }} second recharge time. Killing an enemy minion or monster reduces the recharge time by {{ e1 }}%. Champion takedowns reduce the recharge time by {{ e2 }}% instead.

abilities.name: Grasping Roots
abilities.mechanics_description: Grasping Roots is a linear skillshot that damages and roots enemies hit. If it passes near a seed, it transforms the seed into a Vine Lasher plant, which attacks nearby enemies, applying a stacking slow. This ability is primarily used for crowd control, setting up kills with the root, or adding sustained damage and slows with the summoned plants.
abilities.original_description:
Zyra sends forth vines through the ground to ensnare her target, dealing damage and rooting enemies they come across. If cast near a seed, Grasping Roots grows a Vine Lasher, whose short range attacks reduce enemy Move Speed. Zyra sends vines forward, Rooting for {{ e5 }} second(s) and dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

If this Ability passes near a Seed, the Seed grows into a Vine Lasher that deals {{ spell.zyrap:plantdamage }} magic damage and lasts {{ spell.zyrap:plantduration }} seconds. Vine Lashers have 400 range, and their Attacks Slow by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds. The Slow from multiple Vine Lashers stacks up to {{ maxslowstacks }} times.

abilities.name: Stranglethorns
abilities.mechanics_description: Stranglethorns is a circular skillshot that Zyra casts at a target location. It deals initial magic damage, then after a 2-second delay, it knocks up any enemies caught within the area, while critically also empowering any of Zyra's existing plants within the zone.
abilities.original_description:
Zyra summons a twisted thicket at her target location, dealing damage to enemies as it expands and knocking them airborne as it contracts. Plants within the thicket are enraged. Zyra summons the fury of nature, growing a twisted thicket that deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. After 2 seconds, the vines snap upwards, Knocking Up for {{ e1 }} second.

Zyra's plants within the thicket become enraged, resetting their duration, gaining {{ e2 }}% Health and Attacking for {{ plantdamagebonus }}% bonus damage.

abilities.name: Joy Unending
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Joy Unending (Passive)**

Nilah's passive is an **aura-based buff** that automatically triggers when she is near allied champions. It **enhances and shares healing and shielding** effects from allies, effectively making her allies' sustain grant her benefits too, while also providing a **passive experience gain bonus** from last-hitting minions nearby. This has both **defensive** (boosted healing/shielding) and **utility** (increased experience) applications.
abilities.original_description: Nilah gains increased experience from last-hitting minions along with the ability to enhance and share nearby healing and shielding from her allies.

abilities.name: Slipstream
abilities.mechanics_description: Slipstream is a **linear skillshot dash** that Nilah uses **offensively** to deal physical damage to enemies she passes through. She can target an enemy unit, including minions and monsters, causing her to dash *through* them to their location.
abilities.original_description: Nilah enthusiastically dashes toward her target, dealing damage to any enemies she passes through on the way. Nilah dashes through a unit, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ dashdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> to any enemies she passes through.

abilities.name: Formless Blade
abilities.mechanics_description: Nilah's Q, Formless Blade, is a **linear skillshot** that deals physical damage and briefly extends her auto-attack range. When it hits an enemy, it empowers her subsequent auto-attacks to hit in a **cone**, deal increased damage based on her crit chance, and grant her bonus attack speed, making it a core tool for both trading and wave clear.
abilities.original_description:
With a snap of her whip-blade, Nilah damages any enemies she hits in a straight line in her chosen direction. This action extends her attack range for a short duration. Passive: Nilah gains {{ critarmorpen }} Armor Penetration, and her Attacks against champions restore {{ critlifesteal }} damage dealt as Health. Overhealing from this is converted into a Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

Active: Nilah cracks her whip-blade, dealing {{ damagecalc }} physical damage, increased by her Critical Strike Chance. If an enemy unit or structure is hit, Nilah gains 125 Attack Range and {{ bonusattackspeedcalc }}% Attack Speed, and her Attacks hit in a cone as {{ attacktotaldamagetooltip }} physical damage for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Jubilant Veil
abilities.mechanics_description: Nilah's Jubilant Veil is a **self-cast ability** that grants her a temporary buff, making her **untargetable to attacks** and increasing her **movement speed**. She can also **transfer this effect to nearby allies** by touching them, making it a powerful tool for team engagement and survival.
abilities.original_description:
Nilah envelops herself in mist, increasing her movement speed and allowing her to gracefully dodge all incoming attacks. Any allies she touches during the mist's duration will also gain this effect. Nilah envelops herself in mist for {{ baseduration }} seconds, becoming Ghosted, gaining {{ movespeedpercent*100 }}% Move Speed, dodging Attacks, and reducing magic damage taken by {{ magicdamagereduction*100 }}%.

While active, touching allied champions envelops them in mist, granting the same benefits for {{ sharebaseduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Apotheosis
abilities.mechanics_description: Nilah's Apotheosis (R) is an **area-of-effect spellcast** initiated by Nilah. She deals pulsing physical damage around her for one second, followed by a final burst that **pulls enemies in**. It's used **offensively** for damage and crowd control, and **defensively** as it also heals Nilah and nearby allies based on the damage she deals, converting excess healing into a shield.
abilities.original_description:
Twirling her whip-blade in joyful exuberance, Nilah deals damage to enemies around her before pulling them closer with her weapon. Nilah whirls her whip-blade, dealing {{ damagepertickcalctooltip }} physical damage over 1 second, then finishes with a burst of {{ damagecalc }} physical damage that also Pulls nearby enemies toward her.

Nilah heals herself and nearby allies by {{ champhealingpercent }} (+{{ spell.nilahq:critlifesteal }} Formless Blade) of her damage dealt to enemy champions' Health ({{ otherhealingpercent*100 }}% for non-champions), converting any overhealing into a Shield for {{ duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Skaarl, the Cowardly Lizard
abilities.mechanics_description: Skaarl, Kled's passive, functions as a regenerating **mounted health bar** that Kled shares. When Skaarl's health is depleted, Kled is dismounted, losing access to his full kit and dealing reduced damage to champions until he can generate "Courage" by attacking enemies, which allows him to remount.
abilities.original_description:
Kled rides his trusty steed, Skaarl, who takes damage for him. When Skaarl's health depletes, Kled dismounts.

While dismounted, Kled's abilities change and he deals less damage to champions. Kled can restore Skaarl's courage by fighting enemies. At maximum courage, Kled remounts with a portion of Skaarl's health.

abilities.name: Bear Trap on a Rope
abilities.mechanics_description: "Bear Trap on a Rope" is a linear skillshot that damages the first enemy champion or large monster hit. If Kled remains tethered to the target for a short duration, he pulls them towards him, applying a slow and dealing bonus damage.
abilities.original_description:
Kled throws a bear trap that damages and hooks an enemy champion. If shackled for a short duration, the target takes additional physical damage and is yanked toward Kled.

When dismounted, this ability is replaced by Pocket Pistol, a ranged gun blast that knocks back Kled and restores courage. Mounted: Kled throws a bear trap that deals {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and hooks onto the first enemy champion or large jungle monster hit.

If Kled stays near a hooked enemy for {{ tetherpoptime }} seconds, he yanks out the trap, dealing {{ totalyankdamage }} physical damage, Pulling them, and Slowing by {{ slowamount*-100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Violent Tendencies
abilities.mechanics_description: Violent Tendencies is a passive ability that enhances Kled's next basic attack. Upon attacking, Kled gains a significant burst of attack speed for his subsequent four auto-attacks for a short duration. The fourth attack in this sequence deals bonus physical damage based on the target's maximum health, making it a strong tool for both sustained damage and finishing off targets.
abilities.original_description:
Kled gains massive attack speed for four attacks. The fourth attack deals more damage. Passive: Kled's next Attack grants {{ attackspeed*100 }}% Attack Speed for four Attacks or {{ activeduration }} seconds.

The fourth hit deals an additional {{ baseflatdamage }} plus {{ percentdamage }} max Health physical damage.

abilities.name: Chaaaaaaaarge!!!
abilities.mechanics_description: Kled's ultimate "Chaaaaaaaarge!!!" is a **linear skillshot dash** that sends Kled and Skaarl charging in a target direction. It is primarily used for **offensive engagement and utility**, allowing Kled to quickly close distances, grant allies a speed boost from his trail, and apply a knockback and significant damage to the first enemy champion hit.
abilities.original_description: Kled and Skaarl charge to a location, leaving a speed-granting trail behind them and gaining a shield. Skaarl locks onto and rams the first enemy champion encountered. Kled charges toward an area, leaving a trail that grants allies increasing <speed>Move Speed</speed>. While charging and for 2 seconds after Kled gains up to <shield>{{ maximumshield }} Shield</shield>. Skaarl rams the first enemy champion encountered, dealing <magicDamage>{{ minimumdamagetooltip }}</magicDamage> to <magicDamage>{{ maximumchargedamage }} max Health magic damage</magicDamage> (based on distance travelled) and briefly <status>Knocking Back</status>.

abilities.name: Jousting
abilities.mechanics_description: Kled's E, "Jousting," is a **two-part skillshot dash**. The first cast sends Kled forward, dealing damage and pulling minions/small monsters. If the first cast hits an **enemy champion or large monster**, Kled gains a speed boost and can recast the ability within a short window to dash **back through the same target**, dealing damage again. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and repositioning, but the ability to dash back can also offer defensive escape potential.
abilities.original_description:
Kled dashes, dealing physical damage and gaining a short burst of speed. Kled can cast this ability again to dash back through his initial target, dealing the same damage. Kled dashes, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to enemies he passes through, pulling minions and small monsters towards him.

If this Ability hits an enemy champion or large jungle monster, Kled gains {{ movespeed*100 }}% Move Speed for {{ movespeedduration }} second(s) and can Recast within {{ recastwindow }} seconds to dash back through the same target.

abilities.name: Reign of Anger
abilities.mechanics_description: Renekton's passive, Reign of Anger, is not a manually activated ability but rather a **resource generator** that passively accumulates by landing auto-attacks and abilities. This **Fury resource** is primarily used **offensively** to empower his other abilities with bonus effects, dealing more damage or providing additional utility, and is gained more rapidly at lower health.
abilities.original_description: Renekton's attacks generate Fury, increased when he is low on life. This Fury can empower his abilities with bonus effects.

abilities.name: Ruthless Predator
abilities.mechanics_description: **Ruthless Predator (W)** is a point-and-click ability that Renekton uses to deal damage and stun his target. At high Fury, it becomes empowered, dealing significantly more damage, destroying shields, and stunning for a longer duration.
abilities.original_description:
Renekton slashes his target twice, dealing moderate physical damage and stuns them for 0.75 seconds. If Renekton has more than 50 Fury, he slashes his target three times, destroying damage shields on the target, dealing high physical damage, and stunning them for 1.5 seconds. Renekton's next Attack strikes twice, Stunning for {{ stunduration }} seconds and dealing a total of {{ basictotaldamage }} physical damage. Hitting a champion generates an additional {{ bonusfuryvschamps }} Fury.

Fury Bonus: Renekton Attacks 3 times instead, destroying Shields before dealing {{ emptotaldamage }} physical damage and Stunning for {{ enragedstunduration }} seconds. Does not generate any Fury.

abilities.name: Cull the Meek
abilities.mechanics_description: Cull the Meek is an **AoE (area of effect) cleave** ability that Renekton uses by **swinging his blade around himself**. It deals damage to all targets in range and provides a heal based on damage dealt, which is significantly **empowered with bonus damage and healing at higher Fury levels**.
abilities.original_description:
Renekton swings his blade, dealing moderate physical damage to all targets around him, and heals for a small portion of the damage dealt. If he has more than 50 Fury, his damage and heal are increased. Renekton swings his blade, dealing {{ basicdamage }} physical damage and restoring {{ nonchamphealing }} Health per non-champion and {{ champhealing }} per champion hit. He also generates {{ minionfurygain }} Fury per non-champion and {{ championfurygain }} Fury per champion.

Fury Bonus: Damage is increased to {{ empdamage }} physical damage and healing is increased to {{ empnonchamphealing }} Health against non-champions and {{ empchamphealing }} Health against champions. Does not generate any Fury.

abilities.name: Dominus
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dominus (R):** This is an **auto-targeted, self-buffing ultimate** that Renekton activates on himself. It provides a **temporary health shield**, deals **aoe magic damage** around him, and grants **Fury over time**, making it a **combative ultimate** used for extended engagements and trading.
abilities.original_description: Renekton transforms into the Tyrant form, gaining bonus Health and dealing damage to enemies around him. While in this form, Renekton gains Fury periodically. Renekton surrounds himself with dark energies for {{ buffduration }} seconds, gaining <healing>{{ healthgain }} max Health</healing> and <keywordMajor>{{ furyoncast }} Fury</keywordMajor>. While active, he deals <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagepersecond }} magic damage</magicDamage> and gains <keywordMajor>{{ furypersecond }} Fury</keywordMajor> per second.

abilities.name: Slice and Dice
abilities.mechanics_description: "Slice and Dice" (E) is a two-part dash ability for Renekton. The first cast is a linear skillshot dash dealing damage and generating Fury. If Renekton hits at least one enemy, he can recast it within a short window for a second dash that deals bonus damage, shreds enemy Armor, and consumes Fury. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage, mobility, and to apply Armor shred, but can also be used defensively to reposition.
abilities.original_description:
Renekton dashes, dealing damage to units along the way. Empowered, Renekton deals bonus damage and reduces the Armor of units hit. Renekton dashes, dealing {{ basicdamage }} physical damage. He generates {{ minionragegeneration }} Fury per non-champion and {{ championragegeneration }} Fury per champion hit. Hitting at least one enemy allows Renekton to Recast this Ability once for {{ dicetimer }} seconds.

Fury Bonus: The Recast dash deals {{ empdamage }} physical damage instead and removes {{ enragedarmorshred }}% Armor for {{ shredtimer }} seconds. Does not generate Fury.

abilities.name: Mortal Will
abilities.mechanics_description: Pantheon's passive, **Mortal Will**, is an auto-target buff that empowers his *next* damaging ability after hitting 4 instances of auto-attacks or damaging spells on an enemy champion. This empowerment functions defensively by granting him a **block** that intercepts the next enemy attack or turret shot, and offensively by making his empowered ability deal **bonus damage**.
abilities.original_description: Every few spells or attacks, Pantheon's next spell is empowered.

abilities.name: Shield Vault
abilities.mechanics_description: Shield Vault is a **point-and-click dash that damages and stuns** a target enemy. It is primarily used **offensively for damage and engage, with the stun providing crucial crowd control**.
abilities.original_description:
Pantheon dashes to a target, damaging and stunning them. Pantheon leaps on his target, Stunning for {{ stunduration }} second and dealing {{ maxhealthdamagecalc }} max Health physical damage.

Mortal Will Bonus: Pantheon's next Attack strikes {{ empowerednumhits }} times, dealing a total of {{ empowereddamagemultcalcmodified }} physical damage.

abilities.name: Comet Spear
abilities.mechanics_description: **Comet Spear (Q)** is a **linear skillshot** that Pantheon can either **tap** to thrust his spear for moderate damage and significant cooldown refund against all enemies hit, or **hold** to hurl it, dealing high damage to the first target and reduced damage to subsequent enemies. It is primarily used **offensively** for sustained damage and burst, becoming an **execute** when enemies are below a health threshold, and is further empowered by his **Mortal Will** passive.
abilities.original_description:
Pantheon either thrusts his spear or throws his spear in the chosen direction. Tap: Pantheon thrusts his spear, dealing {{ tapdamagecalc }} physical damage to enemies hit. Refunds {{ tapcooldownrefund*100 }}% of this Ability's Cooldown.

Hold: Pantheon hurls his spear, dealing {{ holddamagecalc }} physical damage to the first enemy hit and {{ damagefalloff*100 }}% less to further targets.

This Ability is enhanced against enemies below {{ crithealththreshold*100 }}% Health to deal {{ executedamagecalcmodified }} physical damage instead.

Mortal Will Bonus: Deals an additional {{ empowereddamagecalc }} physical damage.

abilities.name: Aegis Assault
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Aegis Assault (E)**

*   **How to use:** Pantheon channels a forward-facing cone, becoming immune to damage from that direction and dealing damage over time with his spear. He can move slowly during this channel. At the end of the channel, he performs a final empowered shield bash.
*   **Usage:** Aegis Assault is a versatile tool used both offensively for sustained damage and defensively to block incoming projectiles. The empowered Mortal Will bonus provides significant defensive stats and a movement speed buff for repositioning or chasing.
abilities.original_description:
Pantheon sets his shield, becoming invulnerable to damage from the front and striking repeatedly with his spear. Pantheon braces his shield and engages enemies in a chosen direction for {{ shieldduration }} seconds, becoming immune to non-tower damage from that direction and dealing {{ damagecalc }} physical damage over the duration. After channeling Pantheon slams with his shield, dealing {{ shielddamagecalc }} physical damage.

Mortal Will Bonus: When Pantheon slams his shield he gains {{ resistscalc }} Armor and {{ resistscalc }} Magic Resist for {{ resistsduration }} seconds, and {{ speedamount*100 }}% Move Speed for {{ speedduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Grand Starfall
abilities.mechanics_description: **Grand Starfall (R)** is a **targeted skillshot** ability. Pantheon leaps into the air and then crashes down at a target location, dealing significant **magic damage** in a line upon landing, which can be used both **offensively** to execute enemies and **defensively** to escape or reposition. Enemies hit by the initial spear throw (which manifests as he leaps) are **slowed**.
abilities.original_description:
Pantheon composes himself and then leaps into the air, landing at a chosen location as a comet. Passive: Pantheon gains {{ armorpenetration*100 }}% Armor Penetration.

Active: Pantheon gathers his strength to leap high into the air. He throws his spear from above which in a small area deals {{ spell.pantheonq:holddamagecalc }} physical damage and Slows by {{ spearslow*100 }}% for {{ spearslowduration }} seconds.

Pantheon then crashes down as a meteor at the target area. Deals up to {{ damagecalc }} magic damage to enemies in a line (decreased by up to {{ edgedamagereduction*100 }}% at the edges of the area).

This Ability instantly readies Mortal Will.

abilities.name: Death in Lavender
abilities.mechanics_description: Death in Lavender is a passive ability for Bel'Veth. It enhances her sustained damage by permanently increasing her Attack Speed when she defeats large minions, monsters, or champions. Additionally, it grants a temporary burst of bonus Attack Speed after she uses any of her active abilities, rewarding aggressive ability weaving.
abilities.original_description: Bel'Veth gains permanent attack speed stacks after taking down large minions and monsters and champions. She also gains temporary bonus attack speed after using an ability.

abilities.name: Void Surge
abilities.mechanics_description: Void Surge is a **linear skillshot dash** that Bel'Veth uses offensively to deal physical damage to enemies passed through, and defensively by allowing her to reposition and dodge. Each of the four cardinal directions she can dash from has a separate cooldown that scales down with Attack Speed.
abilities.original_description:
Bel'Veth dashes in a chosen direction and damages all enemies she passes through. Bel'Veth dashes, dealing {{ basedamage }} physical damage to enemies she passes through.

Each direction has an unique Cooldown of {{ f1 }} seconds that scales down based on her Attack Speed.

abilities.name: Above and Below
abilities.mechanics_description: Above and Below is a circular AoE skillshot that Bel'Veth slams her tail down in. It deals magic damage, knocks up all enemies hit, and applies a decaying slow, while also refreshing the cooldown of her E (Void Surge) if a champion is hit.
abilities.original_description: Bel'Veth slams her tail to the ground, damaging, knocking up, and slowing her enemies. Bel'Veth slams her tail, dealing <magicDamage>{{ damage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, <status>Knocking Up</status> foes for {{ duration }} seconds, and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. If a champion is hit, this refreshes the Cooldown of <spellName>Void Surge</spellName> in that direction.

abilities.name: Royal Maelstrom
abilities.mechanics_description: Royal Maelstrom (E) is a **channeled self-buff** that Bel'Veth activates. While channeling, she gains significant lifesteal and damage reduction, and her attacks rapidly target the lowest-health enemy for damage that scales with the target's missing health. This ability is primarily used **offensively** to sustain through fights and quickly finish off weakened targets, but the damage reduction also offers a **defensive** component.
abilities.original_description:
Bel'Veth roots herself in place, channeling a storm of slashes around her that targets the lowest-health enemy and grants her lifesteal and damage reduction. Bel'Veth channels and slashes around herself, gaining {{ drpercent*100 }}% Damage Reduction, {{ totallifesteal }} Life Steal, and Attacking {{ f2.0 }} times over {{ totalduration }} seconds with the number of Attacks increasing based on her Attack Speed. Each Attack strikes the lowest-health enemy, dealing {{ damageperstrike }} to {{ maxdamageperstriketooltip }} physical damage based on the target's missing Health.

Using another Ability or Recasting ends this Ability early.

abilities.name: Endless Banquet
abilities.mechanics_description: Bel'Veth's ultimate, Endless Banquet, is a powerful transformation that's activated by consuming Void Coral remnants, which drop from champions and epic monsters. While the initial activation is a self-buff that grants significant stat bonuses and empowers her other abilities, the true strength comes from consuming Void Coral left by epic monsters like Baron Nashor or the Elder Dragon. Doing so extends the duration of her true form and allows her to summon Void Remora, which will swarm and deal damage to enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Bel'Veth consumes Void coral remnants, transforming into her true form and increasing her max health, attack range, attack speed, and out-of-combat move speed. Consuming the Void coral remnants of a Void epic monster will grant her a longer ultimate duration, as well as the power to summon Void remora. Passive: Every second Attack against the same target deals an additional {{ finalonhitdamage }} true damage, stacking infinitely. Takedowns against champions and epic monsters leave behind a piece of Void Coral.

Active: Consuming Void Coral grants {{ passivestacksondevour }} Lavender stack and activates Bel'Veth's true form for {{ steroidduration }} seconds. Void Coral from Void epic monsters increases the duration to {{ voidduration }} seconds and causes minions that die nearby to become Void Remora. While casting, Bel'Veth Slows nearby enemies before exploding, dealing {{ totalexplosiondamage }} + {{ missinghealthdamage*100 }}% missing-Health true damage.

In her true form, Bel'Veth gains {{ maxhealthondevour }} max Health, {{ oocms }} Move Speed out of combat, {{ bonusaarange }} Attack range, {{ totalasmod*100 }}% Total Attack Speed, and Void Surge can pass through walls.

abilities.name: Reap
abilities.mechanics_description: **Reap (E)** is a **linear skillshot** that Fiddlesticks fires in front of him. It deals magic damage and slows all enemies hit. Enemies caught in the **center of the slash** are also silenced. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for damage and crowd control (slow and silence), allowing Fiddlesticks to chase or lock down targets.
abilities.original_description: Fiddlesticks slashes an area with its scythe, slowing all enemies hit and silencing enemies hit in the center of the slash. Fiddlesticks unleashes dark magic, dealing <magicDamage>{{ damage }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> by {{ slowamount*-100 }}% for {{ silenceduration }} seconds. Enemies in the center are also <status>Silenced</status> for the duration.

abilities.name: Bountiful Harvest
abilities.mechanics_description: **Bountiful Harvest (W):** Bountiful Harvest is a channeled Area of Effect (AoE) drain that deals magic damage over time to all enemies within range of Fiddlesticks. It also heals him for a percentage of the damage dealt and applies bonus execute damage based on missing health at the end of the channel. If Fiddlesticks completes the full channel without being interrupted, the ability's cooldown is significantly reduced.
abilities.original_description:
Fiddlesticks drains health from nearby enemies, dealing bonus execute damage at the end of the duration. Fiddlesticks channels and drains the souls of nearby enemies, dealing {{ draindamagecalc }} magic damage per second for 2 seconds, plus {{ percentfortooltip }}% missing Health magic damage at the end. Fiddlesticks restores {{ vamppercentage }}% of damage as Health.

If Fiddlesticks ends the channel without interruption, the remaining Cooldown is reduced by 60%.

abilities.name: Terrify
abilities.mechanics_description: Fiddlesticks' Terrify is a point-and-click ability that can be **used offensively** to CC enemies with a Fear, forcing them to flee. Its passive allows Fiddlesticks to apply Fear from stealth or via Effigies, while its active also deals damage based on the target's current health, with a bonus if the target was recently Feared.
abilities.original_description:
Fiddlesticks damaging enemies with spells while unseen or targeting an enemy with Terrify's activation strikes a target unit with fear, causing it to flee in terror for a duration. Passive: While unseen and out of combat or impersonating an Effigy, damaging an enemy with an ability Fears them for {{ fearduration }} second(s).

Active: Fear an enemy for {{ fearduration }} second(s) and deal {{ totalpercenthealthdamage }} current Health magic damage. If the target has recently been Feared by Fiddlesticks, instead deal {{ totalpercenthealthdamagefeared }} current Health magic damage.

abilities.name: A Harmless Scarecrow
abilities.mechanics_description: A Harmless Scarecrow is a **passive replacement for Fiddlesticks' trinket**. He can place these **Scarecrow Effigies** by casting the ability, which acts similarly to placing a ward. When an enemy champion gets **close to an Effigy**, it **activates its passive effect, Fear**, but Fiddlesticks himself **does not gain vision** from them.
abilities.original_description: Fiddlesticks' trinket is replaced by scarecrow effigies.

abilities.name: Crowstorm
abilities.mechanics_description: Crowstorm is a channeled AoE ultimate where Fiddlesticks channels for a short duration, then teleports to a target location and unleashes waves of crows for several seconds. This ability is primarily used offensively for high AoE damage and execution, but also functions defensively by allowing Fiddlesticks to reposition quickly and turn invisible during the channel for potential escapes or surprise engagements.
abilities.original_description: A murder of crows flock wildly around Fiddlesticks, dealing damage per second to all enemy units in the area. Fiddlesticks channels for {{ channeltime }} seconds, then teleports and unleashes a murder of crows, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> over {{ duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Undertow
abilities.mechanics_description: **Undertow (Q):** This is a linear skillshot that Olaf throws forward. It deals damage, reduces enemy armor, and slows them. Picking up the thrown axe refunds a significant portion of its cooldown, incentivizing aggressive axe recovery for sustained offense.
abilities.original_description:
Olaf throws an axe into the ground at a target location, dealing damage to enemies it passes through and reducing their Armor and Move Speed. If Olaf picks up the axe, the ability's cooldown is reset. Olaf throws an axe, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and Slowing by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for up to {{ e3 }} seconds (based on distance travelled). Champions hit lose {{ shredamount*100 }}% Armor for {{ debuffduration }} seconds.

If Olaf picks up the axe, this Ability's Cooldown is reduced to {{ tooltipcdrefund }} seconds, or fully refunded if {{ tooltipcdrefund }} seconds has elapsed.

abilities.name: Berserker Rage
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Berserker Rage (Passive)**

*   **How to hit/use:** This is a passive ability and has no user input. It is always active.
*   **How it is used:** This ability is used both offensively and defensively. It provides a significant offensive buff by granting bonus attack speed and healing (Life Steal) as Olaf loses health, making him stronger and more survivable in extended fights when he is low on health.

**Mechanics & Usage:** Olaf's Berserker Rage passively grants him increasing Attack Speed and Life Steal as his Health decreases. This incentivizes Olaf to fight while low on health, turning his vulnerability into a potent offensive and sustain tool for aggressive engagements.
abilities.original_description: Olaf gains Attack Speed and Life Steal based on his missing Health.

abilities.name: Tough It Out
abilities.mechanics_description: Tough It Out (W) is an **auto-target** ability that Olaf uses **defensively** to gain a temporary shield based on his missing health, and **offensively** to significantly boost his attack speed for a short duration. It's a crucial tool for both trading damage and surviving extended fights.
abilities.original_description: Olaf's Attack Speed is increased and he gains a Shield. Olaf gains <attackSpeed>{{ attackspeed*100 }}% Attack Speed</attackSpeed> for {{ duration }} seconds, and <shield>{{ baseshield }} plus {{ shieldpercmissinghp*100 }}% missing Health Shield (up to a maximum of {{ maxshieldcalc }} Shield below {{ thresholdformax*100 }}% Health)</shield> for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Ragnarok
abilities.mechanics_description: Ragnarok is an **activated buff** with a passive component. When activated, Olaf **cleanses all crowd control** and becomes **immune to disables** for a duration, gaining bonus AD and move speed towards enemy champions. Attacking champions or hitting them with Reckless Swing **extends the duration** of the buff.
abilities.original_description:
Olaf passively gains increased armor and magic resist. He can activate this ability to become immune to disables for as long as he keeps attacking. Passive: Olaf gains {{ resists }} Armor and {{ resists }} Magic Resist.

Active: Olaf cleanses all Immobilizing and Disabling effects on himself and becomes immune to them for {{ duration }} seconds. While active, Olaf gains {{ ad }} Attack Damage. Hitting a champion with an Attack or Reckless Swing extends the duration by {{ durationextension }} seconds.

Additionally, Olaf gains {{ haste*100 }}% Move Speed towards enemy champions for {{ hasteduration }} second.

abilities.name: Reckless Swing
abilities.mechanics_description: Reckless Swing is a **point-and-click** ability that deals **true damage** to a target and a smaller amount of **self-true damage**. It is primarily used **offensively** for burst damage, and its primary utility comes from its ability to refund its health cost if the target dies, allowing for extended trading patterns.
abilities.original_description:
Olaf attacks with such force that it deals true damage to his target and himself, refunding the Health cost if he destroys the target. Olaf ferociously swings his axes, dealing {{ totaldamage }} true damage. If the enemy dies, the cost is refunded.

Attacks lower the Cooldown of this Ability by 1 second, increased to 2 seconds when attacking monsters.

abilities.name: Fey Feathers
abilities.mechanics_description: **Fey Feathers (Passive):** Auto-target. Rakan periodically gains a decaying shield, which can be triggered by damaging an enemy champion or large monster. This shield is primarily defensive, offering protection and survivability in skirmishes and trades.
abilities.original_description: Rakan periodically gains a shield.

abilities.name: Gleaming Quill
abilities.mechanics_description:
**1. How to hit/use:** This is a **linear skillshot** that travels a set distance.

**2. How it is used:** Gleaming Quill is primarily used for **utility**, as it deals minor magic damage to the first enemy hit. Its main purpose is to **heal Rakan and nearby allies** if it strikes a champion or epic monster, providing a delayed or touch-activated heal.
abilities.original_description:
Flings a magical feather that deals magic damage. Striking a champion or epic monster enables Rakan to heal his allies. Rakan flings a magical feather that deals {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the first enemy hit.

If the feather hits a champion or epic jungle monster, Rakan restores {{ totalheal }} Health to himself and nearby allies after {{ healdelay }} seconds or when he touches an allied champion.

abilities.name: Battle Dance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Battle Dance (E):** A targeted dash that can be cast on any allied champion to reach them and grant a shield. It can be recast once within a short window to dash to a different allied champion, allowing for quick repositioning or multiple shields.
abilities.original_description:
Flies to an allied champion granting them a shield. Can be re-cast for free for a short duration. Rakan dashes to an allied champion, granting them {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ e3 }} seconds.

Rakan can Recast this Ability once within {{ e2 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Grand Entrance
abilities.mechanics_description: **Grand Entrance (W):** Rakan performs a short-range dash, dealing magic damage and knocking up all enemies hit at his arrival point. This is a linear skillshot dash that is used offensively to initiate fights, disrupt enemy positioning with crowd control, and deal damage.
abilities.original_description: Dashes to a location, knocking up nearby enemies on arrival. Rakan dashes, then spirals into the air, <status>Knocking Up</status> for {{ knockupduration }} second and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: The Quickness
abilities.mechanics_description: Rakan's ultimate, The Quickness, is a **linear skillshot dash** that grants him bonus movement speed. Upon activation, Rakan dashes forward, dealing magic damage and **charming** the first enemy champion he touches, and subsequently charming any other enemies he passes through during the dash. It's primarily used offensively for **engaging fights, catching out targets, and applying crowd control**, with the bonus movement speed also offering a slight defensive repositioning tool.
abilities.original_description: Gains Move Speed, charming and dealing magic damage to enemies touched. Rakan gains <speed>{{ e5 }}% Move Speed</speed> for {{ e2 }} seconds. Rakan deals <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Charms</status> enemies for {{ e3 }} second(s) the first time he touches them. The first champion touched grants Rakan <speed>{{ e6 }}% decaying Move Speed</speed>.

abilities.name: Super Scorcher Breath
abilities.mechanics_description: Super Scorcher Breath is a linear skillshot that deals damage to enemies in a narrow cone. It's primarily offensive, dealing escalating damage and gaining powerful area-of-effect, execute, or burn effects as Smolder gains stacks of Dragon Practice.
abilities.original_description:
Smolder breathes fire on an enemy. As he gains more stacks, this ability becomes more powerful. Smolder belches flame, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage + {{ spell.smolderp:passive_qdamageincrease }} magic damage. If the target dies, Smolder refunds {{ manarestore }} Mana, once per cast.

Based on stacks of Dragon Practice, this Ability evolves to gain the following effects:
  • {{ stacktier1 }} Stacks: Damages all enemies surrounding the target.
  • {{ stacktier2 }} Stacks: Sends {{ tier2_numberofblowback }} explosions beyond the target that deal {{ tier2_blowbackpercentagedamage }}% of this Ability's damage.
  • {{ stacktier3 }} Stacks: Burns the target, dealing {{ tier3_burn }} max Health true damage over {{ tier3_dotlength }} seconds. Enemy champions that drop below {{ tier3_executethreshold }} total health while burning are killed instantly.

abilities.name: Flap, Flap, Flap
abilities.mechanics_description: "Flap, Flap, Flap" is a targeted ability where Smolder flies a short distance, becoming untargetable and ignoring terrain. During this flight, he rapidly bombards the lowest health enemy champion, dealing sustained physical and magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Smolder takes flight ignoring terrain and bombarding the lowest health enemy. Smolder takes flight, gaining {{ movespeed*100 }}% Move Speed and ignoring terrain for {{ duration }} seconds.

While flying, Smolder bombards the lowest Health enemy {{ totalnumberofattacks }} (rounded down) times for {{ damageperhit }} physical damage + {{ spell.smolderp:ebonusdamage }} magic damage per hit.

abilities.name: MMOOOMMMM!
abilities.mechanics_description: MMOOOMMMM! (R) is a linear skillshot. It is primarily used offensively to deal significant damage, especially to enemies clumped in the center for bonus true damage and a strong slow, while also providing Smolder with a defensive heal.
abilities.original_description:
Smolder calls his mom to breath fire from above, dealing extra damage and slowing enemies in the center of her fire. Smolder's mom breathes fire from above, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. Enemies in the center take {{ tooltiponly_totalsweetspotdamage }} physical damage instead and are Slowed by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

Smolder's mom heals her son for {{ momhealcalc }} Health if she hits him.

abilities.name: Dragon Practice
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Dragon Practice (Passive)**

Dragon Practice is a passive ability that Smolder gains stacks from hitting champions with his abilities and by killing enemies with his ultimate, Super Scorcher Breath. Each stack permanently **empowers** one of Smolder's basic abilities, **increasing its damage and adding bonus effects** as he reaches specific thresholds. This passive is **auto-target and enhances his offensive capabilities over time.**
abilities.original_description: Hitting champions with Abilities and killing enemies with Super Scorcher Breath grants a stack of Dragon Practice. Stacks increase the damage of Smolders basic Abilities.

abilities.name: Achooo!
abilities.mechanics_description: Achooo! (W) is a **linear skillshot** that deals damage and applies a slow to enemies hit. When the sneeze *explodes* by hitting an enemy champion, it deals additional damage in an area around them, making it a tool for **both single-target burst and area-of-effect damage**.
abilities.original_description:
Smolder lets out an adorable flaming sneeze that explodes when hitting enemy champions. Smolder lets out an adorable flaming sneeze, dealing {{ initialdamage }} physical damage and Slowing by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

Hitting champions causes an explosion, dealing {{ explosiondamage }} physical + {{ spell.smolderp:passive_wdamageincrease }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Harrier
abilities.mechanics_description: **Harrier (Passive):** Quinn's auto-attacks and abilities mark enemies as "Vulnerable". Her next auto-attack against a Vulnerable target will automatically target them from range and deal bonus physical damage. This passive is primarily used offensively for extra damage.
abilities.original_description: Valor, Quinn's Demacian eagle, periodically marks enemies as <font color='#FFF673'>Vulnerable</font>. Quinn's first basic attack against <font color='#FFF673'>Vulnerable</font> targets will deal bonus physical damage.

abilities.name: Blinding Assault
abilities.mechanics_description: Blinding Assault is a linear skillshot. It marks the first enemy hit with Vulnerable, blurs their vision, and deals damage in a small area around them. If the target isn't a champion, they are also Disarmed.
abilities.original_description:
Quinn calls Valor to mark an enemy and hinder its vision before damaging all enemies in the immediate area. Quinn orders Valor to dive, making the first enemy hit Vulnerable, reducing their vision radius for {{ e3 }} seconds and dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to all surrounding enemies.

If the first enemy struck is not a champion, it is Disarmed for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Heightened Senses
abilities.mechanics_description: **Heightened Senses (W) is a targeted reveal ability.** Quinn can activate this ability to have Valor reveal a large circular area around her for a short duration. This is primarily used for utility, checking bushes, scouting objectives, or tracking enemy movements, rather than direct damage or defense.
abilities.original_description:
Passively grants Quinn Attack Speed and Move Speed after she attacks a Vulnerable target. Activate to have Valor reveal a large area nearby. Passive: Attacking a Vulnerable target grants Quinn {{ attackspeedbonus*100 }}% Attack Speed and {{ e3 }}% Move Speed for {{ e1 }} seconds.

Active: Valor reveals a large area nearby for {{ e5 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Behind Enemy Lines
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Behind Enemy Lines (R) - Quinn**

**Mechanics:**
*   **Type:** Channeling, then recastable with an auto-targeting effect.
*   **Activation:** Quinn channels for 2 seconds, gaining significant bonus movement speed. Following this, she can recast the ability.
*   **Recast Trigger:** The ability automatically recasts (ends the channel) upon attacking, using her Q (Blinding Assault), or her E (Vault).
*   **Recast Effect:** Quinn and Valor perform an aerial maneuver, dealing physical damage in a small radius around Quinn and marking any enemy champions hit as Vulnerable.

**Usage:**
*   **Primary Use:** A powerful mobility and engagement tool. The initial channel allows Quinn to rapidly reposition across the map, especially for flanking or escaping.
*   **Secondary Use:** The recast provides a burst of damage and applies a crucial debuff (Vulnerable) to champions, amplifying all subsequent damage taken by the target. This makes it excellent for initiating fights or finishing off targets.

**Concise Description:**
Quinn channels to gain immense movement speed, allowing rapid repositioning across the map. Recasting the ability ends the channel, dealing damage in an area and marking enemy champions as Vulnerable, significantly amplifying damage taken.
abilities.original_description:
Quinn and Valor team up to fly around at great speed. Ending the ability casts Skystrike, which deals damage to nearby enemies and marks champions as Vulnerable. Quinn calls to Valor, pairing up after channeling for 2 seconds gaining {{ movementspeedmod*100 }}% Move Speed and allowing her to Recast this Ability. Attacking or using Blinding Assault or Vault automatically Recasts this Ability.

Recast: Quinn and Valor perform an aerial maneuver, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage, marking champions as Vulnerable, and ending this Ability.

abilities.name: Vault
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Vault (E)** is a **point-and-click dash** that allows Quinn to quickly close the distance to an enemy. It deals physical damage and applies a 'Vulnerable' mark, increasing subsequent damage to the target. After damaging and slowing the enemy, Quinn **leaps backwards**, creating space for herself and peeling the target away from her.

**Mechanics and Usage:**

*   **Point-and-Click Dash:** Quinn targets an enemy champion, minion, or monster, and automatically dashes to them.
*   **Damage and Debuff:** Deals physical damage and applies the "Vulnerable" debuff, which increases incoming damage from Quinn and Valor.
*   **Crowd Control:** Jumps back from the target, briefly interrupting their actions and knocking them back slightly. Also applies a slow that decays over time.
*   **Utility/Offensive Hybrid:** Primarily used offensively to engage, stick to targets, and set up further damage. Its defensive aspect comes from the knockback and slow, which can be used to disengage or create space.

**Concise Description:**

Quinn's Vault is a point-and-click dash that damages and marks an enemy as Vulnerable, before she leaps backward, briefly interrupting and slowing them to create distance. This ability serves as both a potent offensive tool for closing gaps and initiating trades, and a defensive utility for peeling and repositioning.
abilities.original_description: Quinn dashes to an enemy, dealing physical damage and slowing the target's Move Speed. Upon reaching the target, she leaps off the target, briefly interrupting it, and lands near her maximum Attack Range away from the target. Quinn dashes to an enemy, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and marking them <keywordMajor>Vulnerable</keywordMajor>. Quinn then leaps backwards from the target, slightly <status>Knocking</status> them <status>Back</status> and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ e1 }}%, decaying over {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Clockwork Windup
abilities.mechanics_description: Clockwork Windup is an auto-target passive that deals bonus magic damage to a target after being hit by Orianna's auto-attacks or abilities. This damage increases with each subsequent hit on the same target, rewarding sustained aggression and focused damage output.
abilities.original_description: Orianna's Attacks deal additional magic damage. This damage increases the more Orianna Attacks the same target.

abilities.name: Command: Dissonance
abilities.mechanics_description: Command: Dissonance is a circular skillshot centered on your Ball. It deals magic damage to enemies hit, and the Ball leaves behind a field that slows enemies and grants allies a decaying movement speed buff.
abilities.original_description:
Orianna commands her Ball to release a pulse of energy, dealing magic damage around it. This leaves a field behind that speeds up allies and slows enemies. Orianna commands her Ball to release an electric pulse, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to surrounding enemies.

The pulse leaves behind an energy field for {{ fieldduration }} seconds, Slowing enemies by {{ slowamount*100 }}% and granting allies {{ hasteamount*100 }}% Move Speed, decaying over {{ slowandhasteduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Command: Attack
abilities.mechanics_description: Command: Attack is a **skillshot** ability where Orianna directs her Ball to a target location. It deals magic damage to enemies it passes through, with reduced damage to subsequent targets, and leaves the Ball at the destination. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for damage and to reposition the Ball for future abilities, but can also be used **defensively** to create distance or zone enemies.
abilities.original_description: Orianna commands her Ball to fire toward a target location, dealing magic damage to targets along the way (deals less damage to subsequent targets). Her Ball remains at the target location after. Orianna commands her <keywordMajor>Ball</keywordMajor> to move to an area, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage</magicDamage> to surrounding enemies and to enemies it passes through. Deals {{ e2 }}% less damage to all enemies after the first.

abilities.name: Command: Protect
abilities.mechanics_description: **Command: Protect (E)** is a **targeted skillshot** that Orianna sends her Ball towards an allied champion. It grants a shield, and the Ball also provides a persistent Armor and Magic Resist buff to the allied champion. Enemies the Ball passes through on its way to the target will take magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Orianna commands her Ball to attach to an allied champion, Shielding them and dealing magic damage to any enemies it passes through on the way. Additionally, the Ball grants additional Armor and Magic Resist to the champion it is attached to.
